content_old: 6 And he maketh them to skip like a calf, Lebanon and Sirion like a young buffalo.

content: 7 The voice of Jehovah cleaveth out flames of fire.
content_old: 7 The voice of Jehovah cleaveth out flames of fire.

content: 8 The voice of Jehovah shaketh the wilderness; Jehovah shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh.
content_old: 8 The voice of Jehovah shaketh the wilderness; Jehovah shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh.

content: 9 The voice of Jehovah maketh the hinds to calve, and layeth bare the forests; and in his temple doth every one say, Glory!
content_old: 9 The voice of Jehovah maketh the hinds to calve, and layeth bare the forests; and in his temple doth every one say, Glory!

content: 10 Jehovah sitteth upon the flood; yea, Jehovah sitteth as king for ever.
content_old: 10 Jehovah sitteth upon the flood; yea, Jehovah sitteth as king for ever.

content: A Psalm of David: dedication-song of the house.
content_old: A Psalm of David: dedication-song of the house.

content: 1 I will extol thee, Jehovah; for thou hast delivered me, and hast not made mine enemies to rejoice over me.
content_old: 1 I will extol thee, Jehovah; for thou hast delivered me, and hast not made mine enemies to rejoice over me.

content: 2 Jehovah my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
content_old: 2 Jehovah my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.

content: 3 Jehovah, thou hast brought up my soul from Sheol, thou hast quickened me from among those that go down to the pit.
content_old: 3 Jehovah, thou hast brought up my soul from Sheol, thou hast quickened me from among those that go down to the pit.

content: 4 Sing psalms unto Jehovah, ye saints of his, and give thanks in remembrance of his holiness.
content_old: 4 Sing psalms unto Jehovah, ye saints of his, and give thanks in remembrance of his holiness.

content: 5 For a moment is passed in his anger, a life in his favour; at even weeping cometh for the night, and at morn there is rejoicing.
content_old: 5 For a moment is passed in his anger, a life in his favour; at even weeping cometh for the night, and at morn there is rejoicing.

content: 6 As for me, I said in my prosperity, I shall never be moved.
content_old: 6 As for me, I said in my prosperity, I shall never be moved.

content: 7 Jehovah, by thy favour thou hadst made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face; I was troubled.
content_old: 7 Jehovah, by thy favour thou hadst made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face; I was troubled.

content: 8 I called to thee, Jehovah, and unto the Lord did I make supplication:
content_old: 8 I called to thee, Jehovah, and unto the Lord did I make supplication:

content: 9 What profit is there in my blood, in my going down to the pit? shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?
content_old: 9 What profit is there in my blood, in my going down to the pit? shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

content: 10 Hear, O Jehovah, and be gracious unto me; Jehovah, be my helper.
content_old: 10 Hear, O Jehovah, and be gracious unto me; Jehovah, be my helper.

content: 11 Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing; thou hast loosed my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;
content_old: 11 Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing; thou hast loosed my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;

content: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.

content: 1 In thee, Jehovah, do I trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.
content_old: 1 In thee, Jehovah, do I trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.

content: 2 Incline thine ear to me, deliver me speedily; be a strong rock to me, a house of defence to save me.
content_old: 2 Incline thine ear to me, deliver me speedily; be a strong rock to me, a house of defence to save me.

content: 3 For thou art my rock and my fortress; and, for thy name’s sake, thou wilt lead me and guide me.
content_old: 3 For thou art my rock and my fortress; and, for thy name’s sake, thou wilt lead me and guide me.

content: 4 Draw me out of the net that they have hidden for me; for thou art my strength.
content_old: 4 Draw me out of the net that they have hidden for me; for thou art my strength.

content: 5 Into thy hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, Jehovah, thou •God of truth.
content_old: 5 Into thy hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, Jehovah, thou •God of truth.

content: 6 I have hated them that observe lying vanities; and as for me, I have confided in Jehovah.
content_old: 6 I have hated them that observe lying vanities; and as for me, I have confided in Jehovah.

content: 7 I will be glad and rejoice in thy loving-kindness, for thou hast seen mine affliction; thou hast known the troubles of my soul,
content_old: 7 I will be glad and rejoice in thy loving-kindness, for thou hast seen mine affliction; thou hast known the troubles of my soul,

content: 8 And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large place.
content_old: 8 And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large place.

content: 9 Be gracious unto me, Jehovah, for I am in trouble: mine eye wasteth away with vexation, my soul and my belly.
content_old: 9 Be gracious unto me, Jehovah, for I am in trouble: mine eye wasteth away with vexation, my soul and my belly.

content: 10 For my life is spent with sorrow, and my years with sighing; my strength faileth through mine iniquity, and my bones are wasted.
content_old: 10 For my life is spent with sorrow, and my years with sighing; my strength faileth through mine iniquity, and my bones are wasted.

content: 11 More than to all mine oppressors, I am become exceedingly a reproach, even to my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that see me without flee from me.
content_old: 11 More than to all mine oppressors, I am become exceedingly a reproach, even to my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that see me without flee from me.

content: 12 I am forgotten in their heart as a dead man; I am become like a broken vessel.
content_old: 12 I am forgotten in their heart as a dead man; I am become like a broken vessel.

content: 13 For I have heard the slander of many—terror on every side—when they take counsel together against me: they plot to take away my life.
content_old: 13 For I have heard the slander of many—terror on every side—when they take counsel together against me: they plot to take away my life.

content: 14 But I confided in thee, Jehovah; I said, thou art my God.
content_old: 14 But I confided in thee, Jehovah; I said, thou art my God.

content: 15 My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from my persecutors.
content_old: 15 My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from my persecutors.

content: 16 Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; save me in thy loving-kindness.
content_old: 16 Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; save me in thy loving-kindness.

content: 17 Jehovah, let me not be ashamed; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, let them be silent in Sheol.
content_old: 17 Jehovah, let me not be ashamed; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, let them be silent in Sheol.

content: 18 Let the lying lips become dumb, which speak insolently against the righteous in pride and contempt.
content_old: 18 Let the lying lips become dumb, which speak insolently against the righteous in pride and contempt.

content: 19 Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee, which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee, before the sons of men!
content_old: 19 Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee, which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee, before the sons of men!

content: 20 Thou keepest them concealed in the secret of thy presence from the conspiracies of man; thou hidest them in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.
content_old: 20 Thou keepest them concealed in the secret of thy presence from the conspiracies of man; thou hidest them in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.

content: 21 Blessed be Jehovah; for he hath shewn me wondrously his loving-kindness in a strong city.
content_old: 21 Blessed be Jehovah; for he hath shewn me wondrously his loving-kindness in a strong city.

content: 22 As for me, I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes; nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
content_old: 22 As for me, I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes; nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.

content: 23 Love Jehovah, all ye his saints. Jehovah preserveth the faithful, and plentifully requiteth the proud doer.
content_old: 23 Love Jehovah, all ye his saints. Jehovah preserveth the faithful, and plentifully requiteth the proud doer.

content: Of David. Instruction.
content_old: Of David. Instruction.

content: 1 Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered!
content_old: 1 Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered!

content: 2 Blessed is the man unto whom Jehovah reckoneth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile!
content_old: 2 Blessed is the man unto whom Jehovah reckoneth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile!

content: 3 When I kept silence, my bones waxed old, through my groaning all the day long.
content_old: 3 When I kept silence, my bones waxed old, through my groaning all the day long.

content: 4 For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me; my moisture was turned into the drought of summer. Selah.
content_old: 4 For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me; my moisture was turned into the drought of summer. Selah.

content: 5 I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity I covered not; I said, I will confess my transgressions unto Jehovah, and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
content_old: 5 I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity I covered not; I said, I will confess my transgressions unto Jehovah, and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.

content: 6 For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee at a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they will not reach him.
content_old: 6 For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee at a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they will not reach him.

content: 7 Thou art a hiding-place for me; thou preservest me from trouble; thou dost encompass me with songs of deliverance. Selah.
content_old: 7 Thou art a hiding-place for me; thou preservest me from trouble; thou dost encompass me with songs of deliverance. Selah.

content: 8 I will instruct thee and teach thee the way in which thou shalt go; I will counsel thee with mine eye upon thee.
content_old: 8 I will instruct thee and teach thee the way in which thou shalt go; I will counsel thee with mine eye upon thee.

content: 9 Be ye not as a horse, as a mule, which have no understanding: whose trappings must be bit and bridle, for restraint, or they will not come unto thee.
content_old: 9 Be ye not as a horse, as a mule, which have no understanding: whose trappings must be bit and bridle, for restraint, or they will not come unto thee.

content: 10 Many sorrows hath the wicked; but he that confideth in Jehovah, loving-kindness shall encompass him.
content_old: 10 Many sorrows hath the wicked; but he that confideth in Jehovah, loving-kindness shall encompass him.

content: 1 Exult, ye righteous, in Jehovah: praise is comely for the upright.
content_old: 1 Exult, ye righteous, in Jehovah: praise is comely for the upright.

content: 2 Give thanks unto Jehovah with the harp; sing psalms unto him with the ten-stringed lute.
content_old: 2 Give thanks unto Jehovah with the harp; sing psalms unto him with the ten-stringed lute.

content: 3 Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud sound.
content_old: 3 Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud sound.

content: 4 For the word of Jehovah is right, and all his work is in faithfulness.
content_old: 4 For the word of Jehovah is right, and all his work is in faithfulness.

content: 5 He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the loving-kindness of Jehovah.
content_old: 5 He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the loving-kindness of Jehovah.

content: 6 By the word of Jehovah were the heavens made, and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
content_old: 6 By the word of Jehovah were the heavens made, and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.

content: 7 He gathereth the waters of the sea together as a heap; he layeth up the deeps in storehouses.
content_old: 7 He gathereth the waters of the sea together as a heap; he layeth up the deeps in storehouses.

content: 8 Let all the earth fear Jehovah; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
content_old: 8 Let all the earth fear Jehovah; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.

content: 9 For he spoke, and it was done; he commanded, and it stood fast.
content_old: 9 For he spoke, and it was done; he commanded, and it stood fast.

content: 10 Jehovah frustrateth the counsel of the nations; he maketh the thoughts of the peoples of none effect.
content_old: 10 Jehovah frustrateth the counsel of the nations; he maketh the thoughts of the peoples of none effect.

content: 11 The counsel of Jehovah standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.
content_old: 11 The counsel of Jehovah standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.

content: 12 Blessed is the nation whose God is Jehovah, the people that he hath chosen for his inheritance!
content_old: 12 Blessed is the nation whose God is Jehovah, the people that he hath chosen for his inheritance!

content: 13 Jehovah looketh from the heavens; he beholdeth all the sons of men:
content_old: 13 Jehovah looketh from the heavens; he beholdeth all the sons of men:

content: 14 From the place of his habitation he looketh forth upon all the inhabitants of the earth;
content_old: 14 From the place of his habitation he looketh forth upon all the inhabitants of the earth;

content: 15 He who fashioneth the hearts of them all, who considereth all their works.
content_old: 15 He who fashioneth the hearts of them all, who considereth all their works.

content: 16 The king is not saved by the multitude of his forces; a mighty man is not delivered by much strength.
content_old: 16 The king is not saved by the multitude of his forces; a mighty man is not delivered by much strength.

content: 17 The horse is a vain thing for safety; neither doth he deliver by his great power.
content_old: 17 The horse is a vain thing for safety; neither doth he deliver by his great power.

content: 18 Behold, the eye of Jehovah is upon them that fear him, upon them that hope in his loving-kindness,
content_old: 18 Behold, the eye of Jehovah is upon them that fear him, upon them that hope in his loving-kindness,

content: 19 To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.
content_old: 19 To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.

content: 20 Our soul waiteth for Jehovah: he is our help and our shield.
content_old: 20 Our soul waiteth for Jehovah: he is our help and our shield.

content: 21 For in him shall our heart rejoice, because we have confided in his holy name.
content_old: 21 For in him shall our heart rejoice, because we have confided in his holy name.

content: A Psalm of David; when he changed his behaviour before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he departed.
content_old: A Psalm of David; when he changed his behaviour before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he departed.

content: 1 I will bless Jehovah at all times; his praise shall continually be in my mouth.
content_old: 1 I will bless Jehovah at all times; his praise shall continually be in my mouth.

content: 2 My soul shall make its boast in Jehovah: the meek shall hear, and rejoice.
content_old: 2 My soul shall make its boast in Jehovah: the meek shall hear, and rejoice.

content: 3 Magnify Jehovah with me, and let us exalt his name together.
content_old: 3 Magnify Jehovah with me, and let us exalt his name together.

content: 4 I sought Jehovah, and he answered me, and delivered me from all my fears.
content_old: 4 I sought Jehovah, and he answered me, and delivered me from all my fears.

content: 5 They looked unto him, and were enlightened, and their faces were not confounded.
content_old: 5 They looked unto him, and were enlightened, and their faces were not confounded.

content: 6 This afflicted one called, and Jehovah heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.
content_old: 6 This afflicted one called, and Jehovah heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.

content: 7 The angel of Jehovah encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.
content_old: 7 The angel of Jehovah encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.

content: 8 Taste and see that Jehovah is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him!
content_old: 8 Taste and see that Jehovah is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him!

content: 9 Fear Jehovah, ye his saints; for there is no want to them that fear him.
content_old: 9 Fear Jehovah, ye his saints; for there is no want to them that fear him.

content: 10 The young lions are in need and suffer hunger; but they that seek Jehovah shall not want any good.
content_old: 10 The young lions are in need and suffer hunger; but they that seek Jehovah shall not want any good.

content: 11 Come, ye sons, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of Jehovah.
content_old: 11 Come, ye sons, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of Jehovah.

content: 12 What man is he that desireth life, and loveth days, that he may see good?
content_old: 12 What man is he that desireth life, and loveth days, that he may see good?

content: 13 Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile;
content_old: 13 Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile;

content: 14 Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.
content_old: 14 Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

content: 15 The eyes of Jehovah are upon the righteous, and his ears are toward their cry;
content_old: 15 The eyes of Jehovah are upon the righteous, and his ears are toward their cry;

content: 16 The face of Jehovah is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth:
content_old: 16 The face of Jehovah is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth:

content: 17 The righteous cry, and Jehovah heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
content_old: 17 The righteous cry, and Jehovah heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.

content: 18 Jehovah is nigh to those that are of a broken heart, and saveth them that are of a contrite spirit.
content_old: 18 Jehovah is nigh to those that are of a broken heart, and saveth them that are of a contrite spirit.

content: 19 Many are the adversities of the righteous, but Jehovah delivereth him out of them all:
content_old: 19 Many are the adversities of the righteous, but Jehovah delivereth him out of them all:

content: 20 He keepeth all his bones; not one of them is broken.
content_old: 20 He keepeth all his bones; not one of them is broken.

content: 21 Evil shall destroy the wicked; and they that hate the righteous shall bear their guilt.
content_old: 21 Evil shall destroy the wicked; and they that hate the righteous shall bear their guilt.

content: A Psalm of David.
content_old: A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Strive, O Jehovah, with them that strive with me; fight against them that fight against me:
content_old: 1 Strive, O Jehovah, with them that strive with me; fight against them that fight against me:

content: 2 Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for my help;
content_old: 2 Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for my help;

content: 3 And draw out the spear, and stop the way against my pursuers: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.
content_old: 3 And draw out the spear, and stop the way against my pursuers: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.

content: 4 Let them be put to shame and confounded that seek after my life; let them be turned backward and brought to confusion that devise my hurt:
content_old: 4 Let them be put to shame and confounded that seek after my life; let them be turned backward and brought to confusion that devise my hurt:

content: 5 Let them be as chaff before the wind, and let the angel of Jehovah drive them away;
content_old: 5 Let them be as chaff before the wind, and let the angel of Jehovah drive them away;

content: 6 Let their way be dark and slippery, and let the angel of Jehovah pursue them.
content_old: 6 Let their way be dark and slippery, and let the angel of Jehovah pursue them.

content: 7 For without cause have they hidden for me their net in a pit; without cause they have digged it for my soul.
content_old: 7 For without cause have they hidden for me their net in a pit; without cause they have digged it for my soul.

content: 8 Let destruction come upon him unawares, and let his net which he hath hidden catch himself: for destruction let him fall therein.
content_old: 8 Let destruction come upon him unawares, and let his net which he hath hidden catch himself: for destruction let him fall therein.

content: 9 And my soul shall be joyful in Jehovah; it shall rejoice in his salvation.
content_old: 9 And my soul shall be joyful in Jehovah; it shall rejoice in his salvation.

content: 10 All my bones shall say, Jehovah, who is like unto thee, who deliverest the afflicted from one stronger than he, yea, the afflicted and the needy from him that spoileth him!
content_old: 10 All my bones shall say, Jehovah, who is like unto thee, who deliverest the afflicted from one stronger than he, yea, the afflicted and the needy from him that spoileth him!

content: 11 Unrighteous witnesses rise up; they lay to my charge things which I know not.
content_old: 11 Unrighteous witnesses rise up; they lay to my charge things which I know not.

content: 12 They reward me evil for good, to the bereavement of my soul.
content_old: 12 They reward me evil for good, to the bereavement of my soul.

content: 13 But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth; I chastened my soul with fasting, and my prayer returned into mine own bosom:
content_old: 13 But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth; I chastened my soul with fasting, and my prayer returned into mine own bosom:

content: 14 I behaved myself as though he had been a friend, a brother to me; I bowed down in sadness, as one that mourneth for a mother.
content_old: 14 I behaved myself as though he had been a friend, a brother to me; I bowed down in sadness, as one that mourneth for a mother.

content: 15 But at my halting they rejoiced, and gathered together: the slanderers gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not:
content_old: 15 But at my halting they rejoiced, and gathered together: the slanderers gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not:

content: 16 With profane jesters for bread, they have gnashed their teeth against me.
content_old: 16 With profane jesters for bread, they have gnashed their teeth against me.

content: 17 Lord, how long wilt thou look on? Rescue my soul from their destructions, my only one from the young lions.
content_old: 17 Lord, how long wilt thou look on? Rescue my soul from their destructions, my only one from the young lions.

content: 18 I will give thee thanks in the great congregation; I will praise thee among much people.
content_old: 18 I will give thee thanks in the great congregation; I will praise thee among much people.

content: 19 Let not them that are wrongfully mine enemies rejoice over me; let them not wink with the eye that hate me without cause.
content_old: 19 Let not them that are wrongfully mine enemies rejoice over me; let them not wink with the eye that hate me without cause.

content: 20 For they speak not peace; and they devise deceitful words against the quiet in the land.
content_old: 20 For they speak not peace; and they devise deceitful words against the quiet in the land.

content: 21 And they opened their mouth wide against me; they said, Aha! aha! our eye hath seen it.
content_old: 21 And they opened their mouth wide against me; they said, Aha! aha! our eye hath seen it.

content: 22 Thou hast seen it, Jehovah: keep not silence; O Lord, be not far from me.
content_old: 22 Thou hast seen it, Jehovah: keep not silence; O Lord, be not far from me.

content: 23 Stir up thyself, and awake for my right, for my cause, my God and Lord!
content_old: 23 Stir up thyself, and awake for my right, for my cause, my God and Lord!

content: 24 Judge me, Jehovah my God, according to thy righteousness, and let them not rejoice over me.
content_old: 24 Judge me, Jehovah my God, according to thy righteousness, and let them not rejoice over me.

content: 25 Let them not say in their heart, Aha! so would we have it. Let them not say, We have swallowed him up.
content_old: 25 Let them not say in their heart, Aha! so would we have it. Let them not say, We have swallowed him up.

content: 26 Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine adversity; let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.
content_old: 26 Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine adversity; let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.

content: 27 Let them exult and rejoice that delight in my righteousness; and let them say continually, Jehovah be magnified, who delighteth in the prosperity of his servant.
content_old: 27 Let them exult and rejoice that delight in my righteousness; and let them say continually, Jehovah be magnified, who delighteth in the prosperity of his servant.

content: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of the servant of Jehovah; of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of the servant of Jehovah; of David.

content: 1 The transgression of the wicked uttereth within my heart, There is no fear of God before his eyes.
content_old: 1 The transgression of the wicked uttereth within my heart, There is no fear of God before his eyes.

content: 2 For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, even when his iniquity is found to be hateful.
content_old: 2 For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, even when his iniquity is found to be hateful.

content: 3 The words of his mouth are wickedness and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, to do good.
content_old: 3 The words of his mouth are wickedness and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, to do good.

content: 4 He deviseth wickedness up on his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good: he abhorreth not evil.
content_old: 4 He deviseth wickedness up on his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good: he abhorreth not evil.

content: 5 Jehovah, thy loving-kindness is in the heavens, and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.
content_old: 5 Jehovah, thy loving-kindness is in the heavens, and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.

content: 6 Thy righteousness is like the high mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: thou, Jehovah, preservest man and beast.
content_old: 6 Thy righteousness is like the high mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: thou, Jehovah, preservest man and beast.

content: 7 How precious is thy loving-kindness, O God! So the sons of men take refuge under the shadow of thy wings.
content_old: 7 How precious is thy loving-kindness, O God! So the sons of men take refuge under the shadow of thy wings.

content: 8 They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou wilt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.
content_old: 8 They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou wilt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.

content: 9 For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.
content_old: 9 For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.

content: 10 Continue thy loving-kindness unto them that know thee, and thy righteousness to the upright in heart;
content_old: 10 Continue thy loving-kindness unto them that know thee, and thy righteousness to the upright in heart;

content: 11 Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.
content_old: 11 Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.

content: A Psalm of David.
content_old: A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Fret not thyself because of evil-doers, and be not envious of them that work unrighteousness;
content_old: 1 Fret not thyself because of evil-doers, and be not envious of them that work unrighteousness;

content: 2 for they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and fade as the green herb.
content_old: 2 for they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and fade as the green herb.

content: 3 Confide in Jehovah, and do good; dwell in the land, and feed on faithfulness;
content_old: 3 Confide in Jehovah, and do good; dwell in the land, and feed on faithfulness;

content: 4 and delight thyself in Jehovah, and he will give thee the desires of thy heart.
content_old: 4 and delight thyself in Jehovah, and he will give thee the desires of thy heart.

content: 5 Commit thy way unto Jehovah, and rely upon him: he will bring it to pass;
content_old: 5 Commit thy way unto Jehovah, and rely upon him: he will bring it to pass;

content: 6 and he will bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.
content_old: 6 and he will bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.

content: 7 Rest in Jehovah, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him that prospereth in his way, because of the man that bringeth mischievous devices to pass.
content_old: 7 Rest in Jehovah, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him that prospereth in his way, because of the man that bringeth mischievous devices to pass.

content: 8 Cease from anger, and forsake wrath; fret not thyself: it would be only to do evil.
content_old: 8 Cease from anger, and forsake wrath; fret not thyself: it would be only to do evil.

content: 9 For evil-doers shall be cut off; but those that wait on Jehovah, they shall possess the land.
content_old: 9 For evil-doers shall be cut off; but those that wait on Jehovah, they shall possess the land.

content: 10 For yet a little while, and the wicked is not; and thou considerest his place, but he is not.
content_old: 10 For yet a little while, and the wicked is not; and thou considerest his place, but he is not.

content: 11 But the meek shall possess the land, and shall delight themselves in the abundance of prosperity.
content_old: 11 But the meek shall possess the land, and shall delight themselves in the abundance of prosperity.

content: 12 The wicked plotteth against the righteous, and gnasheth his teeth against him.
content_old: 12 The wicked plotteth against the righteous, and gnasheth his teeth against him.

content: 13 The Lord laugheth at him; for he seeth that his day is coming.
content_old: 13 The Lord laugheth at him; for he seeth that his day is coming.

content: 14 The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the afflicted and needy, to slay those that are upright in the way:
content_old: 14 The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the afflicted and needy, to slay those that are upright in the way:

content: 15 their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.
content_old: 15 their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.

content: 16 The little that the righteous hath is better than the abundance of many wicked;
content_old: 16 The little that the righteous hath is better than the abundance of many wicked;

content: 17 for the arms of the wicked shall be broken, but Jehovah upholdeth the righteous.
content_old: 17 for the arms of the wicked shall be broken, but Jehovah upholdeth the righteous.

content: 18 Jehovah knoweth the days of the perfect; and their inheritance shall be for ever:
content_old: 18 Jehovah knoweth the days of the perfect; and their inheritance shall be for ever:

content: 19 they shall not be ashamed in the time of evil, and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
content_old: 19 they shall not be ashamed in the time of evil, and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.

content: 20 For the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of Jehovah shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume, like smoke shall they consume away.
content_old: 20 For the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of Jehovah shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume, like smoke shall they consume away.

content: 21 The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again; but the righteous is gracious and giveth:
content_old: 21 The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again; but the righteous is gracious and giveth:

content: 22 for those blessed of him shall possess the land, and they that are cursed of him shall be cut off.
content_old: 22 for those blessed of him shall possess the land, and they that are cursed of him shall be cut off.

content: 23 The steps of a man are established by Jehovah, and he delighteth in his way:
content_old: 23 The steps of a man are established by Jehovah, and he delighteth in his way:

content: 24 though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down, for Jehovah upholdeth his hand.
content_old: 24 though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down, for Jehovah upholdeth his hand.

content: 25 I have been young, and now am old, and I have not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed seeking bread:
content_old: 25 I have been young, and now am old, and I have not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed seeking bread:

content: 26 all the day he is gracious and lendeth, and his seed shall be a blessing.
content_old: 26 all the day he is gracious and lendeth, and his seed shall be a blessing.

content: 27 Depart from evil, and do good, and dwell for evermore;
content_old: 27 Depart from evil, and do good, and dwell for evermore;

content: 28 for Jehovah loveth judgment, and will not forsake his saints: They are preserved for ever; but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.
content_old: 28 for Jehovah loveth judgment, and will not forsake his saints: They are preserved for ever; but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.

content: 29 The righteous shall possess the land, and dwell therein for ever.
content_old: 29 The righteous shall possess the land, and dwell therein for ever.

content: 30 The mouth of the righteous proffereth wisdom, and his tongue speaketh judgment;
content_old: 30 The mouth of the righteous proffereth wisdom, and his tongue speaketh judgment;

content: 31 the law of his God is in his heart; his goings shall not slide.
content_old: 31 the law of his God is in his heart; his goings shall not slide.

content: 32 The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him:
content_old: 32 The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him:

content: 33 Jehovah will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.
content_old: 33 Jehovah will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.

content: 34 Wait for Jehovah, and keep his way, and he will exalt thee to possess the land: when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.
content_old: 34 Wait for Jehovah, and keep his way, and he will exalt thee to possess the land: when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.

content: 35 I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading like a green tree in its native soil:
content_old: 35 I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading like a green tree in its native soil:

content: 36 but he passed away, and behold, he was not; and I sought him, but he was not found.
content_old: 36 but he passed away, and behold, he was not; and I sought him, but he was not found.

content: 37 Mark the perfect, and behold the upright, for the end of that man is peace;
content_old: 37 Mark the perfect, and behold the upright, for the end of that man is peace;

content: 38 but the transgressors shall be destroyed together; the future of the wicked shall be cut off.
content_old: 38 but the transgressors shall be destroyed together; the future of the wicked shall be cut off.

content: 39 But the salvation of the righteous is of Jehovah: he is their strength in the time of trouble.
content_old: 39 But the salvation of the righteous is of Jehovah: he is their strength in the time of trouble.

content: A Psalm of David, to bring to remembrance.
content_old: A Psalm of David, to bring to remembrance.

content: 1 Jehovah, rebuke me not in thy wrath; neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
content_old: 1 Jehovah, rebuke me not in thy wrath; neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

content: 2 For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand cometh down upon me.
content_old: 2 For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand cometh down upon me.

content: 3 There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine indignation; no peace in my bones, because of my sin.
content_old: 3 There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine indignation; no peace in my bones, because of my sin.

content: 4 For mine iniquities are gone over my head: as a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
content_old: 4 For mine iniquities are gone over my head: as a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.

content: 5 My wounds stink, they are corrupt, because of my foolishness.
content_old: 5 My wounds stink, they are corrupt, because of my foolishness.

content: 6 I am depressed; I am bowed down beyond measure; I go mourning all the day.
content_old: 6 I am depressed; I am bowed down beyond measure; I go mourning all the day.

content: 7 For my loins are full of burning, and there is no soundness in my flesh.
content_old: 7 For my loins are full of burning, and there is no soundness in my flesh.

content: 8 I am faint and broken beyond measure; I roar by reason of the agitation of my heart.
content_old: 8 I am faint and broken beyond measure; I roar by reason of the agitation of my heart.

content: 9 Lord, all my desire is before thee, and my sighing is not hid from thee.
content_old: 9 Lord, all my desire is before thee, and my sighing is not hid from thee.

content: 10 My heart throbbeth, my strength hath left me; and the light of mine eyes, it also is no more with me.
content_old: 10 My heart throbbeth, my strength hath left me; and the light of mine eyes, it also is no more with me.

content: 11 My lovers and mine associates stand aloof from my stroke; and my kinsmen stand afar off.
content_old: 11 My lovers and mine associates stand aloof from my stroke; and my kinsmen stand afar off.

content: 12 And they that seek after my life lay snares for me; and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and meditate deceits all the day long.
content_old: 12 And they that seek after my life lay snares for me; and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and meditate deceits all the day long.

content: 13 But I, as a deaf man, hear not; and am as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.
content_old: 13 But I, as a deaf man, hear not; and am as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.

content: 14 Yea, I am as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
content_old: 14 Yea, I am as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

content: 15 For in thee, Jehovah, do I hope: thou wilt answer, O Lord my God.
content_old: 15 For in thee, Jehovah, do I hope: thou wilt answer, O Lord my God.

content: 16 For I said, Let them not rejoice over me! When my foot slipped, they magnified themselves against me.
content_old: 16 For I said, Let them not rejoice over me! When my foot slipped, they magnified themselves against me.

content: 17 For I am ready to halt, and my pain is continually before me.
content_old: 17 For I am ready to halt, and my pain is continually before me.

content: 18 For I will declare mine iniquity, I am grieved for my sin.
content_old: 18 For I will declare mine iniquity, I am grieved for my sin.

content: 19 But mine enemies are lively, they are strong; and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied:
content_old: 19 But mine enemies are lively, they are strong; and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied:

content: 20 And they that render evil for good are adversaries unto me; because I pursue what is good.
content_old: 20 And they that render evil for good are adversaries unto me; because I pursue what is good.

content: 21 Forsake me not, Jehovah; O my God, be not far from me.
content_old: 21 Forsake me not, Jehovah; O my God, be not far from me.

content: To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.

content: 1 I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a muzzle, while the wicked is before me.
content_old: 1 I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a muzzle, while the wicked is before me.

content: 2 I was dumb with silence, I held my peace from good; and my sorrow was stirred.
content_old: 2 I was dumb with silence, I held my peace from good; and my sorrow was stirred.

content: 3 My heart burned within me; the fire was kindled in my musing: I spoke with my tongue,
content_old: 3 My heart burned within me; the fire was kindled in my musing: I spoke with my tongue,

content: 4 Make me to know, Jehovah, mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is: I shall know how frail I am.
content_old: 4 Make me to know, Jehovah, mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is: I shall know how frail I am.

content: 5 Behold, thou hast made my days as hand-breadths, and my lifetime is as nothing before thee; verily, every man, even the high placed, is altogether vanity. Selah.
content_old: 5 Behold, thou hast made my days as hand-breadths, and my lifetime is as nothing before thee; verily, every man, even the high placed, is altogether vanity. Selah.

content: 6 Verily, man walketh in a vain show; verily they are disquieted in vain; he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.
content_old: 6 Verily, man walketh in a vain show; verily they are disquieted in vain; he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.

content: 7 And now, what wait I for, Lord? my hope is in thee.
content_old: 7 And now, what wait I for, Lord? my hope is in thee.

content: 8 Deliver me from all my transgressions; make me not the reproach of the foolish.
content_old: 8 Deliver me from all my transgressions; make me not the reproach of the foolish.

content: 9 I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; for thou hast done it.
content_old: 9 I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; for thou hast done it.

content: 10 Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thy hand.
content_old: 10 Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thy hand.

content: 11 When thou with rebukes dost correct a man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely, every man is vanity. Selah.
content_old: 11 When thou with rebukes dost correct a man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely, every man is vanity. Selah.

content: 12 Hear my prayer, Jehovah, and give ear unto my cry; be not silent at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, a sojourner, like all my fathers.
content_old: 12 Hear my prayer, Jehovah, and give ear unto my cry; be not silent at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, a sojourner, like all my fathers.

content: To the chief Musician. Of David. A Psalm.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Of David. A Psalm.

content: 1 I waited patiently for Jehovah; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
content_old: 1 I waited patiently for Jehovah; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.

content: 2 And he brought me up out of the pit of destruction, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock; he hath established my goings:
content_old: 2 And he brought me up out of the pit of destruction, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock; he hath established my goings:

content: 3 And he hath put a new song in my mouth, praise unto our God. Many shall see it, and fear, and shall confide in Jehovah.
content_old: 3 And he hath put a new song in my mouth, praise unto our God. Many shall see it, and fear, and shall confide in Jehovah.

content: 4 Blessed is the man that hath made Jehovah his confidence, and turneth not to the proud, and to such as turn aside to lies.
content_old: 4 Blessed is the man that hath made Jehovah his confidence, and turneth not to the proud, and to such as turn aside to lies.

content: 5 Thou, O Jehovah my God, hast multiplied thy marvellous works, and thy thoughts toward us: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee; would I declare and speak them, they are more than can be numbered.
content_old: 5 Thou, O Jehovah my God, hast multiplied thy marvellous works, and thy thoughts toward us: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee; would I declare and speak them, they are more than can be numbered.

content: 6 Sacrifice and oblation thou didst not desire: ears hast thou prepared me. Burnt-offering and sin-offering hast thou not demanded;
content_old: 6 Sacrifice and oblation thou didst not desire: ears hast thou prepared me. Burnt-offering and sin-offering hast thou not demanded;

content: 7 Then said I, Behold, I come, in the volume of the book it is written of me—
content_old: 7 Then said I, Behold, I come, in the volume of the book it is written of me—

content: 8 To do thy good pleasure, my God, is my delight, and thy law is within my heart.
content_old: 8 To do thy good pleasure, my God, is my delight, and thy law is within my heart.

content: 9 I have published righteousness in the great congregation: behold, I have not withheld my lips, Jehovah, thou knowest.
content_old: 9 I have published righteousness in the great congregation: behold, I have not withheld my lips, Jehovah, thou knowest.

content: 10 I have not hidden thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy loving-kindness and thy truth from the great congregation.
content_old: 10 I have not hidden thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy loving-kindness and thy truth from the great congregation.

content: 11 Withhold not thou, Jehovah, thy tender mercies from me; let thy loving-kindness and thy truth continually preserve me.
content_old: 11 Withhold not thou, Jehovah, thy tender mercies from me; let thy loving-kindness and thy truth continually preserve me.

content: 12 For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I cannot see; they are more than the hairs of my head: and my heart hath failed me.
content_old: 12 For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I cannot see; they are more than the hairs of my head: and my heart hath failed me.

content: 13 Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me; Jehovah, make haste to my help.
content_old: 13 Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me; Jehovah, make haste to my help.

content: 14 Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be turned backward and confounded that take pleasure in mine adversity;
content_old: 14 Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be turned backward and confounded that take pleasure in mine adversity;

content: 15 Let them be desolate, because of their shame, that say unto me, Aha! Aha!
content_old: 15 Let them be desolate, because of their shame, that say unto me, Aha! Aha!

content: 16 Let all those that seek thee be glad and rejoice in thee; let such as love thy salvation say continually, Jehovah be magnified!
content_old: 16 Let all those that seek thee be glad and rejoice in thee; let such as love thy salvation say continually, Jehovah be magnified!

content: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Blessed is he that understandeth the poor: Jehovah will deliver him in the day of evil.
content_old: 1 Blessed is he that understandeth the poor: Jehovah will deliver him in the day of evil.

content: 2 Jehovah will preserve him, and keep him alive; he shall be made happy in the land; and thou wilt not deliver him to the will of his enemies.
content_old: 2 Jehovah will preserve him, and keep him alive; he shall be made happy in the land; and thou wilt not deliver him to the will of his enemies.

content: 3 Jehovah will sustain him upon the bed of languishing: thou turnest all his bed in his sickness.
content_old: 3 Jehovah will sustain him upon the bed of languishing: thou turnest all his bed in his sickness.

content: 4 As for me, I said, Jehovah, be gracious unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.
content_old: 4 As for me, I said, Jehovah, be gracious unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.

content: 5 Mine enemies wish me evil: When will he die, and his name perish?
content_old: 5 Mine enemies wish me evil: When will he die, and his name perish?

content: 6 And if one come to see me, he speaketh falsehood; his heart gathereth wickedness to itself: he goeth abroad, he telleth it.
content_old: 6 And if one come to see me, he speaketh falsehood; his heart gathereth wickedness to itself: he goeth abroad, he telleth it.

content: 7 All that hate me whisper together against me; against me do they devise my hurt.
content_old: 7 All that hate me whisper together against me; against me do they devise my hurt.

content: 8 A thing of Belial cleaveth fast unto him; and now that he is laid down, he will rise up no more.
content_old: 8 A thing of Belial cleaveth fast unto him; and now that he is laid down, he will rise up no more.

content: 9 Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I confided, who did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.
content_old: 9 Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I confided, who did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.

content: 10 But thou, Jehovah, be gracious unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.
content_old: 10 But thou, Jehovah, be gracious unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

content: 11 By this I know that thou delightest in me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.
content_old: 11 By this I know that thou delightest in me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

content: 12 But as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.
content_old: 12 But as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.

content: To the chief Musician. An instruction; of the sons of Korah.
content_old: To the chief Musician. An instruction; of the sons of Korah.

content: 1 As the hart panteth after the water-brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.
content_old: 1 As the hart panteth after the water-brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.

content: 2 My soul thirsteth for God, for the living •God: when shall I come and appear before God?
content_old: 2 My soul thirsteth for God, for the living •God: when shall I come and appear before God?

content: 3 My tears have been my bread day and night, while they say unto me all the day, Where is thy God?
content_old: 3 My tears have been my bread day and night, while they say unto me all the day, Where is thy God?

content: 4 These things I remember and have poured out my soul within me: how I passed along with the multitude, how I went on with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, a festive multitude.
content_old: 4 These things I remember and have poured out my soul within me: how I passed along with the multitude, how I went on with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, a festive multitude.

content: 5 Why art thou cast down, my soul, and art disquieted in me? hope in God; for I shall yet praise him, for the health of his countenance.
content_old: 5 Why art thou cast down, my soul, and art disquieted in me? hope in God; for I shall yet praise him, for the health of his countenance.

content: 6 My God, my soul is cast down within me; therefore do I remember thee from the land of the Jordan, and the Hermons, from mount Mizar.
content_old: 6 My God, my soul is cast down within me; therefore do I remember thee from the land of the Jordan, and the Hermons, from mount Mizar.

content: 7 Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy cataracts; all thy breakers and thy billows are gone over me.
content_old: 7 Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy cataracts; all thy breakers and thy billows are gone over me.

content: 8 In the day-time will Jehovah command his loving-kindness, and in the night his song shall be with me, a prayer unto the •God of my life.
content_old: 8 In the day-time will Jehovah command his loving-kindness, and in the night his song shall be with me, a prayer unto the •God of my life.

content: 9 I will say unto •God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
content_old: 9 I will say unto •God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

content: 10 As with a crushing in my bones mine adversaries reproach me, while they say unto me all the day, Where is thy God?
content_old: 10 As with a crushing in my bones mine adversaries reproach me, while they say unto me all the day, Where is thy God?

content: 1 Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation; deliver me from the deceitful and unrighteous man.
content_old: 1 Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation; deliver me from the deceitful and unrighteous man.

content: 2 For thou art the God of my strength: why hast thou cast me off? why go I about mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
content_old: 2 For thou art the God of my strength: why hast thou cast me off? why go I about mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

content: 3 Send out thy light and thy truth: they shall lead me, they shall bring me to thy holy mount, and unto thy habitations.
content_old: 3 Send out thy light and thy truth: they shall lead me, they shall bring me to thy holy mount, and unto thy habitations.

content: 4 Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto the •God of the gladness of my joy: yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O God, my God.
content_old: 4 Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto the •God of the gladness of my joy: yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O God, my God.

content: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. An instruction.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. An instruction.

content: 1 O God, with our ears have we heard, our fathers have told us, the work thou wroughtest in their days, in the days of old:
content_old: 1 O God, with our ears have we heard, our fathers have told us, the work thou wroughtest in their days, in the days of old:

content: 2 Thou, by thy hand, didst dispossess the nations, but them thou didst plant; thou didst afflict the peoples, but them didst thou cause to spread out.
content_old: 2 Thou, by thy hand, didst dispossess the nations, but them thou didst plant; thou didst afflict the peoples, but them didst thou cause to spread out.

content: 3 For not by their own sword did they take possession of the land, neither did their own arm save them; but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst delight in them.
content_old: 3 For not by their own sword did they take possession of the land, neither did their own arm save them; but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst delight in them.

content: 4 Thou thyself art my king, O God: command deliverance for Jacob.
content_old: 4 Thou thyself art my king, O God: command deliverance for Jacob.

content: 5 Through thee will we push down our adversaries; through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.
content_old: 5 Through thee will we push down our adversaries; through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.

content: 6 For I will not put confidence in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
content_old: 6 For I will not put confidence in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

content: 7 For thou hast saved us from our adversaries, and hast put them to shame that hate us.
content_old: 7 For thou hast saved us from our adversaries, and hast put them to shame that hate us.

content: 8 In God will we boast all the day, and we will praise thy name for ever. Selah.
content_old: 8 In God will we boast all the day, and we will praise thy name for ever. Selah.

content: 9 But thou hast cast off, and put us to confusion, and dost not go forth with our armies;
content_old: 9 But thou hast cast off, and put us to confusion, and dost not go forth with our armies;

content: 10 Thou hast made us to turn back from the adversary, and they that hate us spoil for themselves;
content_old: 10 Thou hast made us to turn back from the adversary, and they that hate us spoil for themselves;

content: 11 Thou hast given us over like sheep appointed for meat, and hast scattered us among the nations;
content_old: 11 Thou hast given us over like sheep appointed for meat, and hast scattered us among the nations;

content: 12 Thou hast sold thy people for nought, and hast not increased thy wealth by their price;
content_old: 12 Thou hast sold thy people for nought, and hast not increased thy wealth by their price;

content: 13 Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a mockery and a derision for them that are round about us;
content_old: 13 Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a mockery and a derision for them that are round about us;

content: 14 Thou makest us a byword among the nations, a shaking of the head among the peoples.
content_old: 14 Thou makest us a byword among the nations, a shaking of the head among the peoples.

content: 15 All the day my confusion is before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
content_old: 15 All the day my confusion is before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

content: 16 Because of the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and the avenger.
content_old: 16 Because of the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and the avenger.

content: 17 All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely against thy covenant:
content_old: 17 All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely against thy covenant:

content: 18 Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy path;
content_old: 18 Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy path;

content: 19 Though thou hast crushed us in the place of jackals, and covered us with the shadow of death.
content_old: 19 Though thou hast crushed us in the place of jackals, and covered us with the shadow of death.

content: 20 If we had forgotten the name of our God, and stretched out our hands to a strange •god,
content_old: 20 If we had forgotten the name of our God, and stretched out our hands to a strange •god,

content: 21 Would not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
content_old: 21 Would not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

content: 22 But for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are reckoned as sheep for slaughter.
content_old: 22 But for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are reckoned as sheep for slaughter.

content: 23 Awake, why sleepest thou, Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.
content_old: 23 Awake, why sleepest thou, Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.

content: 24 Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
content_old: 24 Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

content: 25 For our soul is bowed down to the dust; our belly cleaveth unto the earth.
content_old: 25 For our soul is bowed down to the dust; our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

content: To the chief Musician. Upon Shoshannim. Of the sons of Korah. An instruction; —a song of the Beloved.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Upon Shoshannim. Of the sons of Korah. An instruction; —a song of the Beloved.

content: 1 My heart is welling forth with a good matter: I say what I have composed touching the king. My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
content_old: 1 My heart is welling forth with a good matter: I say what I have composed touching the king. My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

content: 2 Thou art fairer than the sons of men; grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.
content_old: 2 Thou art fairer than the sons of men; grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.

content: 3 Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one, in thy majesty and thy splendour;
content_old: 3 Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one, in thy majesty and thy splendour;

content: 4 And in thy splendour ride prosperously, because of truth and meekness and righteousness: and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
content_old: 4 And in thy splendour ride prosperously, because of truth and meekness and righteousness: and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

content: 5 Thine arrows are sharp—peoples fall under thee—in the heart of the king’s enemies.
content_old: 5 Thine arrows are sharp—peoples fall under thee—in the heart of the king’s enemies.

content: 6 Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever; a sceptre of uprightness is the sceptre of thy kingdom:
content_old: 6 Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever; a sceptre of uprightness is the sceptre of thy kingdom:

content: 7 Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated wickedness; therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy companions.
content_old: 7 Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated wickedness; therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy companions.

content: 8 Myrrh and aloes, cassia, are all thy garments; out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made thee glad.
content_old: 8 Myrrh and aloes, cassia, are all thy garments; out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made thee glad.

content: 9 Kings’ daughters are among thine honourable women; upon thy right hand doth stand the queen in gold of Ophir.
content_old: 9 Kings’ daughters are among thine honourable women; upon thy right hand doth stand the queen in gold of Ophir.

content: 10 Hearken, daughter, and see, and incline thine ear; and forget thine own people and thy father’s house:
content_old: 10 Hearken, daughter, and see, and incline thine ear; and forget thine own people and thy father’s house:

content: 11 And the king will desire thy beauty; for he is thy Lord, and worship thou him.
content_old: 11 And the king will desire thy beauty; for he is thy Lord, and worship thou him.

content: 12 And the daughter of Tyre with a gift, the rich ones among the people, shall court thy favour.
content_old: 12 And the daughter of Tyre with a gift, the rich ones among the people, shall court thy favour.

content: 13 All glorious is the king’s daughter within; her clothing is of wrought gold:
content_old: 13 All glorious is the king’s daughter within; her clothing is of wrought gold:

content: 14 She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of embroidery; the virgins behind her, her companions, shall be brought in unto thee:
content_old: 14 She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of embroidery; the virgins behind her, her companions, shall be brought in unto thee:

content: 15 With joy and gladness shall they be brought; they shall enter into the king’s palace.
content_old: 15 With joy and gladness shall they be brought; they shall enter into the king’s palace.

content: 16 Instead of thy fathers shall be thy sons; princes shalt thou make them in all the earth.
content_old: 16 Instead of thy fathers shall be thy sons; princes shalt thou make them in all the earth.

content: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. On Alamoth. A song.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. On Alamoth. A song.

content: 1 God is our refuge and strength, a help in distresses, very readily found.
content_old: 1 God is our refuge and strength, a help in distresses, very readily found.

content: 2 Therefore will we not fear though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the heart of the seas;
content_old: 2 Therefore will we not fear though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the heart of the seas;

content: 3 Though the waters thereof roar and foam, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.
content_old: 3 Though the waters thereof roar and foam, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.

content: 4 There is a river the streams whereof make glad the city of God, the sanctuary of the habitations of the Most High.
content_old: 4 There is a river the streams whereof make glad the city of God, the sanctuary of the habitations of the Most High.

content: 5 God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her at the dawn of the morning.
content_old: 5 God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her at the dawn of the morning.

content: 6 The nations raged, the kingdoms were moved; he uttered his voice, the earth melted.
content_old: 6 The nations raged, the kingdoms were moved; he uttered his voice, the earth melted.

content: 7 Jehovah of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our high fortress. Selah.
content_old: 7 Jehovah of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our high fortress. Selah.

content: 8 Come, behold the works of Jehovah, what desolations he hath made in the earth:
content_old: 8 Come, behold the works of Jehovah, what desolations he hath made in the earth:

content: 9 He hath made wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariots in the fire.
content_old: 9 He hath made wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariots in the fire.

content: 10 Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.
content_old: 10 Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.

content: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm.

content: 1 All ye peoples, clap your hands; shout unto God with the voice of triumph!
content_old: 1 All ye peoples, clap your hands; shout unto God with the voice of triumph!

content: 2 For Jehovah, the Most High, is terrible, a great king over all the earth.
content_old: 2 For Jehovah, the Most High, is terrible, a great king over all the earth.

content: 3 He subdueth the peoples under us, and the nations under our feet.
content_old: 3 He subdueth the peoples under us, and the nations under our feet.

content: 4 He hath chosen our inheritance for us, the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
content_old: 4 He hath chosen our inheritance for us, the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.

content: 5 God is gone up amid shouting, Jehovah amid the sound of the trumpet.
content_old: 5 God is gone up amid shouting, Jehovah amid the sound of the trumpet.

content: 6 Sing psalms of God, sing psalms; sing psalms unto our King, sing psalms!
content_old: 6 Sing psalms of God, sing psalms; sing psalms unto our King, sing psalms!

content: 7 For God is the King of all the earth; sing psalms with understanding.
content_old: 7 For God is the King of all the earth; sing psalms with understanding.

content: 8 God reigneth over the nations; God sitteth upon the throne of his holiness.
content_old: 8 God reigneth over the nations; God sitteth upon the throne of his holiness.

content: A Song; a Psalm. Of the sons of Korah.
content_old: A Song; a Psalm. Of the sons of Korah.

content: 1 Great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in the hill of his holiness.
content_old: 1 Great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in the hill of his holiness.

content: 2 Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.
content_old: 2 Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.

content: 3 God is known in her palaces as a high fortress.
content_old: 3 God is known in her palaces as a high fortress.

content: 4 For behold, the kings assembled themselves, they passed by together;
content_old: 4 For behold, the kings assembled themselves, they passed by together;

content: 5 They saw, —so they marvelled; they were troubled, they fled in consternation:
content_old: 5 They saw, —so they marvelled; they were troubled, they fled in consternation:

content: 6 Trembling took hold upon them there; anguish, as of a woman in travail.
content_old: 6 Trembling took hold upon them there; anguish, as of a woman in travail.

content: 7 With an east wind thou hast broken the ships of Tarshish.
content_old: 7 With an east wind thou hast broken the ships of Tarshish.

content: 8 As we have heard, so have we seen, in the city of Jehovah of hosts, in the city of our God: God doth establish it for ever. Selah.
content_old: 8 As we have heard, so have we seen, in the city of Jehovah of hosts, in the city of our God: God doth establish it for ever. Selah.

content: 9 We have thought, O God, of thy loving-kindness, in the midst of thy temple.
content_old: 9 We have thought, O God, of thy loving-kindness, in the midst of thy temple.

content: 10 According to thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth: thy right hand is full of righteousness.
content_old: 10 According to thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth: thy right hand is full of righteousness.

content: 11 Let mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.
content_old: 11 Let mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.

content: 12 Walk about Zion, and go round about her: count the towers thereof;
content_old: 12 Walk about Zion, and go round about her: count the towers thereof;

content: 13 Mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces: that ye may tell it to the generation following.
content_old: 13 Mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces: that ye may tell it to the generation following.

content: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm.

content: 1 Hear this, all ye peoples; give ear, all inhabitants of the world:
content_old: 1 Hear this, all ye peoples; give ear, all inhabitants of the world:

content: 2 Both men of low and men of high degree, rich and poor alike.
content_old: 2 Both men of low and men of high degree, rich and poor alike.

content: 3 My mouth shall speak wisdom, and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding:
content_old: 3 My mouth shall speak wisdom, and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding:

content: 4 I will incline mine ear to a parable, I will open my riddle upon the harp.
content_old: 4 I will incline mine ear to a parable, I will open my riddle upon the harp.

content: 5 Wherefore should I fear in the days of adversity, when the iniquity of my supplanters encompasseth me? —
content_old: 5 Wherefore should I fear in the days of adversity, when the iniquity of my supplanters encompasseth me? —

content: 6 They depend upon their wealth, and boast themselves in the abundance of their riches. …
content_old: 6 They depend upon their wealth, and boast themselves in the abundance of their riches. …

content: 7 None can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him,
content_old: 7 None can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him,

content: 8 (For the redemption of their soul is costly, and must be given up for ever,)
content_old: 8 (For the redemption of their soul is costly, and must be given up for ever,)

content: 9 That he should still live perpetually, and not see corruption.
content_old: 9 That he should still live perpetually, and not see corruption.

content: 10 For he seeth that wise men die; all alike, the fool and the brutish perish, and they leave their wealth to others.
content_old: 10 For he seeth that wise men die; all alike, the fool and the brutish perish, and they leave their wealth to others.

content: 11 Their inward thought is, that their houses are for ever, their dwelling-places from generation to generation: they call the lands after their own names.
content_old: 11 Their inward thought is, that their houses are for ever, their dwelling-places from generation to generation: they call the lands after their own names.

content: 12 Nevertheless, man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.
content_old: 12 Nevertheless, man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.

content: 13 This their way is their folly, yet they that come after them delight in their sayings. Selah.
content_old: 13 This their way is their folly, yet they that come after them delight in their sayings. Selah.

content: 14 Like sheep are they laid in Sheol: Death feedeth on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their comeliness shall be for Sheol to consume, that there be no habitation for them.
content_old: 14 Like sheep are they laid in Sheol: Death feedeth on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their comeliness shall be for Sheol to consume, that there be no habitation for them.

content: 15 But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol: for he will receive me. Selah.
content_old: 15 But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol: for he will receive me. Selah.

content: 16 Be not afraid when a man becometh rich, when the glory of his house is increased:
content_old: 16 Be not afraid when a man becometh rich, when the glory of his house is increased:

content: 17 For when he dieth, he shall carry nothing away; his glory shall not descend after him.
content_old: 17 For when he dieth, he shall carry nothing away; his glory shall not descend after him.

content: 18 Though he blessed his soul in his lifetime, —and men will praise thee when thou doest well to thyself, —
content_old: 18 Though he blessed his soul in his lifetime, —and men will praise thee when thou doest well to thyself, —

content: 19 It shall go to the generation of his fathers: they shall never see light.
content_old: 19 It shall go to the generation of his fathers: they shall never see light.

content: A Psalm. Of Asaph.
content_old: A Psalm. Of Asaph.

content: 1 •God, Elohim-Jehovah, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.
content_old: 1 •God, Elohim-Jehovah, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.

content: 2 Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined forth.
content_old: 2 Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined forth.

content: 3 Our God will come, and will not keep silence: fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.
content_old: 3 Our God will come, and will not keep silence: fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.

content: 4 He will call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people:
content_old: 4 He will call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people:

content: 5 Gather unto me my godly ones, those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice!
content_old: 5 Gather unto me my godly ones, those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice!

content: 6 And the heavens shall declare his righteousness; for God executeth judgment himself. Selah.
content_old: 6 And the heavens shall declare his righteousness; for God executeth judgment himself. Selah.

content: 7 Hear, my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify unto thee: I am God, thy God.
content_old: 7 Hear, my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify unto thee: I am God, thy God.

content: 8 I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices, or thy burnt-offerings, continually before me;
content_old: 8 I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices, or thy burnt-offerings, continually before me;

content: 9 I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he-goats out of thy folds:
content_old: 9 I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he-goats out of thy folds:

content: 10 For every beast of the forest is mine, the cattle upon a thousand hills;
content_old: 10 For every beast of the forest is mine, the cattle upon a thousand hills;

content: 11 I know all the fowl of the mountains, and the roaming creatures of the field are mine:
content_old: 11 I know all the fowl of the mountains, and the roaming creatures of the field are mine:

content: 12 If I were hungry, I would not tell thee; for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.
content_old: 12 If I were hungry, I would not tell thee; for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.

content: 13 Should I eat the flesh of bulls, and drink the blood of goats?
content_old: 13 Should I eat the flesh of bulls, and drink the blood of goats?

content: 14 Offer unto God thanksgiving, and perform thy vows unto the Most High;
content_old: 14 Offer unto God thanksgiving, and perform thy vows unto the Most High;

content: 15 And call upon me in the day of trouble; I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
content_old: 15 And call upon me in the day of trouble; I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

content: 16 But unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant into thy mouth,
content_old: 16 But unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant into thy mouth,

content: 17 Seeing thou hast hated correction and hast cast my words behind thee?
content_old: 17 Seeing thou hast hated correction and hast cast my words behind thee?

content: 18 When thou sawest a thief, thou didst take pleasure in him, and thy portion was with adulterers;
content_old: 18 When thou sawest a thief, thou didst take pleasure in him, and thy portion was with adulterers;

content: 19 Thou lettest thy mouth loose to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit;
