content_old: 19 Thou lettest thy mouth loose to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit;

content: 20 Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother, thou revilest thine own mother’s son:
content_old: 20 Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother, thou revilest thine own mother’s son:

content: 21 These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.
content_old: 21 These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.

content: 22 Now consider this, ye that forget †God, lest I tear in pieces, and there be no deliverer.
content_old: 22 Now consider this, ye that forget †God, lest I tear in pieces, and there be no deliverer.

content: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David; when Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David; when Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba.

content: 1 Be gracious unto me, O God, according to thy loving-kindness; according to the abundance of thy tender mercies, blot out my transgressions.
content_old: 1 Be gracious unto me, O God, according to thy loving-kindness; according to the abundance of thy tender mercies, blot out my transgressions.

content: 2 Wash me fully from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
content_old: 2 Wash me fully from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

content: 3 For I acknowledge my transgressions, and my sin is continually before me.
content_old: 3 For I acknowledge my transgressions, and my sin is continually before me.

content: 4 Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done what is evil in thy sight; that thou mayest be justified when thou speakest, be clear when thou judgest.
content_old: 4 Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done what is evil in thy sight; that thou mayest be justified when thou speakest, be clear when thou judgest.

content: 5 Behold, in iniquity was I brought forth, and in sin did my mother conceive me.
content_old: 5 Behold, in iniquity was I brought forth, and in sin did my mother conceive me.

content: 6 Behold, thou wilt have truth in the inward parts; and in the hidden part thou wilt make me to know wisdom.
content_old: 6 Behold, thou wilt have truth in the inward parts; and in the hidden part thou wilt make me to know wisdom.

content: 7 Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
content_old: 7 Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

content: 8 Make me to hear gladness and joy; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.
content_old: 8 Make me to hear gladness and joy; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

content: 9 Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.
content_old: 9 Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

content: 10 Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me.
content_old: 10 Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me.

content: 11 Cast me not away from thy presence, and take not the spirit of thy holiness from me.
content_old: 11 Cast me not away from thy presence, and take not the spirit of thy holiness from me.

content: 12 Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation, and let a willing spirit sustain me.
content_old: 12 Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation, and let a willing spirit sustain me.

content: 13 I will teach transgressors thy ways, and sinners shall return unto thee.
content_old: 13 I will teach transgressors thy ways, and sinners shall return unto thee.

content: 14 Deliver me from blood-guiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
content_old: 14 Deliver me from blood-guiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.

content: 15 Lord, open my lips, and my mouth shall declare thy praise.
content_old: 15 Lord, open my lips, and my mouth shall declare thy praise.

content: 16 For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou hast no pleasure in burnt-offering.
content_old: 16 For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou hast no pleasure in burnt-offering.

content: 17 The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
content_old: 17 The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

content: 18 Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion; build the walls of Jerusalem.
content_old: 18 Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion; build the walls of Jerusalem.

content: To the chief Musician: an instruction. Of David; when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, and said unto him, David came to the house of Ahimelech.
content_old: To the chief Musician: an instruction. Of David; when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, and said unto him, David came to the house of Ahimelech.

content: 1 Why boastest thou thyself in evil, thou mighty man? The loving-kindness of •God abideth continually.
content_old: 1 Why boastest thou thyself in evil, thou mighty man? The loving-kindness of •God abideth continually.

content: 2 Thy tongue deviseth mischievous things, like a sharp razor, practising deceit.
content_old: 2 Thy tongue deviseth mischievous things, like a sharp razor, practising deceit.

content: 3 Thou hast loved evil rather than good, lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.
content_old: 3 Thou hast loved evil rather than good, lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.

content: 4 Thou hast loved all devouring words, O deceitful tongue!
content_old: 4 Thou hast loved all devouring words, O deceitful tongue!

content: 5 •God shall likewise destroy thee for ever; he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of thy tent, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.
content_old: 5 •God shall likewise destroy thee for ever; he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of thy tent, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.

content: 6 The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him, saying,
content_old: 6 The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him, saying,

content: 7 Behold the man that made not God his strength, but put confidence in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his avarice.
content_old: 7 Behold the man that made not God his strength, but put confidence in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his avarice.

content: 8 But as for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God: I will confide in the loving-kindness of God for ever and ever.
content_old: 8 But as for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God: I will confide in the loving-kindness of God for ever and ever.

content: To the chief Musician. On Mahalath: an instruction. Of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On Mahalath: an instruction. Of David.

content: 1 The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God! They have corrupted themselves, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good.
content_old: 1 The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God! They have corrupted themselves, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good.

content: 2 God looked down from the heavens upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.
content_old: 2 God looked down from the heavens upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.

content: 3 Every one of them is gone back, they are together become corrupt: there is none that doeth good, not even one.
content_old: 3 Every one of them is gone back, they are together become corrupt: there is none that doeth good, not even one.

content: 4 Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge, eating up my people as they eat bread? they call not upon God.
content_old: 4 Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge, eating up my people as they eat bread? they call not upon God.

content: 5 There were they in great fear, where no fear was; for God scattereth the bones of him that encampeth against thee. Thou hast put them to shame, for God hath despised them.
content_old: 5 There were they in great fear, where no fear was; for God scattereth the bones of him that encampeth against thee. Thou hast put them to shame, for God hath despised them.

content: To the chief Musician. On stringed instruments: an instruction. Of David; when the Ziphites came, and said to Saul, Is not David hiding himself with us?
content_old: To the chief Musician. On stringed instruments: an instruction. Of David; when the Ziphites came, and said to Saul, Is not David hiding himself with us?

content: 1 O God, by thy name save me, and by thy strength do me justice.
content_old: 1 O God, by thy name save me, and by thy strength do me justice.

content: 2 O God, hear my prayer; give ear to the words of my mouth.
content_old: 2 O God, hear my prayer; give ear to the words of my mouth.

content: 3 For strangers are risen up against me, and the violent seek after my life: they have not set God before them. Selah.
content_old: 3 For strangers are risen up against me, and the violent seek after my life: they have not set God before them. Selah.

content: 4 Behold, God is my helper; the Lord is among them that uphold my soul.
content_old: 4 Behold, God is my helper; the Lord is among them that uphold my soul.

content: 5 He will requite evil to mine enemies: in thy truth cut them off.
content_old: 5 He will requite evil to mine enemies: in thy truth cut them off.

content: 6 I will freely sacrifice unto thee; I will praise thy name, O Jehovah, because it is good.
content_old: 6 I will freely sacrifice unto thee; I will praise thy name, O Jehovah, because it is good.

content: To the chief Musician. On stringed instruments: an instruction. Of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On stringed instruments: an instruction. Of David.

content: 1 Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.
content_old: 1 Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.

content: 2 Attend unto me, and answer me: I wander about in my plaint, and I moan aloud,
content_old: 2 Attend unto me, and answer me: I wander about in my plaint, and I moan aloud,

content: 3 Because of the voice of the enemy; because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in anger they persecute me.
content_old: 3 Because of the voice of the enemy; because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in anger they persecute me.

content: 4 My heart is writhing within me, and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
content_old: 4 My heart is writhing within me, and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.

content: 5 Fear and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.
content_old: 5 Fear and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.

content: 6 And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away, and be at rest;
content_old: 6 And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away, and be at rest;

content: 7 Behold, I would flee afar off, I would lodge in the wilderness; Selah;
content_old: 7 Behold, I would flee afar off, I would lodge in the wilderness; Selah;

content: 8 I would hasten my escape from the stormy wind, from the tempest.
content_old: 8 I would hasten my escape from the stormy wind, from the tempest.

content: 9 Swallow them up, Lord; divide their tongue: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
content_old: 9 Swallow them up, Lord; divide their tongue: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

content: 10 Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof; and iniquity and mischief are in the midst of it.
content_old: 10 Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof; and iniquity and mischief are in the midst of it.

content: 11 Perversities are in the midst thereof; and oppression and deceit depart not from its streets.
content_old: 11 Perversities are in the midst thereof; and oppression and deceit depart not from its streets.

content: 12 For it is not an enemy that hath reproached me—then could I have borne it; neither is it he that hateth me that hath magnified himself against me—then would I have hidden myself from him;
content_old: 12 For it is not an enemy that hath reproached me—then could I have borne it; neither is it he that hateth me that hath magnified himself against me—then would I have hidden myself from him;

content: 13 But it was thou, a man mine equal, mine intimate, my familiar friend. …
content_old: 13 But it was thou, a man mine equal, mine intimate, my familiar friend. …

content: 14 We who held sweet intercourse together. To the house of God we walked amid the throng.
content_old: 14 We who held sweet intercourse together. To the house of God we walked amid the throng.

content: 15 Let death seize upon them, let them go down alive into Sheol. For wickedness is in their dwellings, in their midst.
content_old: 15 Let death seize upon them, let them go down alive into Sheol. For wickedness is in their dwellings, in their midst.

content: 16 As for me, unto God will I call; and Jehovah will save me.
content_old: 16 As for me, unto God will I call; and Jehovah will save me.

content: 17 Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray and moan aloud; and he will hear my voice.
content_old: 17 Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray and moan aloud; and he will hear my voice.

content: 18 He hath redeemed my soul in peace from the battle against me: for there were many about me.
content_old: 18 He hath redeemed my soul in peace from the battle against me: for there were many about me.

content: 19 •God will hear, and afflict them: he that is seated of old, (Selah) …because there is no change in them, and they fear not God.
content_old: 19 •God will hear, and afflict them: he that is seated of old, (Selah) …because there is no change in them, and they fear not God.

content: 20 He hath put forth his hands against such as are at peace with him; he hath profaned his covenant.
content_old: 20 He hath put forth his hands against such as are at peace with him; he hath profaned his covenant.

content: 21 Smooth were the milky words of his mouth, but his heart was war; his words were softer than oil, yet are they drawn swords.
content_old: 21 Smooth were the milky words of his mouth, but his heart was war; his words were softer than oil, yet are they drawn swords.

content: 22 Cast thy burden upon Jehovah, and he will sustain thee: he will never suffer the righteous to be moved.
content_old: 22 Cast thy burden upon Jehovah, and he will sustain thee: he will never suffer the righteous to be moved.

content: To the chief Musician. On Jonathelem-rechokim. Of David. Michtam; when the Philistines took him in Gath.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On Jonathelem-rechokim. Of David. Michtam; when the Philistines took him in Gath.

content: 1 Be gracious unto me, O God; for man would swallow me up: all the day long fighting he oppresseth me.
content_old: 1 Be gracious unto me, O God; for man would swallow me up: all the day long fighting he oppresseth me.

content: 2 Mine enemies would swallow me up all the day long; for they are many that fight against me haughtily.
content_old: 2 Mine enemies would swallow me up all the day long; for they are many that fight against me haughtily.

content: 3 In the day that I am afraid, I will confide in thee.
content_old: 3 In the day that I am afraid, I will confide in thee.

content: 4 In God will I praise his word, in God I put my confidence: I will not fear; what can flesh do unto me?
content_old: 4 In God will I praise his word, in God I put my confidence: I will not fear; what can flesh do unto me?

content: 5 All the day long they wrest my words; all their thoughts are against me for evil.
content_old: 5 All the day long they wrest my words; all their thoughts are against me for evil.

content: 6 They gather themselves together, they hide themselves; they mark my steps, because they wait for my soul.
content_old: 6 They gather themselves together, they hide themselves; they mark my steps, because they wait for my soul.

content: 7 Shall they escape by iniquity? In anger cast down the peoples, O God.
content_old: 7 Shall they escape by iniquity? In anger cast down the peoples, O God.

content: 8 Thou countest my wanderings; put my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?
content_old: 8 Thou countest my wanderings; put my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?

content: 9 Then shall mine enemies return backward in the day when I call: this I know, for God is for me.
content_old: 9 Then shall mine enemies return backward in the day when I call: this I know, for God is for me.

content: 10 In God will I praise his word; in Jehovah will I praise his word.
content_old: 10 In God will I praise his word; in Jehovah will I praise his word.

content: 11 In God have I put my confidence: I will not fear; what can man do unto me?
content_old: 11 In God have I put my confidence: I will not fear; what can man do unto me?

content: 12 Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render thanks unto thee.
content_old: 12 Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render thanks unto thee.

content: To the chief Musician. ‘Destroy not.’ Of David. Michtam; when he fled from Saul in the cave.
content_old: To the chief Musician. ‘Destroy not.’ Of David. Michtam; when he fled from Saul in the cave.

content: 1 Be gracious unto me, O God, be gracious unto me; for my soul taketh refuge in thee: yea, in the shadow of thy wings do I take refuge, until the calamities be overpast.
content_old: 1 Be gracious unto me, O God, be gracious unto me; for my soul taketh refuge in thee: yea, in the shadow of thy wings do I take refuge, until the calamities be overpast.

content: 2 I will call unto God, the Most High; unto •God that performeth all for me.
content_old: 2 I will call unto God, the Most High; unto •God that performeth all for me.

content: 3 He will send from the heavens and save me; he hath covered with reproach him that would swallow me up. Selah. God hath sent forth his loving-kindness and his truth.
content_old: 3 He will send from the heavens and save me; he hath covered with reproach him that would swallow me up. Selah. God hath sent forth his loving-kindness and his truth.

content: 4 My soul is in the midst of lions; I lie down among them that breathe out flames, the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.
content_old: 4 My soul is in the midst of lions; I lie down among them that breathe out flames, the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

content: 5 Be exalted above the heavens, O God; let thy glory be above all the earth!
content_old: 5 Be exalted above the heavens, O God; let thy glory be above all the earth!

content: 6 They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul was bowed down: they have digged a pit before me; they are fallen into the midst thereof. Selah.
content_old: 6 They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul was bowed down: they have digged a pit before me; they are fallen into the midst thereof. Selah.

content: 7 My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed: I will sing, yea, I will sing psalms.
content_old: 7 My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed: I will sing, yea, I will sing psalms.

content: 8 Awake, my glory; awake, lute and harp: I will wake the dawn.
content_old: 8 Awake, my glory; awake, lute and harp: I will wake the dawn.

content: 9 I will give thee thanks among the peoples, O Lord; of thee will I sing psalms among the nations:
content_old: 9 I will give thee thanks among the peoples, O Lord; of thee will I sing psalms among the nations:

content: 10 For thy loving-kindness is great unto the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.
content_old: 10 For thy loving-kindness is great unto the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.

content: To the chief Musician. ‘Destroy not.’ Of David. Michtam.
content_old: To the chief Musician. ‘Destroy not.’ Of David. Michtam.

content: 1 Is righteousness indeed silent? Do ye speak it? Do ye judge with equity, ye sons of men?
content_old: 1 Is righteousness indeed silent? Do ye speak it? Do ye judge with equity, ye sons of men?

content: 2 Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh out the violence of your hands in the earth.
content_old: 2 Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh out the violence of your hands in the earth.

content: 3 The wicked go astray from the womb; they err as soon as they are born, speaking lies.
content_old: 3 The wicked go astray from the womb; they err as soon as they are born, speaking lies.

content: 4 Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder which stoppeth her ear;
content_old: 4 Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder which stoppeth her ear;

content: 5 Which doth not hearken to the voice of enchanters, of one charming ever so wisely.
content_old: 5 Which doth not hearken to the voice of enchanters, of one charming ever so wisely.

content: 6 O God, break their teeth in their mouth; break out the great teeth of the young lions, O Jehovah.
content_old: 6 O God, break their teeth in their mouth; break out the great teeth of the young lions, O Jehovah.

content: 7 Let them melt away as waters that flow off; when he aimeth his arrows, let them be as blunted:
content_old: 7 Let them melt away as waters that flow off; when he aimeth his arrows, let them be as blunted:

content: 8 Let them be as a snail that melteth as it passeth away; like the untimely birth of a woman, let them not see the sun.
content_old: 8 Let them be as a snail that melteth as it passeth away; like the untimely birth of a woman, let them not see the sun.

content: 9 Before your pots feel the thorns, green or burning, —they shall be whirled away.
content_old: 9 Before your pots feel the thorns, green or burning, —they shall be whirled away.

content: 10 The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance; he shall wash his footsteps in the blood of the wicked:
content_old: 10 The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance; he shall wash his footsteps in the blood of the wicked:

content: To the chief Musician. ‘Destroy not.’ Of David. Michtam; when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him.
content_old: To the chief Musician. ‘Destroy not.’ Of David. Michtam; when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him.

content: 1 Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God; secure me on high from them that rise up against me.
content_old: 1 Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God; secure me on high from them that rise up against me.

content: 2 Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from men of blood.
content_old: 2 Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from men of blood.

content: 3 For behold, they lie in wait for my soul; strong ones are gathered against me: not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Jehovah.
content_old: 3 For behold, they lie in wait for my soul; strong ones are gathered against me: not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Jehovah.

content: 4 They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to meet me, and behold.
content_old: 4 They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to meet me, and behold.

content: 5 Yea, do thou, Jehovah, the God of hosts, the God of Israel, arise to visit all the nations: be not gracious to any plotters of iniquity. Selah.
content_old: 5 Yea, do thou, Jehovah, the God of hosts, the God of Israel, arise to visit all the nations: be not gracious to any plotters of iniquity. Selah.

content: 6 They return in the evening; they howl like a dog, and go round about the city:
content_old: 6 They return in the evening; they howl like a dog, and go round about the city:

content: 7 Behold, they belch out with their mouth; swords are in their lips: for who say they doth hear?
content_old: 7 Behold, they belch out with their mouth; swords are in their lips: for who say they doth hear?

content: 8 But thou, Jehovah, wilt laugh at them; thou wilt have all the nations in derision.
content_old: 8 But thou, Jehovah, wilt laugh at them; thou wilt have all the nations in derision.

content: 9 Their strength! …I will take heed to thee; for God is my high fortress.
content_old: 9 Their strength! …I will take heed to thee; for God is my high fortress.

content: 10 God, whose loving-kindness will come to meet me, —God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
content_old: 10 God, whose loving-kindness will come to meet me, —God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.

content: 11 Slay them not, lest my people forget; by thy power make them wander, and bring them down, O Lord, our shield.
content_old: 11 Slay them not, lest my people forget; by thy power make them wander, and bring them down, O Lord, our shield.

content: 12 Because of the sin of their mouth, the word of their lips, let them even be taken in their pride; and because of cursing and lying which they speak.
content_old: 12 Because of the sin of their mouth, the word of their lips, let them even be taken in their pride; and because of cursing and lying which they speak.

content: 13 Make an end in wrath, make an end, that they may be no more; that they may know that God ruleth in Jacob, unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
content_old: 13 Make an end in wrath, make an end, that they may be no more; that they may know that God ruleth in Jacob, unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

content: 14 And in the evening they shall return, they shall howl like a dog, and go round about the city.
content_old: 14 And in the evening they shall return, they shall howl like a dog, and go round about the city.

content: 15 They shall wander about for meat, and stay all night if they be not satisfied.
content_old: 15 They shall wander about for meat, and stay all night if they be not satisfied.

content: 16 But as for me, I will sing of thy strength; yea, I will sing aloud of thy loving-kindness in the morning; for thou hast been to me a high fortress, and a refuge in the day of my trouble.
content_old: 16 But as for me, I will sing of thy strength; yea, I will sing aloud of thy loving-kindness in the morning; for thou hast been to me a high fortress, and a refuge in the day of my trouble.

content: To the chief Musician. On Shushan. Testimony. Michtam of David; to teach: when he strove with the Syrians of Mesopotamia, and the Syrians of Zobah, and Joab returned, and smote the Edomites in the valley of salt, twelve thousand.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On Shushan. Testimony. Michtam of David; to teach: when he strove with the Syrians of Mesopotamia, and the Syrians of Zobah, and Joab returned, and smote the Edomites in the valley of salt, twelve thousand.

content: 1 O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased: restore us again.
content_old: 1 O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased: restore us again.

content: 2 Thou hast made the earth to tremble, thou hast rent it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.
content_old: 2 Thou hast made the earth to tremble, thou hast rent it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.

content: 3 Thou hast shewn thy people hard things; thou hast made us to drink the wine of bewilderment.
content_old: 3 Thou hast shewn thy people hard things; thou hast made us to drink the wine of bewilderment.

content: 4 Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth, (Selah,)
content_old: 4 Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth, (Selah,)

content: 5 That thy beloved ones may be delivered. Save with thy right hand, and answer me.
content_old: 5 That thy beloved ones may be delivered. Save with thy right hand, and answer me.

content: 6 God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
content_old: 6 God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

content: 7 Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine, and Ephraim is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;
content_old: 7 Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine, and Ephraim is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;

content: 8 Moab is my wash-pot; upon Edom will I cast my sandal; Philistia, shout aloud because of me.
content_old: 8 Moab is my wash-pot; upon Edom will I cast my sandal; Philistia, shout aloud because of me.

content: 9 Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me unto Edom?
content_old: 9 Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me unto Edom?

content: 10 Wilt not thou, O God, who didst cast us off? and didst not go forth, O God, with our armies?
content_old: 10 Wilt not thou, O God, who didst cast us off? and didst not go forth, O God, with our armies?

content: 11 Give us help from trouble; for vain is man’s deliverance.
content_old: 11 Give us help from trouble; for vain is man’s deliverance.

content: To the chief Musician. On a stringed instrument. A Psalm of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On a stringed instrument. A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Hear, O God, my cry; attend unto my prayer.
content_old: 1 Hear, O God, my cry; attend unto my prayer.

content: 2 From the end of the earth will I call unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: thou wilt lead me on to a rock which is too high for me.
content_old: 2 From the end of the earth will I call unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: thou wilt lead me on to a rock which is too high for me.

content: 3 For thou hast been a refuge for me, a strong tower from before the enemy.
content_old: 3 For thou hast been a refuge for me, a strong tower from before the enemy.

content: 4 I will sojourn in thy tent for ever; I will take refuge in the covert of thy wings. Selah.
content_old: 4 I will sojourn in thy tent for ever; I will take refuge in the covert of thy wings. Selah.

content: 5 For thou, O God, hast heard my vows; thou hast given me the inheritance of those that fear thy name.
content_old: 5 For thou, O God, hast heard my vows; thou hast given me the inheritance of those that fear thy name.

content: 6 Thou wilt add days to the days of the king: his years shall be as many generations.
content_old: 6 Thou wilt add days to the days of the king: his years shall be as many generations.

content: 7 He shall abide before God for ever: bestow loving-kindness and truth, that they may preserve him.
content_old: 7 He shall abide before God for ever: bestow loving-kindness and truth, that they may preserve him.

content: To the chief Musician. On Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Upon God alone doth my soul rest peacefully; from him is my salvation.
content_old: 1 Upon God alone doth my soul rest peacefully; from him is my salvation.

content: 2 He only is my rock and my salvation; my high fortress: I shall not be greatly moved.
content_old: 2 He only is my rock and my salvation; my high fortress: I shall not be greatly moved.

content: 3 How long will ye assail a man; will ye seek, all of you, to break him down as a bowing wall or a tottering fence?
content_old: 3 How long will ye assail a man; will ye seek, all of you, to break him down as a bowing wall or a tottering fence?

content: 4 They only consult to thrust him down from his excellency; they delight in lies; they bless with their mouth, but in their inward part they curse. Selah.
content_old: 4 They only consult to thrust him down from his excellency; they delight in lies; they bless with their mouth, but in their inward part they curse. Selah.

content: 5 Upon God alone, O my soul, rest peacefully; for my expectation is from him.
content_old: 5 Upon God alone, O my soul, rest peacefully; for my expectation is from him.

content: 6 He only is my rock and my salvation; my high fortress: I shall not be moved.
content_old: 6 He only is my rock and my salvation; my high fortress: I shall not be moved.

content: 7 With God is my salvation and my glory; the rock of my strength, my refuge is in God.
content_old: 7 With God is my salvation and my glory; the rock of my strength, my refuge is in God.

content: 8 Confide in him at all times, ye people; pour out your heart before him: God is our refuge. Selah.
content_old: 8 Confide in him at all times, ye people; pour out your heart before him: God is our refuge. Selah.

content: 9 Men of low degree are only vanity; men of high degree, a lie: laid in the balance, they go up together lighter than vanity.
content_old: 9 Men of low degree are only vanity; men of high degree, a lie: laid in the balance, they go up together lighter than vanity.

content: 10 Put not confidence in oppression, and become not vain in robbery; if wealth increase, set not your heart upon it.
content_old: 10 Put not confidence in oppression, and become not vain in robbery; if wealth increase, set not your heart upon it.

content: 11 Once hath God spoken, twice have I heard this, that strength belongeth unto God.
content_old: 11 Once hath God spoken, twice have I heard this, that strength belongeth unto God.

content: A Psalm of David; when he was in the wilderness of Judah.
content_old: A Psalm of David; when he was in the wilderness of Judah.

content: 1 O God, thou art my •God; early will I seek thee. My soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh languisheth for thee, in a dry and weary land without water:
content_old: 1 O God, thou art my •God; early will I seek thee. My soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh languisheth for thee, in a dry and weary land without water:

content: 2 To see thy power and thy glory, as I have beheld thee in the sanctuary;
content_old: 2 To see thy power and thy glory, as I have beheld thee in the sanctuary;

content: 3 For thy loving-kindness is better than life: my lips shall praise thee.
content_old: 3 For thy loving-kindness is better than life: my lips shall praise thee.

content: 4 So will I bless thee while I live; I will lift up my hands in thy name.
content_old: 4 So will I bless thee while I live; I will lift up my hands in thy name.

content: 5 My soul is satisfied as with marrow and fatness, and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips.
content_old: 5 My soul is satisfied as with marrow and fatness, and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips.

content: 6 When I remember thee upon my bed, I meditate on thee in the night-watches:
content_old: 6 When I remember thee upon my bed, I meditate on thee in the night-watches:

content: 7 For thou hast been my help, and in the shadow of thy wings will I sing for joy.
content_old: 7 For thou hast been my help, and in the shadow of thy wings will I sing for joy.

content: 8 My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.
content_old: 8 My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.

content: 9 But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth;
content_old: 9 But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth;

content: 10 They shall be given over to the power of the sword; they shall be the portion of foxes.
content_old: 10 They shall be given over to the power of the sword; they shall be the portion of foxes.

content: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Hear, O God, my voice in my plaint; preserve my life from fear of the enemy:
content_old: 1 Hear, O God, my voice in my plaint; preserve my life from fear of the enemy:

content: 2 Hide me from the secret counsel of evil-doers, from the tumultuous crowd of the workers of iniquity,
content_old: 2 Hide me from the secret counsel of evil-doers, from the tumultuous crowd of the workers of iniquity,

content: 3 Who have sharpened their tongue like a sword, and have aimed their arrow, a bitter word;
content_old: 3 Who have sharpened their tongue like a sword, and have aimed their arrow, a bitter word;

content: 4 That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.
content_old: 4 That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.

content: 5 They encourage themselves in an evil matter, they concert to hide snares; they say, Who will see them?
content_old: 5 They encourage themselves in an evil matter, they concert to hide snares; they say, Who will see them?

content: 6 They devise iniquities: We have it ready, the plan is diligently sought out. And each one’s inward thought and heart is deep.
content_old: 6 They devise iniquities: We have it ready, the plan is diligently sought out. And each one’s inward thought and heart is deep.

content: 7 But God will shoot an arrow at them: suddenly are they wounded;
content_old: 7 But God will shoot an arrow at them: suddenly are they wounded;

content: 8 By their own tongue they are made to fall over one another: all that see them shall flee away.
content_old: 8 By their own tongue they are made to fall over one another: all that see them shall flee away.

content: 9 And all men shall fear, and shall declare God’s doing; and they shall wisely consider his work.
content_old: 9 And all men shall fear, and shall declare God’s doing; and they shall wisely consider his work.

content: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David: a Song.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David: a Song.

content: 1 Praise waiteth for thee in silence, O God, in Zion; and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
content_old: 1 Praise waiteth for thee in silence, O God, in Zion; and unto thee shall the vow be performed.

content: 2 O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.
content_old: 2 O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.

content: 3 Iniquities have prevailed against me: our transgressions, thou wilt forgive them.
content_old: 3 Iniquities have prevailed against me: our transgressions, thou wilt forgive them.

content: 4 Blessed is he whom thou choosest and causest to approach: he shall dwell in thy courts. We shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, of thy holy temple.
content_old: 4 Blessed is he whom thou choosest and causest to approach: he shall dwell in thy courts. We shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, of thy holy temple.

content: 5 By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation, thou confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of the distant regions of the sea. …
content_old: 5 By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation, thou confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of the distant regions of the sea. …

content: 6 Who by his strength established the mountains, being girded with power;
content_old: 6 Who by his strength established the mountains, being girded with power;

content: 7 Who stilleth the raging of the seas, the raging of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples.
content_old: 7 Who stilleth the raging of the seas, the raging of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples.

content: 8 And they that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens; thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
content_old: 8 And they that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens; thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.

content: 9 Thou hast visited the earth, thou hast watered it; thou greatly enrichest it: the river of God is full of water; thou providest their corn, when thou hast so prepared it:
content_old: 9 Thou hast visited the earth, thou hast watered it; thou greatly enrichest it: the river of God is full of water; thou providest their corn, when thou hast so prepared it:

content: 10 Thou dost satiate its furrows, thou smoothest its clods, thou makest it soft with showers; thou blessest the springing thereof.
content_old: 10 Thou dost satiate its furrows, thou smoothest its clods, thou makest it soft with showers; thou blessest the springing thereof.

content: 11 Thou crownest the year with thy goodness, and thy paths drop fatness:
content_old: 11 Thou crownest the year with thy goodness, and thy paths drop fatness:

content: 12 They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness, and the hills are girded with gladness.
content_old: 12 They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness, and the hills are girded with gladness.

content: To the chief Musician. A Song: a Psalm.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Song: a Psalm.

content: 1 Shout aloud unto God, all the earth:
content_old: 1 Shout aloud unto God, all the earth:

content: 2 Sing forth the glory of his name, make his praise glorious;
content_old: 2 Sing forth the glory of his name, make his praise glorious;

content: 3 Say unto God, How terrible are thy works! because of the greatness of thy strength, thine enemies come cringing unto thee.
content_old: 3 Say unto God, How terrible are thy works! because of the greatness of thy strength, thine enemies come cringing unto thee.

content: 4 All the earth shall worship thee, and sing psalms unto thee: they shall sing forth thy name. Selah.
content_old: 4 All the earth shall worship thee, and sing psalms unto thee: they shall sing forth thy name. Selah.

content: 5 Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doings toward the children of men.
content_old: 5 Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doings toward the children of men.

content: 6 He turned the sea into dry land; they went through the river on foot: there did we rejoice in him.
content_old: 6 He turned the sea into dry land; they went through the river on foot: there did we rejoice in him.

content: 7 He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes observe the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
content_old: 7 He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes observe the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.

content: 8 Bless our God, ye peoples, and make the voice of his praise to be heard;
content_old: 8 Bless our God, ye peoples, and make the voice of his praise to be heard;

content: 9 Who hath set our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.
content_old: 9 Who hath set our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.

content: 10 For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.
content_old: 10 For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.

content: 11 Thou broughtest us into a net, thou didst lay a heavy burden upon our loins;
content_old: 11 Thou broughtest us into a net, thou didst lay a heavy burden upon our loins;

content: 12 Thou didst cause men to ride over our head; we went through fire and through water: but thou hast brought us out into abundance.
content_old: 12 Thou didst cause men to ride over our head; we went through fire and through water: but thou hast brought us out into abundance.

content: 13 I will go into thy house with burnt-offerings; I will perform my vows to thee,
content_old: 13 I will go into thy house with burnt-offerings; I will perform my vows to thee,

content: 14 Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
content_old: 14 Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.

content: 15 I will offer up unto thee burnt-offerings of fatted beasts, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
content_old: 15 I will offer up unto thee burnt-offerings of fatted beasts, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.

content: 16 Come, hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.
content_old: 16 Come, hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.

content: 17 I called unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.
content_old: 17 I called unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.

content: 18 Had I regarded iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not hear.
content_old: 18 Had I regarded iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not hear.

content: 19 But God hath heard; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
content_old: 19 But God hath heard; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

content: To the chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A Psalm: a Song.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A Psalm: a Song.

content: 1 God be gracious unto us, and bless us, and cause his face to shine upon us; Selah,
content_old: 1 God be gracious unto us, and bless us, and cause his face to shine upon us; Selah,

content: 2 That thy way may be known upon earth, thy salvation among all nations.
content_old: 2 That thy way may be known upon earth, thy salvation among all nations.

content: 3 Let the peoples praise thee, O God, let all the peoples praise thee.
content_old: 3 Let the peoples praise thee, O God, let all the peoples praise thee.

content: 4 Let the nations rejoice and sing for joy: for thou wilt judge the peoples equitably; and the nations upon earth, thou wilt guide them. Selah.
content_old: 4 Let the nations rejoice and sing for joy: for thou wilt judge the peoples equitably; and the nations upon earth, thou wilt guide them. Selah.

content: 5 Let the peoples praise thee, O God; let all the peoples praise thee.
content_old: 5 Let the peoples praise thee, O God; let all the peoples praise thee.

content: 6 The earth will yield her increase; God, our God, will bless us:
content_old: 6 The earth will yield her increase; God, our God, will bless us:

content: To the chief Musician. Of David. A Psalm: a Song.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Of David. A Psalm: a Song.

content: 1 Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered, and let them that hate him flee before him.
content_old: 1 Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered, and let them that hate him flee before him.

content: 2 As smoke is driven, thou wilt drive them away; as wax melteth before the fire, the wicked shall perish at the presence of God.
content_old: 2 As smoke is driven, thou wilt drive them away; as wax melteth before the fire, the wicked shall perish at the presence of God.

content: 3 But the righteous shall rejoice: they shall exult before God and be glad with joy.
content_old: 3 But the righteous shall rejoice: they shall exult before God and be glad with joy.

content: 4 Sing unto God, sing forth his name; cast up a way for him that rideth in the deserts: his name is Jah; and rejoice before him.
content_old: 4 Sing unto God, sing forth his name; cast up a way for him that rideth in the deserts: his name is Jah; and rejoice before him.

content: 5 A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
content_old: 5 A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.

content: 6 God maketh the solitary into families; those that were bound he bringeth out into prosperity: but the rebellious dwell in a parched land.
content_old: 6 God maketh the solitary into families; those that were bound he bringeth out into prosperity: but the rebellious dwell in a parched land.

content: 7 O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness—(Selah) —
content_old: 7 O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness—(Selah) —

content: 8 The earth trembled, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God, yon Sinai, at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
content_old: 8 The earth trembled, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God, yon Sinai, at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

content: 9 Thou, O God, didst pour a plentiful rain upon thine inheritance, and when it was weary thou strengthenedst it.
content_old: 9 Thou, O God, didst pour a plentiful rain upon thine inheritance, and when it was weary thou strengthenedst it.

content: 10 Thy flock hath dwelt therein: thou hast prepared in thy goodness, for the afflicted, O God!
content_old: 10 Thy flock hath dwelt therein: thou hast prepared in thy goodness, for the afflicted, O God!

content: 11 The Lord gives the word: great the host of the publishers.
content_old: 11 The Lord gives the word: great the host of the publishers.

content: 12 Kings of armies flee; they flee, and she that tarrieth at home divideth the spoil.
content_old: 12 Kings of armies flee; they flee, and she that tarrieth at home divideth the spoil.

content: 13 Though ye have lain among the sheepfolds, ye shall be as wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with green gold.
content_old: 13 Though ye have lain among the sheepfolds, ye shall be as wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with green gold.

content: 14 When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it became snow-white as Zalmon.
content_old: 14 When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it became snow-white as Zalmon.

content: 15 As mount Bashan is the mount of God, a many-peaked mountain, as mount Bashan.
content_old: 15 As mount Bashan is the mount of God, a many-peaked mountain, as mount Bashan.

content: 16 Why do ye look with envy, ye many-peaked mountains, upon the mount that God hath desired for his abode? yea, Jehovah will dwell there for ever.
content_old: 16 Why do ye look with envy, ye many-peaked mountains, upon the mount that God hath desired for his abode? yea, Jehovah will dwell there for ever.

content: 17 The chariots of God are twenty thousand, thousands upon thousands; the Lord is among them: it is a Sinai in holiness.
content_old: 17 The chariots of God are twenty thousand, thousands upon thousands; the Lord is among them: it is a Sinai in holiness.

content: 18 Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts in Man, and even for the rebellious, for the dwelling there of Jah Elohim.
content_old: 18 Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts in Man, and even for the rebellious, for the dwelling there of Jah Elohim.

content: 19 Blessed be the Lord: day by day doth he load us with good, the •God who is our salvation. Selah.
content_old: 19 Blessed be the Lord: day by day doth he load us with good, the •God who is our salvation. Selah.

content: 20 Our •God is the •God of salvation; and with Jehovah, the Lord, are the goings forth even from death.
content_old: 20 Our •God is the •God of salvation; and with Jehovah, the Lord, are the goings forth even from death.

content: 21 Verily God will smite the head of his enemies, the hairy scalp of him that goeth on still in his trespasses.
content_old: 21 Verily God will smite the head of his enemies, the hairy scalp of him that goeth on still in his trespasses.

content: 22 The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring them again from the depth of the sea;
content_old: 22 The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring them again from the depth of the sea;

content: 23 That thou mayest dip thy foot in blood: the tongue of thy dogs has its portion from enemies.
content_old: 23 That thou mayest dip thy foot in blood: the tongue of thy dogs has its portion from enemies.

content: 24 They have seen thy goings, O God, the goings of my •God, my King, in the sanctuary.
content_old: 24 They have seen thy goings, O God, the goings of my •God, my King, in the sanctuary.

content: 25 The singers went before, the players on stringed instruments after, in the midst of maidens playing on tabrets.
content_old: 25 The singers went before, the players on stringed instruments after, in the midst of maidens playing on tabrets.

content: 26 In the congregations bless ye God, the Lord, —ye from the fountain of Israel.
content_old: 26 In the congregations bless ye God, the Lord, —ye from the fountain of Israel.

content: 27 There is little Benjamin, their ruler; the princes of Judah, their company; the princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.
content_old: 27 There is little Benjamin, their ruler; the princes of Judah, their company; the princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.

content: 28 Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.
content_old: 28 Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.

content: 29 Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.
content_old: 29 Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.

content: 30 Rebuke the beast of the reeds, the assembly of the strong, with the calves of the peoples: every one submitteth himself with pieces of silver. Scatter the peoples that delight in war.
content_old: 30 Rebuke the beast of the reeds, the assembly of the strong, with the calves of the peoples: every one submitteth himself with pieces of silver. Scatter the peoples that delight in war.

content: 31 Great ones shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall quickly stretch out her hands unto God.
content_old: 31 Great ones shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall quickly stretch out her hands unto God.

content: 32 Ye kingdoms of the earth, sing unto God; sing psalms of the Lord, (Selah,)
content_old: 32 Ye kingdoms of the earth, sing unto God; sing psalms of the Lord, (Selah,)

content: 33 Of him that rideth upon the heavens, the heavens which are of old: lo, he uttereth his voice, a mighty voice.
content_old: 33 Of him that rideth upon the heavens, the heavens which are of old: lo, he uttereth his voice, a mighty voice.

content: 34 Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
content_old: 34 Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

content: To the chief Musician. Upon Shoshannim. A Psalm of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Upon Shoshannim. A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.
content_old: 1 Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.

content: 2 I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing; I am come into the depths of waters, and the flood overfloweth me.
content_old: 2 I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing; I am come into the depths of waters, and the flood overfloweth me.

content: 3 I am weary with my crying, my throat is parched; mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.
content_old: 3 I am weary with my crying, my throat is parched; mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.

content: 4 They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head; they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.
content_old: 4 They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head; they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.

content: 5 Thou, O God, knowest my foolishness, and my trespasses are not hidden from thee.
content_old: 5 Thou, O God, knowest my foolishness, and my trespasses are not hidden from thee.

content: 6 Let not them that wait on thee, Lord, Jehovah of hosts, be ashamed through me; let not those that seek thee be confounded through me, O God of Israel.
content_old: 6 Let not them that wait on thee, Lord, Jehovah of hosts, be ashamed through me; let not those that seek thee be confounded through me, O God of Israel.

content: 7 Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; confusion hath covered my face.
content_old: 7 Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; confusion hath covered my face.

content: 8 I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s sons;
content_old: 8 I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s sons;

content: 9 For the zeal of thy house hath devoured me, and the reproaches of them that reproach thee have fallen upon me.
content_old: 9 For the zeal of thy house hath devoured me, and the reproaches of them that reproach thee have fallen upon me.

content: 10 And I wept, my soul was fasting: that also was to my reproach; —
content_old: 10 And I wept, my soul was fasting: that also was to my reproach; —

content: 11 And I made sackcloth my garment: then I became a proverb to them.
content_old: 11 And I made sackcloth my garment: then I became a proverb to them.

content: 12 They that sit in the gate talk of me, and I am the song of the drunkards.
content_old: 12 They that sit in the gate talk of me, and I am the song of the drunkards.

content: 13 But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, Jehovah, in an acceptable time: O God, in the abundance of thy loving-kindness answer me, according to the truth of thy salvation:
content_old: 13 But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, Jehovah, in an acceptable time: O God, in the abundance of thy loving-kindness answer me, according to the truth of thy salvation:

content: 14 Deliver me out of the mire, let me not sink; let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the depths of waters.
content_old: 14 Deliver me out of the mire, let me not sink; let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the depths of waters.

content: 15 Let not the flood of waters overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up; and let not the pit shut its mouth upon me.
content_old: 15 Let not the flood of waters overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up; and let not the pit shut its mouth upon me.

content: 16 Answer me, O Jehovah; for thy loving-kindness is good: according to the abundance of thy tender mercies, turn toward me;
content_old: 16 Answer me, O Jehovah; for thy loving-kindness is good: according to the abundance of thy tender mercies, turn toward me;

content: 17 And hide not thy face from thy servant, for I am in trouble: answer me speedily.
content_old: 17 And hide not thy face from thy servant, for I am in trouble: answer me speedily.

content: 18 Draw nigh unto my soul, be its redeemer; ransom me because of mine enemies.
content_old: 18 Draw nigh unto my soul, be its redeemer; ransom me because of mine enemies.

content: 19 Thou knowest my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.
content_old: 19 Thou knowest my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.

content: 20 Reproach hath broken my heart, and I am overwhelmed: and I looked for sympathy, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.
content_old: 20 Reproach hath broken my heart, and I am overwhelmed: and I looked for sympathy, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.

content: 21 Yea, they gave me gall for my food, and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
content_old: 21 Yea, they gave me gall for my food, and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

content: 22 Let their table become a snare before them, and their very welfare a trap;
content_old: 22 Let their table become a snare before them, and their very welfare a trap;

content: 23 Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not, and make their loins continually to shake.
content_old: 23 Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not, and make their loins continually to shake.

content: 24 Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let the fierceness of thine anger take hold of them.
content_old: 24 Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let the fierceness of thine anger take hold of them.

content: 25 Let their habitation be desolate; let there be no dweller in their tents.
content_old: 25 Let their habitation be desolate; let there be no dweller in their tents.

content: 26 For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten, and they talk for the sorrow of those whom thou hast wounded.
content_old: 26 For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten, and they talk for the sorrow of those whom thou hast wounded.

content: 27 Add iniquity unto their iniquity, and let them not come into thy righteousness.
content_old: 27 Add iniquity unto their iniquity, and let them not come into thy righteousness.

content: 28 Let them be blotted out of the book of life, and not be written with the righteous.
content_old: 28 Let them be blotted out of the book of life, and not be written with the righteous.

content: 29 But I am afflicted and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me secure on high.
content_old: 29 But I am afflicted and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me secure on high.

content: 30 I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving;
content_old: 30 I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving;

content: 31 And it shall please Jehovah more than an ox, —a bullock with horns and cloven hoofs.
content_old: 31 And it shall please Jehovah more than an ox, —a bullock with horns and cloven hoofs.

content: 32 The meek shall see it, they shall be glad; ye that seek God, your heart shall live.
content_old: 32 The meek shall see it, they shall be glad; ye that seek God, your heart shall live.

content: 33 For Jehovah heareth the needy, and despiseth not his prisoners.
content_old: 33 For Jehovah heareth the needy, and despiseth not his prisoners.

content: 34 Let heavens and earth praise him; the seas, and everything that moveth therein.
content_old: 34 Let heavens and earth praise him; the seas, and everything that moveth therein.

content: 35 For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah; and they shall dwell there, and possess it:
content_old: 35 For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah; and they shall dwell there, and possess it:

content: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David: to bring to remembrance.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David: to bring to remembrance.

content: 1 Make haste, O God, to deliver me; Jehovah, hasten to my help.
content_old: 1 Make haste, O God, to deliver me; Jehovah, hasten to my help.

content: 2 Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion that seek after my soul; let them be turned backward and confounded that take pleasure in mine adversity;
content_old: 2 Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion that seek after my soul; let them be turned backward and confounded that take pleasure in mine adversity;

content: 3 Let them turn back because of their shame that say, Aha! Aha!
content_old: 3 Let them turn back because of their shame that say, Aha! Aha!

content: 4 Let all those that seek thee be glad and rejoice in thee, and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified!
content_old: 4 Let all those that seek thee be glad and rejoice in thee, and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified!

content: 1 In thee, Jehovah, do I trust: let me never be ashamed.
content_old: 1 In thee, Jehovah, do I trust: let me never be ashamed.

content: 2 Deliver me in thy righteousness, and rescue me; incline thine ear unto me, and save me.
content_old: 2 Deliver me in thy righteousness, and rescue me; incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

content: 3 Be to me a rock of habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.
content_old: 3 Be to me a rock of habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.

content: 4 My God, rescue me out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
content_old: 4 My God, rescue me out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

content: 5 For thou art my hope, O Lord Jehovah, my confidence from my youth.
content_old: 5 For thou art my hope, O Lord Jehovah, my confidence from my youth.

content: 6 On thee have I been stayed from the womb; from the bowels of my mother thou didst draw me forth: my praise shall be continually of thee.
content_old: 6 On thee have I been stayed from the womb; from the bowels of my mother thou didst draw me forth: my praise shall be continually of thee.

content: 7 I have been as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.
content_old: 7 I have been as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.

content: 8 My mouth shall be filled with thy praise, with thy glory, all the day.
content_old: 8 My mouth shall be filled with thy praise, with thy glory, all the day.

content: 9 Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.
content_old: 9 Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.

content: 10 For mine enemies speak against me, and they that watch for my soul consult together,
content_old: 10 For mine enemies speak against me, and they that watch for my soul consult together,

content: 11 Saying, God hath forsaken him; pursue and seize him, for there is none to deliver.
content_old: 11 Saying, God hath forsaken him; pursue and seize him, for there is none to deliver.

content: 12 O God, be not far from me; my God, hasten to my help.
content_old: 12 O God, be not far from me; my God, hasten to my help.

content: 13 Let them be ashamed, let them be consumed, that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.
content_old: 13 Let them be ashamed, let them be consumed, that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.

content: 14 But as for me, I will hope continually, and will praise thee yet more and more.
content_old: 14 But as for me, I will hope continually, and will praise thee yet more and more.

content: 15 My mouth shall declare thy righteousness, and thy salvation all the day: for I know not the numbers thereof.
content_old: 15 My mouth shall declare thy righteousness, and thy salvation all the day: for I know not the numbers thereof.

content: 16 I will go in the might of the Lord Jehovah; I will recall thy righteousness, thine alone.
content_old: 16 I will go in the might of the Lord Jehovah; I will recall thy righteousness, thine alone.

content: 17 O God, thou hast taught me from my youth, and hitherto have I proclaimed thy marvellous works:
content_old: 17 O God, thou hast taught me from my youth, and hitherto have I proclaimed thy marvellous works:

content: 18 Now also, when I am old and greyheaded, O God, forsake me not, until I have proclaimed thine arm unto this generation, thy might to every one that is to come.
content_old: 18 Now also, when I am old and greyheaded, O God, forsake me not, until I have proclaimed thine arm unto this generation, thy might to every one that is to come.

content: 19 And thy righteousness, O God, reacheth on high, thou who hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee?
content_old: 19 And thy righteousness, O God, reacheth on high, thou who hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee?

content: 20 Thou, who hast shewn us many and sore troubles, wilt revive us again, and wilt bring us up again from the depths of the earth;
content_old: 20 Thou, who hast shewn us many and sore troubles, wilt revive us again, and wilt bring us up again from the depths of the earth;

content: 21 Thou wilt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.
content_old: 21 Thou wilt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.

content: 22 I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, my God; unto thee will I sing psalms with the harp, thou holy One of Israel.
content_old: 22 I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, my God; unto thee will I sing psalms with the harp, thou holy One of Israel.

content: 23 My lips shall exult when I sing psalms unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
content_old: 23 My lips shall exult when I sing psalms unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.

content: For Solomon.
content_old: For Solomon.

content: 1 O God, give the king thy judgments, and thy righteousness unto the king’s son.
content_old: 1 O God, give the king thy judgments, and thy righteousness unto the king’s son.

content: 2 He will judge thy people with righteousness, and thine afflicted with judgment.
content_old: 2 He will judge thy people with righteousness, and thine afflicted with judgment.

content: 3 The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the hills, by righteousness.
content_old: 3 The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the hills, by righteousness.

content: 4 He will do justice to the afflicted of the people; he will save the children of the needy, and will break in pieces the oppressor.
content_old: 4 He will do justice to the afflicted of the people; he will save the children of the needy, and will break in pieces the oppressor.

content: 5 They shall fear thee as long as sun and moon endure, from generation to generation.
content_old: 5 They shall fear thee as long as sun and moon endure, from generation to generation.

content: 6 He shall come down like rain on the mown grass, as showers that water the earth.
content_old: 6 He shall come down like rain on the mown grass, as showers that water the earth.

content: 7 In his days shall the righteous flourish, and abundance of peace till the moon be no more.
content_old: 7 In his days shall the righteous flourish, and abundance of peace till the moon be no more.

content: 8 And he shall have dominion from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.
content_old: 8 And he shall have dominion from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

content: 9 The dwellers in the desert shall bow before him, and his enemies shall lick the dust.
content_old: 9 The dwellers in the desert shall bow before him, and his enemies shall lick the dust.

content: 10 The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall render presents; the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer tribute:
content_old: 10 The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall render presents; the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer tribute:

content: 11 Yea, all kings shall bow down before him; all nations shall serve him.
content_old: 11 Yea, all kings shall bow down before him; all nations shall serve him.

content: 12 For he will deliver the needy who crieth, and the afflicted, who hath no helper;
content_old: 12 For he will deliver the needy who crieth, and the afflicted, who hath no helper;

content: 13 He will have compassion on the poor and needy, and will save the souls of the needy:
content_old: 13 He will have compassion on the poor and needy, and will save the souls of the needy:

content: 14 He will redeem their souls from oppression and violence, and precious shall their blood be in his sight.
content_old: 14 He will redeem their souls from oppression and violence, and precious shall their blood be in his sight.

content: 15 And he shall live; and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba; and prayer shall be made for him continually: all the day shall he be blessed.
content_old: 15 And he shall live; and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba; and prayer shall be made for him continually: all the day shall he be blessed.

content: 16 There shall be abundance of corn in the earth, upon the top of the mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon; and they of the city shall bloom like the herb of the earth.
content_old: 16 There shall be abundance of corn in the earth, upon the top of the mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon; and they of the city shall bloom like the herb of the earth.

content: 17 His name shall endure for ever; his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and men shall bless themselves in him; all nations shall call him blessed.
content_old: 17 His name shall endure for ever; his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and men shall bless themselves in him; all nations shall call him blessed.

content: 18 Blessed be Jehovah Elohim, the God of Israel, who alone doeth wondrous things!
content_old: 18 Blessed be Jehovah Elohim, the God of Israel, who alone doeth wondrous things!

content: 19 And blessed be his glorious name for ever! and let the whole earth be filled with his glory! Amen, and Amen.
content_old: 19 And blessed be his glorious name for ever! and let the whole earth be filled with his glory! Amen, and Amen.

content: A Psalm of Asaph.
content_old: A Psalm of Asaph.

content: 1 Truly God is good to Israel, to such as are of a pure heart.
content_old: 1 Truly God is good to Israel, to such as are of a pure heart.

content: 2 But as for me, my feet were almost gone, my steps had well nigh slipped;
content_old: 2 But as for me, my feet were almost gone, my steps had well nigh slipped;

content: 3 For I was envious at the arrogant, seeing the prosperity of the wicked.
content_old: 3 For I was envious at the arrogant, seeing the prosperity of the wicked.

content: 4 For they have no pangs in their death, and their body is well nourished;
content_old: 4 For they have no pangs in their death, and their body is well nourished;

content: 5 They have not the hardships of mankind, neither are they plagued like other men:
content_old: 5 They have not the hardships of mankind, neither are they plagued like other men:

content: 6 Therefore pride encompasseth them as a neck-chain, violence covereth them as a garment;
content_old: 6 Therefore pride encompasseth them as a neck-chain, violence covereth them as a garment;

content: 7 Their eyes stand out from fatness, they exceed the imaginations of their heart:
content_old: 7 Their eyes stand out from fatness, they exceed the imaginations of their heart:

content: 8 They mock and speak wickedly of oppression, they speak loftily:
content_old: 8 They mock and speak wickedly of oppression, they speak loftily:

content: 9 They set their mouth in the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
content_old: 9 They set their mouth in the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

content: 10 Therefore his people turn hither, and waters in fulness are wrung out to them.
content_old: 10 Therefore his people turn hither, and waters in fulness are wrung out to them.

content: 11 And they say, How can •God know, and is there knowledge in the Most High?
content_old: 11 And they say, How can •God know, and is there knowledge in the Most High?

content: 12 Behold, these are the wicked, and they prosper in the world: they heap up riches.
content_old: 12 Behold, these are the wicked, and they prosper in the world: they heap up riches.

content: 13 Truly have I purified my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency:
content_old: 13 Truly have I purified my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency:

content: 14 For all the day have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.
content_old: 14 For all the day have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.

content: 15 If I said, I will speak thus, behold, I should be faithless to the generation of thy children.
content_old: 15 If I said, I will speak thus, behold, I should be faithless to the generation of thy children.

content: 16 When I thought to be able to know this, it was a grievous task in mine eyes;
content_old: 16 When I thought to be able to know this, it was a grievous task in mine eyes;

content: 17 Until I went into the sanctuaries of •God; then understood I their end.
content_old: 17 Until I went into the sanctuaries of •God; then understood I their end.

content: 18 Truly thou settest them in slippery places, thou castest them down in ruins.
content_old: 18 Truly thou settest them in slippery places, thou castest them down in ruins.

content: 19 How are they suddenly made desolate! they pass away, consumed with terrors.
content_old: 19 How are they suddenly made desolate! they pass away, consumed with terrors.

content: 20 As a dream, when one awaketh, wilt thou, Lord, on arising despise their image.
content_old: 20 As a dream, when one awaketh, wilt thou, Lord, on arising despise their image.

content: 21 When my heart was in a ferment, and I was pricked in my reins,
content_old: 21 When my heart was in a ferment, and I was pricked in my reins,

content: 22 Then I was brutish and knew nothing; I was as a beast with thee.
content_old: 22 Then I was brutish and knew nothing; I was as a beast with thee.

content: 23 Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden my right hand;
content_old: 23 Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden my right hand;

content: 24 Thou wilt guide me by thy counsel, and after the glory, thou wilt receive me.
content_old: 24 Thou wilt guide me by thy counsel, and after the glory, thou wilt receive me.

content: 25 Whom have I in the heavens? and there is none upon earth I desire beside thee.
content_old: 25 Whom have I in the heavens? and there is none upon earth I desire beside thee.

content: 26 My flesh and my heart faileth: God is the rock of my heart and my portion for ever.
content_old: 26 My flesh and my heart faileth: God is the rock of my heart and my portion for ever.

content: 27 For behold, they that are far from thee shall perish; thou destroyest every one that goeth a whoring from thee.
content_old: 27 For behold, they that are far from thee shall perish; thou destroyest every one that goeth a whoring from thee.

content: An instruction: of Asaph.
content_old: An instruction: of Asaph.

content: 1 Why, O God, hast thou cast off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?
content_old: 1 Why, O God, hast thou cast off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?

content: 2 Remember thine assembly, which thou hast purchased of old, which thou hast redeemed to be the portion of thine inheritance, this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.
content_old: 2 Remember thine assembly, which thou hast purchased of old, which thou hast redeemed to be the portion of thine inheritance, this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.

content: 3 Lift up thy steps unto the perpetual desolations: everything in the sanctuary hath the enemy destroyed.
content_old: 3 Lift up thy steps unto the perpetual desolations: everything in the sanctuary hath the enemy destroyed.

content: 4 Thine adversaries roar in the midst of thy place of assembly; they set up their signs for signs.
content_old: 4 Thine adversaries roar in the midst of thy place of assembly; they set up their signs for signs.

content: 5 A man was known as he could lift up axes in the thicket of trees;
content_old: 5 A man was known as he could lift up axes in the thicket of trees;

content: 6 And now they break down its carved work altogether, with hatchets and hammers.
content_old: 6 And now they break down its carved work altogether, with hatchets and hammers.

content: 7 They have set on fire thy sanctuary, they have profaned the habitation of thy name to the ground.
content_old: 7 They have set on fire thy sanctuary, they have profaned the habitation of thy name to the ground.

content: 8 They said in their heart, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all •God’s places of assembly in the land.
content_old: 8 They said in their heart, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all •God’s places of assembly in the land.

content: 9 We see not our signs; there is no more any prophet, neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.
content_old: 9 We see not our signs; there is no more any prophet, neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.

content: 10 How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy contemn thy name for ever?
