content_old: 10 How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy contemn thy name for ever?

content: 11 Why withdrawest thou thy hand, and thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom: consume them.
content_old: 11 Why withdrawest thou thy hand, and thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom: consume them.

content: 12 But God is my king of old, accomplishing deliverances in the midst of the earth.
content_old: 12 But God is my king of old, accomplishing deliverances in the midst of the earth.

content: 13 Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength; thou didst break the heads of the monsters on the waters:
content_old: 13 Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength; thou didst break the heads of the monsters on the waters:

content: 14 Thou didst break in pieces the heads of leviathan, thou gavest him to be meat to those that people the desert.
content_old: 14 Thou didst break in pieces the heads of leviathan, thou gavest him to be meat to those that people the desert.

content: 15 Thou didst cleave fountain and torrent, thou driedst up ever-flowing rivers.
content_old: 15 Thou didst cleave fountain and torrent, thou driedst up ever-flowing rivers.

content: 16 The day is thine, the night also is thine; thou hast prepared the moon and the sun:
content_old: 16 The day is thine, the night also is thine; thou hast prepared the moon and the sun:

content: 17 Thou hast set all the borders of the earth; summer and winter—thou didst form them.
content_old: 17 Thou hast set all the borders of the earth; summer and winter—thou didst form them.

content: 18 Remember this, that an enemy hath reproached Jehovah, and a foolish people have contemned thy name.
content_old: 18 Remember this, that an enemy hath reproached Jehovah, and a foolish people have contemned thy name.

content: 19 Give not up the soul of thy turtle-dove unto the wild beast; forget not the troop of thine afflicted for ever.
content_old: 19 Give not up the soul of thy turtle-dove unto the wild beast; forget not the troop of thine afflicted for ever.

content: 20 Have respect unto the covenant; for the dark places of the earth are full of the dwellings of violence.
content_old: 20 Have respect unto the covenant; for the dark places of the earth are full of the dwellings of violence.

content: 21 Oh let not the oppressed one return ashamed; let the afflicted and needy praise thy name.
content_old: 21 Oh let not the oppressed one return ashamed; let the afflicted and needy praise thy name.

content: 22 Rise up, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee all the day;
content_old: 22 Rise up, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee all the day;

content: To the chief Musician. ‘Destroy not.’ A Psalm of Asaph: a Song.
content_old: To the chief Musician. ‘Destroy not.’ A Psalm of Asaph: a Song.

content: 1 Unto thee we give thanks, O God, we give thanks; and thy name is near: thy marvellous works declare it.
content_old: 1 Unto thee we give thanks, O God, we give thanks; and thy name is near: thy marvellous works declare it.

content: 2 When I shall receive the assembly, I will judge with equity.
content_old: 2 When I shall receive the assembly, I will judge with equity.

content: 3 The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: I have established its pillars. Selah.
content_old: 3 The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: I have established its pillars. Selah.

content: 4 I said unto the boastful, Boast not; and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:
content_old: 4 I said unto the boastful, Boast not; and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:

content: 5 Lift not up your horn on high; speak not arrogantly with a stiff neck.
content_old: 5 Lift not up your horn on high; speak not arrogantly with a stiff neck.

content: 6 For not from the east nor from the west, nor yet from the south doth exaltation come:
content_old: 6 For not from the east nor from the west, nor yet from the south doth exaltation come:

content: 7 For God is the judge; he putteth down one and exalteth another.
content_old: 7 For God is the judge; he putteth down one and exalteth another.

content: 8 For in the hand of Jehovah there is a cup, and it foameth with wine, it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the same; yea, the dregs thereof shall all the wicked of the earth drain off, and drink.
content_old: 8 For in the hand of Jehovah there is a cup, and it foameth with wine, it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the same; yea, the dregs thereof shall all the wicked of the earth drain off, and drink.

content: 9 But as for me, I will declare for ever; I will sing psalms to the God of Jacob.
content_old: 9 But as for me, I will declare for ever; I will sing psalms to the God of Jacob.

content: To the chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A Psalm of Asaph: a Song.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A Psalm of Asaph: a Song.

content: 1 In Judah is God known, his name is great in Israel;
content_old: 1 In Judah is God known, his name is great in Israel;

content: 2 And in Salem is his tent, and his dwelling-place in Zion.
content_old: 2 And in Salem is his tent, and his dwelling-place in Zion.

content: 3 There broke he the flashings of the bow, shield and sword and battle. Selah.
content_old: 3 There broke he the flashings of the bow, shield and sword and battle. Selah.

content: 4 More glorious art thou, more excellent, than the mountains of prey.
content_old: 4 More glorious art thou, more excellent, than the mountains of prey.

content: 5 The stout-hearted are made a spoil, they have slept their sleep; and none of the men of might have found their hands.
content_old: 5 The stout-hearted are made a spoil, they have slept their sleep; and none of the men of might have found their hands.

content: 6 At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.
content_old: 6 At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.

content: 7 Thou, thou art to be feared, and who can stand before thee when once thou art angry?
content_old: 7 Thou, thou art to be feared, and who can stand before thee when once thou art angry?

content: 8 Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from the heavens; the earth feared, and was still,
content_old: 8 Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from the heavens; the earth feared, and was still,

content: 9 When God rose up to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.
content_old: 9 When God rose up to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.

content: 10 For the fury of man shall praise thee; the remainder of fury wilt thou gird on thyself.
content_old: 10 For the fury of man shall praise thee; the remainder of fury wilt thou gird on thyself.

content: 11 Vow and pay unto Jehovah your God: let all that are round about him bring presents unto him that is to be feared.
content_old: 11 Vow and pay unto Jehovah your God: let all that are round about him bring presents unto him that is to be feared.

content: To the chief Musician. On Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A Psalm.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A Psalm.

content: 1 My voice is unto God, and I will cry; my voice is unto God, and he will give ear unto me.
content_old: 1 My voice is unto God, and I will cry; my voice is unto God, and he will give ear unto me.

content: 2 In the day of my trouble, I sought the Lord: my hand was stretched out in the night, and slacked not; my soul refused to be comforted.
content_old: 2 In the day of my trouble, I sought the Lord: my hand was stretched out in the night, and slacked not; my soul refused to be comforted.

content: 3 I remembered God, and I moaned; I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.
content_old: 3 I remembered God, and I moaned; I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

content: 4 Thou holdest open mine eyelids; I am full of disquiet and cannot speak.
content_old: 4 Thou holdest open mine eyelids; I am full of disquiet and cannot speak.

content: 5 I consider the days of old, the years of ancient times.
content_old: 5 I consider the days of old, the years of ancient times.

content: 6 I remember my song in the night; I muse in mine own heart, and my spirit maketh diligent search.
content_old: 6 I remember my song in the night; I muse in mine own heart, and my spirit maketh diligent search.

content: 7 Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?
content_old: 7 Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?

content: 8 Hath his loving-kindness ceased for ever? hath his word come to an end from generation to generation?
content_old: 8 Hath his loving-kindness ceased for ever? hath his word come to an end from generation to generation?

content: 9 Hath •God forgotten to be gracious? or hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.
content_old: 9 Hath •God forgotten to be gracious? or hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.

content: 10 Then said I, This is my weakness: —the years of the right hand of the Most High
content_old: 10 Then said I, This is my weakness: —the years of the right hand of the Most High

content: 11 Will I remember, —the works of Jah; for I will remember thy wonders of old,
content_old: 11 Will I remember, —the works of Jah; for I will remember thy wonders of old,

content: 12 And I will meditate upon all thy work, and muse upon thy doings.
content_old: 12 And I will meditate upon all thy work, and muse upon thy doings.

content: 13 O God, thy way is in the sanctuary: who is so great a •god as God?
content_old: 13 O God, thy way is in the sanctuary: who is so great a •god as God?

content: 14 Thou art the •God that doest wonders; thou hast declared thy strength among the peoples.
content_old: 14 Thou art the •God that doest wonders; thou hast declared thy strength among the peoples.

content: 15 Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
content_old: 15 Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

content: 16 The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they trembled, yea, the depths were troubled:
content_old: 16 The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they trembled, yea, the depths were troubled:

content: 17 The thick clouds poured out water; the skies sent out a sound, yea, thine arrows went abroad:
content_old: 17 The thick clouds poured out water; the skies sent out a sound, yea, thine arrows went abroad:

content: 18 The voice of thy thunder was in the whirlwind, lightnings lit up the world; the earth was troubled and it quaked.
content_old: 18 The voice of thy thunder was in the whirlwind, lightnings lit up the world; the earth was troubled and it quaked.

content: 19 Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths are in the great waters; and thy footsteps are not known.
content_old: 19 Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths are in the great waters; and thy footsteps are not known.

content: An instruction. Of Asaph.
content_old: An instruction. Of Asaph.

content: 1 Give ear, O my people, to my law; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
content_old: 1 Give ear, O my people, to my law; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

content: 2 I will open my mouth in a parable; I will utter riddles from of old,
content_old: 2 I will open my mouth in a parable; I will utter riddles from of old,

content: 3 Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us:
content_old: 3 Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us:

content: 4 We will not hide them from their sons, shewing forth to the generation to come the praises of Jehovah, and his strength, and his marvellous works which he hath done.
content_old: 4 We will not hide them from their sons, shewing forth to the generation to come the praises of Jehovah, and his strength, and his marvellous works which he hath done.

content: 5 For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children;
content_old: 5 For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children;

content: 6 That the generation to come might know them, the children that should be born; that they might rise up and tell them to their children,
content_old: 6 That the generation to come might know them, the children that should be born; that they might rise up and tell them to their children,

content: 7 And that they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of •God, but observe his commandments;
content_old: 7 And that they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of •God, but observe his commandments;

content: 8 And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation that prepared not their heart, and whose spirit was not stedfast with •God.
content_old: 8 And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation that prepared not their heart, and whose spirit was not stedfast with •God.

content: 9 The sons of Ephraim, armed bowmen, turned back in the day of battle.
content_old: 9 The sons of Ephraim, armed bowmen, turned back in the day of battle.

content: 10 They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;
content_old: 10 They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;

content: 11 And forgot his doings, and his marvellous works which he had shewn them.
content_old: 11 And forgot his doings, and his marvellous works which he had shewn them.

content: 12 In the sight of their fathers had he done wonders, in the land of Egypt, the field of Zoan.
content_old: 12 In the sight of their fathers had he done wonders, in the land of Egypt, the field of Zoan.

content: 13 He clave the sea, and caused them to pass through; and made the waters to stand as a heap;
content_old: 13 He clave the sea, and caused them to pass through; and made the waters to stand as a heap;

content: 14 And he led them with a cloud in the daytime, and all the night with the light of fire.
content_old: 14 And he led them with a cloud in the daytime, and all the night with the light of fire.

content: 15 He clave rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the depths, abundantly;
content_old: 15 He clave rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the depths, abundantly;

content: 16 And he brought streams out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.
content_old: 16 And he brought streams out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

content: 17 Yet they still went on sinning against him, provoking the Most High in the desert;
content_old: 17 Yet they still went on sinning against him, provoking the Most High in the desert;

content: 18 And they tempted •God in their heart, by asking meat for their lust;
content_old: 18 And they tempted •God in their heart, by asking meat for their lust;

content: 19 And they spoke against God: they said, Is •God able to prepare a table in the wilderness?
content_old: 19 And they spoke against God: they said, Is •God able to prepare a table in the wilderness?

content: 20 Behold, he smote the rock, and waters gushed out, and streams overflowed; is he able to give bread also, or provide flesh for his people?
content_old: 20 Behold, he smote the rock, and waters gushed out, and streams overflowed; is he able to give bread also, or provide flesh for his people?

content: 21 Therefore Jehovah heard, and was wroth; and fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also went up against Israel:
content_old: 21 Therefore Jehovah heard, and was wroth; and fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also went up against Israel:

content: 22 Because they believed not in God, and confided not in his salvation;
content_old: 22 Because they believed not in God, and confided not in his salvation;

content: 23 Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and had opened the doors of the heavens,
content_old: 23 Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and had opened the doors of the heavens,

content: 24 And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them the corn of the heavens.
content_old: 24 And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them the corn of the heavens.

content: 25 Man did eat the bread of the mighty; he sent them provision to the full.
content_old: 25 Man did eat the bread of the mighty; he sent them provision to the full.

content: 26 He caused the east wind to rise in the heavens, and by his strength he brought the south wind;
content_old: 26 He caused the east wind to rise in the heavens, and by his strength he brought the south wind;

content: 27 And he rained flesh upon them as dust, and feathered fowl as the sand of the seas,
content_old: 27 And he rained flesh upon them as dust, and feathered fowl as the sand of the seas,

content: 28 And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations:
content_old: 28 And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations:

content: 29 And they did eat, and were well filled; for that they lusted after, he brought to them.
content_old: 29 And they did eat, and were well filled; for that they lusted after, he brought to them.

content: 30 They were not alienated from their lust, their meat was yet in their mouths,
content_old: 30 They were not alienated from their lust, their meat was yet in their mouths,

content: 31 When the anger of God went up against them; and he slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
content_old: 31 When the anger of God went up against them; and he slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.

content: 32 For all this, they sinned still, and believed not in his marvellous works;
content_old: 32 For all this, they sinned still, and believed not in his marvellous works;

content: 33 And he consumed their days in vanity, and their years in terror.
content_old: 33 And he consumed their days in vanity, and their years in terror.

content: 34 When he slew them, then they sought him, and returned and sought early after •God;
content_old: 34 When he slew them, then they sought him, and returned and sought early after •God;

content: 35 And they remembered that God was their rock, and •God, the Most High, their redeemer.
content_old: 35 And they remembered that God was their rock, and •God, the Most High, their redeemer.

content: 36 But they flattered him with their mouth, and lied unto him with their tongue;
content_old: 36 But they flattered him with their mouth, and lied unto him with their tongue;

content: 37 For their heart was not firm toward him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.
content_old: 37 For their heart was not firm toward him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.

content: 38 But he was merciful: he forgave the iniquity, and destroyed them not; but many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his fury:
content_old: 38 But he was merciful: he forgave the iniquity, and destroyed them not; but many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his fury:

content: 39 And he remembered that they were flesh, a breath that passeth away and cometh not again.
content_old: 39 And he remembered that they were flesh, a breath that passeth away and cometh not again.

content: 40 How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!
content_old: 40 How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!

content: 41 And they turned again and tempted •God, and grieved the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 41 And they turned again and tempted •God, and grieved the Holy One of Israel.

content: 42 They remembered not his hand, the day when he delivered them from the oppressor,
content_old: 42 They remembered not his hand, the day when he delivered them from the oppressor,

content: 43 How he set his signs in Egypt, and his miracles in the field of Zoan;
content_old: 43 How he set his signs in Egypt, and his miracles in the field of Zoan;

content: 44 And turned their rivers into blood, and their streams, that they could not drink;
content_old: 44 And turned their rivers into blood, and their streams, that they could not drink;

content: 45 He sent dog-flies among them, which devoured them, and frogs, which destroyed them;
content_old: 45 He sent dog-flies among them, which devoured them, and frogs, which destroyed them;

content: 46 And he gave their increase unto the caterpillar, and their labour unto the locust;
content_old: 46 And he gave their increase unto the caterpillar, and their labour unto the locust;

content: 47 He killed their vines with hail, and their sycamore trees with hail-stones;
content_old: 47 He killed their vines with hail, and their sycamore trees with hail-stones;

content: 48 And he delivered up their cattle to the hail, and their flocks to thunderbolts.
content_old: 48 And he delivered up their cattle to the hail, and their flocks to thunderbolts.

content: 49 He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and distress, —a mission of angels of woes.
content_old: 49 He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and distress, —a mission of angels of woes.

content: 50 He made a way for his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;
content_old: 50 He made a way for his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

content: 51 And he smote all the firstborn in Egypt, the first-fruits of their vigour in the tents of Ham.
content_old: 51 And he smote all the firstborn in Egypt, the first-fruits of their vigour in the tents of Ham.

content: 52 And he made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock;
content_old: 52 And he made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock;

content: 53 And he led them safely, so that they were without fear; and the sea covered their enemies.
content_old: 53 And he led them safely, so that they were without fear; and the sea covered their enemies.

content: 54 And he brought them to his holy border, this mountain, which his right hand purchased;
content_old: 54 And he brought them to his holy border, this mountain, which his right hand purchased;

content: 55 And he drove out the nations before them, and allotted them for an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
content_old: 55 And he drove out the nations before them, and allotted them for an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

content: 56 But they tempted and provoked God, the Most High, and kept not his testimonies,
content_old: 56 But they tempted and provoked God, the Most High, and kept not his testimonies,

content: 57 And they drew back and dealt treacherously like their fathers: they turned like a deceitful bow.
content_old: 57 And they drew back and dealt treacherously like their fathers: they turned like a deceitful bow.

content: 58 And they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
content_old: 58 And they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

content: 59 God heard, and was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:
content_old: 59 God heard, and was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

content: 60 And he forsook the tabernacle at Shiloh, the tent where he had dwelt among men,
content_old: 60 And he forsook the tabernacle at Shiloh, the tent where he had dwelt among men,

content: 61 And gave his strength into captivity, and his glory into the hand of the oppressor;
content_old: 61 And gave his strength into captivity, and his glory into the hand of the oppressor;

content: 62 And delivered up his people unto the sword, and was very wroth with his inheritance:
content_old: 62 And delivered up his people unto the sword, and was very wroth with his inheritance:

content: 63 The fire consumed their young men, and their maidens were not praised in nuptial song;
content_old: 63 The fire consumed their young men, and their maidens were not praised in nuptial song;

content: 64 Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows made no lamentation.
content_old: 64 Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows made no lamentation.

content: 65 Then the Lord awoke as one out of sleep, like a mighty man that shouteth aloud by reason of wine;
content_old: 65 Then the Lord awoke as one out of sleep, like a mighty man that shouteth aloud by reason of wine;

content: 66 And he smote his adversaries in the hinder part, and put them to everlasting reproach.
content_old: 66 And he smote his adversaries in the hinder part, and put them to everlasting reproach.

content: 67 And he rejected the tent of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim,
content_old: 67 And he rejected the tent of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim,

content: 68 But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved;
content_old: 68 But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved;

content: 69 And he built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth which he hath founded for ever.
content_old: 69 And he built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth which he hath founded for ever.

content: 70 And he chose David his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:
content_old: 70 And he chose David his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

content: 71 From following the suckling-ewes, he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
content_old: 71 From following the suckling-ewes, he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

content: A Psalm of Asaph.
content_old: A Psalm of Asaph.

content: 1 O God, the nations are come into thine inheritance: thy holy temple have they defiled; they have laid Jerusalem in heaps.
content_old: 1 O God, the nations are come into thine inheritance: thy holy temple have they defiled; they have laid Jerusalem in heaps.

content: 2 The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowl of the heavens, the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth:
content_old: 2 The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowl of the heavens, the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth:

content: 3 Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.
content_old: 3 Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.

content: 4 We are become a reproach to our neighbours, a mockery and a derision to them that are round about us.
content_old: 4 We are become a reproach to our neighbours, a mockery and a derision to them that are round about us.

content: 5 How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou be angry for ever? Shall thy jealousy burn like fire?
content_old: 5 How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou be angry for ever? Shall thy jealousy burn like fire?

content: 6 Pour out thy fury upon the nations that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that call not upon thy name:
content_old: 6 Pour out thy fury upon the nations that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that call not upon thy name:

content: 7 For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his habitation.
content_old: 7 For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his habitation.

content: 8 Remember not against us the iniquities of our forefathers; let thy tender mercies speedily come to meet us: for we are brought very low.
content_old: 8 Remember not against us the iniquities of our forefathers; let thy tender mercies speedily come to meet us: for we are brought very low.

content: 9 Help us, O God of our salvation, because of the glory of thy name; and deliver us, and forgive our sins, for thy name’s sake.
content_old: 9 Help us, O God of our salvation, because of the glory of thy name; and deliver us, and forgive our sins, for thy name’s sake.

content: 10 Wherefore should the nations say, Where is their God? Let the avenging of the blood of thy servants that is shed be known among the nations in our sight.
content_old: 10 Wherefore should the nations say, Where is their God? Let the avenging of the blood of thy servants that is shed be known among the nations in our sight.

content: 11 Let the groaning of the prisoner come before thee; according to the greatness of thine arm, preserve those that are appointed to die;
content_old: 11 Let the groaning of the prisoner come before thee; according to the greatness of thine arm, preserve those that are appointed to die;

content: 12 And render unto our neighbours, sevenfold into their bosom, their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.
content_old: 12 And render unto our neighbours, sevenfold into their bosom, their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.

content: To the chief Musician. On Shoshannim-Eduth. Of Asaph. A Psalm.
content_old: To the chief Musician. On Shoshannim-Eduth. Of Asaph. A Psalm.

content: 1 Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that sittest between the cherubim, shine forth.
content_old: 1 Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that sittest between the cherubim, shine forth.

content: 2 Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up thy strength, and come to our deliverance.
content_old: 2 Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up thy strength, and come to our deliverance.

content: 3 O God, restore us; and cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
content_old: 3 O God, restore us; and cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.

content: 4 Jehovah, God of hosts, how long will thine anger smoke against the prayer of thy people?
content_old: 4 Jehovah, God of hosts, how long will thine anger smoke against the prayer of thy people?

content: 5 Thou hast fed them with the bread of tears, and given them tears to drink in large measure:
content_old: 5 Thou hast fed them with the bread of tears, and given them tears to drink in large measure:

content: 6 Thou hast made us a strife unto our neighbours, and our enemies mock among themselves.
content_old: 6 Thou hast made us a strife unto our neighbours, and our enemies mock among themselves.

content: 7 Restore us, O God of hosts; and cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
content_old: 7 Restore us, O God of hosts; and cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.

content: 8 Thou broughtest a vine out of Egypt; thou didst cast out the nations, and plant it:
content_old: 8 Thou broughtest a vine out of Egypt; thou didst cast out the nations, and plant it:

content: 9 Thou preparedst space before it, and it took deep root, and filled the land;
content_old: 9 Thou preparedst space before it, and it took deep root, and filled the land;

content: 10 The mountains were covered with its shadow, and the branches thereof were like cedars of •God;
content_old: 10 The mountains were covered with its shadow, and the branches thereof were like cedars of •God;

content: 11 It sent out its boughs unto the sea, and its shoots unto the river.
content_old: 11 It sent out its boughs unto the sea, and its shoots unto the river.

content: 12 Why hast thou broken down its fences, so that all who pass by the way do pluck it?
content_old: 12 Why hast thou broken down its fences, so that all who pass by the way do pluck it?

content: 13 The boar out of the forest doth waste it, and the beast of the field doth feed off it.
content_old: 13 The boar out of the forest doth waste it, and the beast of the field doth feed off it.

content: 14 O God of hosts, return, we beseech thee; look down from the heavens, and behold, and visit this vine;
content_old: 14 O God of hosts, return, we beseech thee; look down from the heavens, and behold, and visit this vine;

content: 15 Even the stock which thy right hand hath planted, and the young plant thou madest strong for thyself.
content_old: 15 Even the stock which thy right hand hath planted, and the young plant thou madest strong for thyself.

content: 16 It is burned with fire, it is cut down; they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
content_old: 16 It is burned with fire, it is cut down; they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.

content: 17 Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou hast made strong for thyself.
content_old: 17 Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou hast made strong for thyself.

content: 18 So will we not go back from thee. Revive us, and we will call upon thy name.
content_old: 18 So will we not go back from thee. Revive us, and we will call upon thy name.

content: To the chief Musician. Upon the Gittith. A Psalm of Asaph.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Upon the Gittith. A Psalm of Asaph.

content: 1 Sing ye joyously unto God our strength, shout aloud unto the God of Jacob;
content_old: 1 Sing ye joyously unto God our strength, shout aloud unto the God of Jacob;

content: 2 Raise a song, and sound the tambour, the pleasant harp with the lute.
content_old: 2 Raise a song, and sound the tambour, the pleasant harp with the lute.

content: 3 Blow the trumpet at the new moon, at the set time, on our feast day:
content_old: 3 Blow the trumpet at the new moon, at the set time, on our feast day:

content: 4 For this is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob;
content_old: 4 For this is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob;

content: 5 He ordained it in Joseph for a testimony, when he went forth over the land of Egypt, where I heard a language that I knew not.
content_old: 5 He ordained it in Joseph for a testimony, when he went forth over the land of Egypt, where I heard a language that I knew not.

content: 6 I removed his shoulder from the burden; his hands were freed from the basket.
content_old: 6 I removed his shoulder from the burden; his hands were freed from the basket.

content: 7 Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder; I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
content_old: 7 Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder; I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

content: 8 Hear, my people, and I will testify unto thee; O Israel, if thou wouldest hearken unto me!
content_old: 8 Hear, my people, and I will testify unto thee; O Israel, if thou wouldest hearken unto me!

content: 9 There shall no strange •god be in thee, neither shalt thou worship any foreign •god.
content_old: 9 There shall no strange •god be in thee, neither shalt thou worship any foreign •god.

content: 10 I am Jehovah thy God, that brought thee up out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
content_old: 10 I am Jehovah thy God, that brought thee up out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

content: 11 But my people hearkened not to my voice, and Israel would none of me.
content_old: 11 But my people hearkened not to my voice, and Israel would none of me.

content: 12 So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ stubbornness: they walked after their own counsels.
content_old: 12 So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ stubbornness: they walked after their own counsels.

content: 13 Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, that Israel had walked in my ways!
content_old: 13 Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, that Israel had walked in my ways!

content: 14 I would soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.
content_old: 14 I would soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.

content: 15 The haters of Jehovah would have come cringing unto him; but their time would have been for ever.
content_old: 15 The haters of Jehovah would have come cringing unto him; but their time would have been for ever.

content: A Psalm of Asaph.
content_old: A Psalm of Asaph.

content: 1 God standeth in the assembly of •God, he judgeth among the gods.
content_old: 1 God standeth in the assembly of •God, he judgeth among the gods.

content: 2 How long will ye judge unrighteously, and accept the person of the wicked? Selah.
content_old: 2 How long will ye judge unrighteously, and accept the person of the wicked? Selah.

content: 3 Judge the poor and the fatherless, do justice to the afflicted and the destitute;
content_old: 3 Judge the poor and the fatherless, do justice to the afflicted and the destitute;

content: 4 Rescue the poor and needy, deliver them out of the hand of the wicked.
content_old: 4 Rescue the poor and needy, deliver them out of the hand of the wicked.

content: 5 They know not, neither do they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are moved.
content_old: 5 They know not, neither do they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are moved.

content: 6 I have said, Ye are gods, and all of you are children of the Most High;
content_old: 6 I have said, Ye are gods, and all of you are children of the Most High;

content: 7 But ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.
content_old: 7 But ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.

content: A Song; a Psalm of Asaph.
content_old: A Song; a Psalm of Asaph.

content: 1 O God, keep not silence; hold not thy peace, and be not still, O •God:
content_old: 1 O God, keep not silence; hold not thy peace, and be not still, O •God:

content: 2 For behold, thine enemies make a tumult; and they that hate thee lift up the head.
content_old: 2 For behold, thine enemies make a tumult; and they that hate thee lift up the head.

content: 3 They take crafty counsel against thy people, and consult against thy hidden ones:
content_old: 3 They take crafty counsel against thy people, and consult against thy hidden ones:

content: 4 They say, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation, and let the name of Israel be mentioned no more.
content_old: 4 They say, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation, and let the name of Israel be mentioned no more.

content: 5 For they have consulted together with one heart: they have made an alliance together against thee.
content_old: 5 For they have consulted together with one heart: they have made an alliance together against thee.

content: 6 The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagarites;
content_old: 6 The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagarites;

content: 7 Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia, with the inhabitants of Tyre;
content_old: 7 Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia, with the inhabitants of Tyre;

content: 8 Asshur also is joined with them: they are an arm to the sons of Lot. Selah.
content_old: 8 Asshur also is joined with them: they are an arm to the sons of Lot. Selah.

content: 9 Do unto them as to Midian; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the torrent of Kishon:
content_old: 9 Do unto them as to Midian; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the torrent of Kishon:

content: 10 Who were destroyed at Endor; they became as dung for the ground.
content_old: 10 Who were destroyed at Endor; they became as dung for the ground.

content: 11 Make their nobles as Oreb and as Zeeb; and all their chiefs as Zebah and as Zalmunna.
content_old: 11 Make their nobles as Oreb and as Zeeb; and all their chiefs as Zebah and as Zalmunna.

content: 12 For they have said, Let us take to ourselves God’s dwelling-places in possession.
content_old: 12 For they have said, Let us take to ourselves God’s dwelling-places in possession.

content: 13 O my God, make them like a whirling thing, like stubble before the wind.
content_old: 13 O my God, make them like a whirling thing, like stubble before the wind.

content: 14 As fire burneth a forest, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire,
content_old: 14 As fire burneth a forest, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire,

content: 15 So pursue them with thy tempest, and terrify them with thy whirlwind.
content_old: 15 So pursue them with thy tempest, and terrify them with thy whirlwind.

content: 16 Fill their faces with shame, that they may seek thy name, O Jehovah.
content_old: 16 Fill their faces with shame, that they may seek thy name, O Jehovah.

content: 17 Let them be put to shame and be dismayed for ever, and let them be confounded and perish:
content_old: 17 Let them be put to shame and be dismayed for ever, and let them be confounded and perish:

content: To the chief Musician. Upon the Gittith. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Upon the Gittith. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm.

content: 1 How amiable are thy tabernacles, O Jehovah of hosts!
content_old: 1 How amiable are thy tabernacles, O Jehovah of hosts!

content: 2 My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of Jehovah; my heart and my flesh cry out for the living •God.
content_old: 2 My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of Jehovah; my heart and my flesh cry out for the living •God.

content: 3 Yea, the sparrow hath found a house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she layeth her young, thine altars, O Jehovah of hosts, my King and my God.
content_old: 3 Yea, the sparrow hath found a house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she layeth her young, thine altars, O Jehovah of hosts, my King and my God.

content: 4 Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be constantly praising thee. Selah.
content_old: 4 Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be constantly praising thee. Selah.

content: 5 Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee, —they, in whose heart are the highways.
content_old: 5 Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee, —they, in whose heart are the highways.

content: 6 Passing through the valley of Baca, they make it a well-spring; yea, the early rain covereth it with blessings.
content_old: 6 Passing through the valley of Baca, they make it a well-spring; yea, the early rain covereth it with blessings.

content: 7 They go from strength to strength: each one will appear before God in Zion.
content_old: 7 They go from strength to strength: each one will appear before God in Zion.

content: 8 Jehovah, God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
content_old: 8 Jehovah, God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

content: 9 Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.
content_old: 9 Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.

content: 10 For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather stand at the threshold of the house of my God, than dwell in the tents of wickedness.
content_old: 10 For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather stand at the threshold of the house of my God, than dwell in the tents of wickedness.

content: 11 For Jehovah Elohim is a sun and shield: Jehovah will give grace and glory; no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
content_old: 11 For Jehovah Elohim is a sun and shield: Jehovah will give grace and glory; no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

content: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm.

content: 1 Thou hast been favourable, Jehovah, unto thy land; thou hast turned the captivity of Jacob:
content_old: 1 Thou hast been favourable, Jehovah, unto thy land; thou hast turned the captivity of Jacob:

content: 2 Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people; thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
content_old: 2 Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people; thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.

content: 3 Thou hast withdrawn all thy wrath; thou hast turned from the fierceness of thine anger.
content_old: 3 Thou hast withdrawn all thy wrath; thou hast turned from the fierceness of thine anger.

content: 4 Bring us back, O God of our salvation, and cause thine indignation toward us to cease.
content_old: 4 Bring us back, O God of our salvation, and cause thine indignation toward us to cease.

content: 5 Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine anger from generation to generation?
content_old: 5 Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine anger from generation to generation?

content: 6 Wilt thou not revive us again, that thy people may rejoice in thee?
content_old: 6 Wilt thou not revive us again, that thy people may rejoice in thee?

content: 7 Shew us thy loving-kindness, O Jehovah, and grant us thy salvation.
content_old: 7 Shew us thy loving-kindness, O Jehovah, and grant us thy salvation.

content: 8 I will hear what •God, Jehovah, will speak; for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his godly ones: but let them not turn again to folly.
content_old: 8 I will hear what •God, Jehovah, will speak; for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his godly ones: but let them not turn again to folly.

content: 9 Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.
content_old: 9 Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.

content: 10 Loving-kindness and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other:
content_old: 10 Loving-kindness and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other:

content: 11 Truth shall spring out of the earth, and righteousness shall look down from the heavens.
content_old: 11 Truth shall spring out of the earth, and righteousness shall look down from the heavens.

content: 12 Jehovah also will give what is good, and our land shall yield its increase.
content_old: 12 Jehovah also will give what is good, and our land shall yield its increase.

content: A Prayer of David.
content_old: A Prayer of David.

content: 1 Incline thine ear, Jehovah, answer me; for I am afflicted and needy.
content_old: 1 Incline thine ear, Jehovah, answer me; for I am afflicted and needy.

content: 2 Keep my soul, for I am godly; O thou my God, save thy servant who confideth in thee.
content_old: 2 Keep my soul, for I am godly; O thou my God, save thy servant who confideth in thee.

content: 3 Be gracious unto me, O Lord; for unto thee do I call all the day.
content_old: 3 Be gracious unto me, O Lord; for unto thee do I call all the day.

content: 4 Rejoice the soul of thy servant; for unto thee, Lord, do I lift up my soul.
content_old: 4 Rejoice the soul of thy servant; for unto thee, Lord, do I lift up my soul.

content: 5 For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive, and art of great loving-kindness unto all that call upon thee.
content_old: 5 For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive, and art of great loving-kindness unto all that call upon thee.

content: 6 Give ear, O Jehovah, unto my prayer, and attend to the voice of my supplications.
content_old: 6 Give ear, O Jehovah, unto my prayer, and attend to the voice of my supplications.

content: 7 In the day of my distress I will call upon thee, for thou wilt answer me.
content_old: 7 In the day of my distress I will call upon thee, for thou wilt answer me.

content: 8 Among the gods there is none like unto thee, Lord, and there is nothing like unto thy works.
content_old: 8 Among the gods there is none like unto thee, Lord, and there is nothing like unto thy works.

content: 9 All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord, and shall glorify thy name.
content_old: 9 All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord, and shall glorify thy name.

content: 10 For thou art great, and doest wondrous things: thou art God, thou alone.
content_old: 10 For thou art great, and doest wondrous things: thou art God, thou alone.

content: 11 Teach me thy way, Jehovah; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.
content_old: 11 Teach me thy way, Jehovah; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.

content: 12 I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart; and I will glorify thy name for evermore.
content_old: 12 I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart; and I will glorify thy name for evermore.

content: 13 For great is thy loving-kindness toward me, and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.
content_old: 13 For great is thy loving-kindness toward me, and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.

content: 14 O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assembly of the violent seek after my soul, and they have not set thee before them.
content_old: 14 O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assembly of the violent seek after my soul, and they have not set thee before them.

content: 15 But thou, Lord, art a •God merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in goodness and truth.
content_old: 15 But thou, Lord, art a •God merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in goodness and truth.

content: 16 Turn toward me, and be gracious unto me; give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.
content_old: 16 Turn toward me, and be gracious unto me; give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.

content: Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm. A Song.
content_old: Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm. A Song.

content: 1 His foundation is in the mountains of holiness.
content_old: 1 His foundation is in the mountains of holiness.

content: 2 Jehovah loveth the gates of Zion more than all the habitations of Jacob.
content_old: 2 Jehovah loveth the gates of Zion more than all the habitations of Jacob.

content: 3 Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.
content_old: 3 Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.

content: 4 I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon among them that know me; behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia: this man was born there.
content_old: 4 I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon among them that know me; behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia: this man was born there.

content: 5 And of Zion it shall be said, This one and that one was born in her; and the Most High himself shall establish her.
content_old: 5 And of Zion it shall be said, This one and that one was born in her; and the Most High himself shall establish her.

content: 6 Jehovah will count, when he inscribeth the peoples, This man was born there. Selah.
content_old: 6 Jehovah will count, when he inscribeth the peoples, This man was born there. Selah.

content: A Song, a Psalm for the sons of Korah. To the chief Musician. Upon Mahalath Leannoth. An instruction. Of Heman the Ezrahite.
content_old: A Song, a Psalm for the sons of Korah. To the chief Musician. Upon Mahalath Leannoth. An instruction. Of Heman the Ezrahite.

content: 1 Jehovah, God of my salvation, I have cried by day and in the night before thee.
content_old: 1 Jehovah, God of my salvation, I have cried by day and in the night before thee.

content: 2 Let my prayer come before thee; incline thine ear unto my cry.
content_old: 2 Let my prayer come before thee; incline thine ear unto my cry.

content: 3 For my soul is full of troubles, and my life draweth nigh to Sheol.
content_old: 3 For my soul is full of troubles, and my life draweth nigh to Sheol.

content: 4 I am reckoned with them that go down into the pit; I am as a man that hath no strength:
content_old: 4 I am reckoned with them that go down into the pit; I am as a man that hath no strength:

content: 5 Prostrate among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave; whom thou rememberest no more, and who are cut off from thy hand.
content_old: 5 Prostrate among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave; whom thou rememberest no more, and who are cut off from thy hand.

content: 6 Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in dark places, in the deeps.
content_old: 6 Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in dark places, in the deeps.

content: 7 Thy fury lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.
content_old: 7 Thy fury lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.

content: 8 Thou hast put my familiar friends far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.
content_old: 8 Thou hast put my familiar friends far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.

content: 9 Mine eye consumeth by reason of affliction. Upon thee, Jehovah, have I called every day; I have stretched out my hands unto thee.
content_old: 9 Mine eye consumeth by reason of affliction. Upon thee, Jehovah, have I called every day; I have stretched out my hands unto thee.

content: 10 Wilt thou do wonders to the dead? shall the shades arise and praise thee? Selah.
content_old: 10 Wilt thou do wonders to the dead? shall the shades arise and praise thee? Selah.

content: 11 Shall thy loving-kindness be declared in the grave? thy faithfulness in Destruction?
content_old: 11 Shall thy loving-kindness be declared in the grave? thy faithfulness in Destruction?

content: 12 Shall thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
content_old: 12 Shall thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

content: 13 But as for me, Jehovah, I cry unto thee, and in the morning my prayer cometh before thee.
content_old: 13 But as for me, Jehovah, I cry unto thee, and in the morning my prayer cometh before thee.

content: 14 Why, O Jehovah, castest thou off my soul? why hidest thou thy face from me?
content_old: 14 Why, O Jehovah, castest thou off my soul? why hidest thou thy face from me?

content: 15 I am afflicted and expiring from my youth up; I suffer thy terrors, and I am distracted.
content_old: 15 I am afflicted and expiring from my youth up; I suffer thy terrors, and I am distracted.

content: 16 Thy fierce anger hath gone over me; thy terrors have brought me to nought:
content_old: 16 Thy fierce anger hath gone over me; thy terrors have brought me to nought:

content: 17 They have surrounded me all the day like water; they have compassed me about together.
content_old: 17 They have surrounded me all the day like water; they have compassed me about together.

content: An instruction. Of Ethan the Ezrahite.
content_old: An instruction. Of Ethan the Ezrahite.

content: 1 I will sing of the loving-kindness of Jehovah for ever; with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness from generation to generation.
content_old: 1 I will sing of the loving-kindness of Jehovah for ever; with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness from generation to generation.

content: 2 For I said, Loving-kindness shall be built up for ever; in the very heavens wilt thou establish thy faithfulness.
content_old: 2 For I said, Loving-kindness shall be built up for ever; in the very heavens wilt thou establish thy faithfulness.

content: 3 I have made a covenant with mine elect, I have sworn unto David my servant:
content_old: 3 I have made a covenant with mine elect, I have sworn unto David my servant:

content: 4 Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne from generation to generation. Selah.
content_old: 4 Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne from generation to generation. Selah.

content: 5 And the heavens shall celebrate thy wonders, O Jehovah, and thy faithfulness in the congregation of the saints.
content_old: 5 And the heavens shall celebrate thy wonders, O Jehovah, and thy faithfulness in the congregation of the saints.

content: 6 For who in the heaven can be compared to Jehovah? who among the sons of the mighty shall be likened to Jehovah?
content_old: 6 For who in the heaven can be compared to Jehovah? who among the sons of the mighty shall be likened to Jehovah?

content: 7 •God is greatly to be feared in the council of the saints, and terrible for all that are round about him.
content_old: 7 •God is greatly to be feared in the council of the saints, and terrible for all that are round about him.

content: 8 Jehovah, God of hosts, who is like unto thee, the strong Jah? And thy faithfulness is round about thee.
content_old: 8 Jehovah, God of hosts, who is like unto thee, the strong Jah? And thy faithfulness is round about thee.

content: 9 Thou rulest the pride of the sea: when its waves arise, thou stillest them.
content_old: 9 Thou rulest the pride of the sea: when its waves arise, thou stillest them.

content: 10 Thou hast crushed Rahab as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with the arm of thy strength.
content_old: 10 Thou hast crushed Rahab as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with the arm of thy strength.

content: 11 Thine are the heavens, the earth also is thine; the world and its fulness, thou hast founded them.
content_old: 11 Thine are the heavens, the earth also is thine; the world and its fulness, thou hast founded them.

content: 12 The north and the south, thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon triumph in thy name.
content_old: 12 The north and the south, thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon triumph in thy name.

content: 13 Thine is the arm of might: strong is thy hand, high is thy right hand.
content_old: 13 Thine is the arm of might: strong is thy hand, high is thy right hand.

content: 14 Righteousness and judgment are the foundation of thy throne; loving-kindness and truth go before thy face.
content_old: 14 Righteousness and judgment are the foundation of thy throne; loving-kindness and truth go before thy face.

content: 15 Blessed is the people that know the shout of joy: they walk, O Jehovah, in the light of thy countenance.
content_old: 15 Blessed is the people that know the shout of joy: they walk, O Jehovah, in the light of thy countenance.

content: 16 In thy name are they joyful all the day, and in thy righteousness are they exalted.
content_old: 16 In thy name are they joyful all the day, and in thy righteousness are they exalted.

content: 17 For thou art the glory of their strength; and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.
content_old: 17 For thou art the glory of their strength; and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.

content: 18 For Jehovah is our shield, and the Holy One of Israel, our king.
content_old: 18 For Jehovah is our shield, and the Holy One of Israel, our king.

content: 19 Then thou spakest in vision of thy Holy One, and saidst, I have laid help upon a mighty one; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
content_old: 19 Then thou spakest in vision of thy Holy One, and saidst, I have laid help upon a mighty one; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

content: 20 I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:
content_old: 20 I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:

content: 21 With whom my hand shall be established; and mine arm shall strengthen him.
content_old: 21 With whom my hand shall be established; and mine arm shall strengthen him.

content: 22 No enemy shall exact upon him, nor the son of wickedness afflict him;
content_old: 22 No enemy shall exact upon him, nor the son of wickedness afflict him;

content: 23 But I will beat down his adversaries before his face, and will smite them that hate him.
content_old: 23 But I will beat down his adversaries before his face, and will smite them that hate him.

content: 24 And my faithfulness and my loving-kindness shall be with him, and by my name shall his horn be exalted.
content_old: 24 And my faithfulness and my loving-kindness shall be with him, and by my name shall his horn be exalted.

content: 25 And I will set his hand in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.
content_old: 25 And I will set his hand in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

content: 26 He shall call unto me, Thou art my father, my •God, and the rock of my salvation;
content_old: 26 He shall call unto me, Thou art my father, my •God, and the rock of my salvation;

content: 27 And as to me, I will make him firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.
content_old: 27 And as to me, I will make him firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.

content: 28 My loving-kindness will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him;
content_old: 28 My loving-kindness will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him;

content: 29 And I will establish his seed for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
content_old: 29 And I will establish his seed for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

content: 30 If his sons forsake my law, and walk not in mine ordinances;
content_old: 30 If his sons forsake my law, and walk not in mine ordinances;

content: 31 If they profane my statutes, and keep not my commandments:
content_old: 31 If they profane my statutes, and keep not my commandments:

content: 32 Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.
content_old: 32 Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

content: 33 Nevertheless my loving-kindness will I not utterly take from him, nor belie my faithfulness;
content_old: 33 Nevertheless my loving-kindness will I not utterly take from him, nor belie my faithfulness;

content: 34 My covenant will I not profane, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
content_old: 34 My covenant will I not profane, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.

content: 35 Once have I sworn by my holiness; I will not lie unto David:
content_old: 35 Once have I sworn by my holiness; I will not lie unto David:

content: 36 His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me;
content_old: 36 His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me;

content: 37 It shall be established for ever as the moon, and the witness in the sky is firm. Selah.
content_old: 37 It shall be established for ever as the moon, and the witness in the sky is firm. Selah.

content: 38 But thou hast rejected and cast off; thou hast been very wroth with thine anointed:
content_old: 38 But thou hast rejected and cast off; thou hast been very wroth with thine anointed:

content: 39 Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant; thou hast profaned his crown to the ground:
content_old: 39 Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant; thou hast profaned his crown to the ground:

content: 40 Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strongholds to ruin.
content_old: 40 Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strongholds to ruin.

content: 41 All that pass by the way plunder him; he is become a reproach to his neighbours.
content_old: 41 All that pass by the way plunder him; he is become a reproach to his neighbours.

content: 42 Thou hast exalted the right hand of his oppressors; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice:
content_old: 42 Thou hast exalted the right hand of his oppressors; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice:

content: 43 Yea, thou hast turned back the edge of his sword, and hast not made him stand in the battle.
content_old: 43 Yea, thou hast turned back the edge of his sword, and hast not made him stand in the battle.

content: 44 Thou hast made his brightness to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground;
content_old: 44 Thou hast made his brightness to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground;

content: 45 The days of his youth hast thou shortened; thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.
content_old: 45 The days of his youth hast thou shortened; thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

content: 46 How long, Jehovah, wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy fury burn like fire?
content_old: 46 How long, Jehovah, wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy fury burn like fire?

content: 47 Remember, as regards me, what life is. Wherefore hast thou created all the children of men to be vanity?
content_old: 47 Remember, as regards me, what life is. Wherefore hast thou created all the children of men to be vanity?

content: 48 What man liveth, and shall not see death? Shall he deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah.
content_old: 48 What man liveth, and shall not see death? Shall he deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah.

content: 49 Where, Lord, are thy former loving-kindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy faithfulness?
content_old: 49 Where, Lord, are thy former loving-kindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy faithfulness?

content: 50 Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants—that I bear in my bosom that of all the mighty peoples—
content_old: 50 Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants—that I bear in my bosom that of all the mighty peoples—

content: 51 Wherewith thine enemies, O Jehovah, have reproached, wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.
content_old: 51 Wherewith thine enemies, O Jehovah, have reproached, wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.

content: A Prayer of Moses, the man of God.
content_old: A Prayer of Moses, the man of God.

content: 1 Lord, thou hast been our dwelling-place in all generations.
content_old: 1 Lord, thou hast been our dwelling-place in all generations.

content: 2 Before the mountains were brought forth, and thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from eternity to eternity thou art •God.
content_old: 2 Before the mountains were brought forth, and thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from eternity to eternity thou art •God.

content: 3 Thou makest mortal man to return to dust, and sayest, Return, children of men.
content_old: 3 Thou makest mortal man to return to dust, and sayest, Return, children of men.

content: 4 For a thousand years, in thy sight, are as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.
content_old: 4 For a thousand years, in thy sight, are as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.

content: 5 Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: in the morning they are like grass that groweth up:
content_old: 5 Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: in the morning they are like grass that groweth up:

content: 6 In the morning it flourisheth and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down and withereth.
content_old: 6 In the morning it flourisheth and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down and withereth.

content: 7 For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy fury are we troubled.
content_old: 7 For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy fury are we troubled.

content: 8 Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
content_old: 8 Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.

content: 9 For all our days pass away in thy wrath: we spend our years as a passing thought.
content_old: 9 For all our days pass away in thy wrath: we spend our years as a passing thought.

content: 10 The days of our years are threescore years and ten; and if, by reason of strength, they be fourscore years, yet their pride is labour and vanity, for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.
content_old: 10 The days of our years are threescore years and ten; and if, by reason of strength, they be fourscore years, yet their pride is labour and vanity, for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.

content: 11 Who knoweth the power of thine anger? and thy wrath according to the fear of thee?
content_old: 11 Who knoweth the power of thine anger? and thy wrath according to the fear of thee?

content: 12 So teach us to number our days, that we may acquire a wise heart.
content_old: 12 So teach us to number our days, that we may acquire a wise heart.

content: 13 Return, Jehovah: how long? and let it repent thee concerning thy servants.
content_old: 13 Return, Jehovah: how long? and let it repent thee concerning thy servants.

content: 14 Satisfy us early with thy loving-kindness; that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
content_old: 14 Satisfy us early with thy loving-kindness; that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.

content: 15 Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us, according to the years wherein we have seen evil.
content_old: 15 Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us, according to the years wherein we have seen evil.

content: 16 Let thy work appear unto thy servants, and thy majesty unto their sons.
content_old: 16 Let thy work appear unto thy servants, and thy majesty unto their sons.

content: 1 He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
content_old: 1 He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

content: 2 I say of Jehovah, My refuge and my fortress; my God, I will confide in him.
content_old: 2 I say of Jehovah, My refuge and my fortress; my God, I will confide in him.

content: 3 Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the destructive pestilence.
content_old: 3 Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the destructive pestilence.

content: 4 He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou find refuge: his truth is a shield and buckler.
content_old: 4 He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou find refuge: his truth is a shield and buckler.

content: 5 Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night, for the arrow that flieth by day,
content_old: 5 Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night, for the arrow that flieth by day,

content: 6 For the pestilence that walketh in darkness, for the destruction that wasteth at noonday.
content_old: 6 For the pestilence that walketh in darkness, for the destruction that wasteth at noonday.

content: 7 A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.
content_old: 7 A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.

content: 8 Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold, and see the reward of the wicked.
content_old: 8 Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold, and see the reward of the wicked.

content: 9 Because thou hast made Jehovah, my refuge, the Most High, thy dwelling-place,
content_old: 9 Because thou hast made Jehovah, my refuge, the Most High, thy dwelling-place,

content: 10 There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy tent.
content_old: 10 There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy tent.

content: 11 For he shall give his angels charge concerning thee, to keep thee in all thy ways:
content_old: 11 For he shall give his angels charge concerning thee, to keep thee in all thy ways:

content: 12 They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
content_old: 12 They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

content: 13 Thou shalt tread upon the lion and the adder; the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under foot.
content_old: 13 Thou shalt tread upon the lion and the adder; the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under foot.

content: 14 Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him; I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.
content_old: 14 Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him; I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.

content: 15 He shall call upon me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honour him.
content_old: 15 He shall call upon me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honour him.

content: A Psalm, a Song, for the Sabbath day.
content_old: A Psalm, a Song, for the Sabbath day.

content: 1 It is good to give thanks unto Jehovah, and to sing psalms unto thy name, O Most High;
content_old: 1 It is good to give thanks unto Jehovah, and to sing psalms unto thy name, O Most High;

content: 2 To declare thy loving-kindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness in the nights,
content_old: 2 To declare thy loving-kindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness in the nights,

content: 3 Upon an instrument of ten strings and upon the lute; upon the Higgaion with the harp.
content_old: 3 Upon an instrument of ten strings and upon the lute; upon the Higgaion with the harp.

content: 4 For thou, Jehovah, hast made me glad through thy work; I will triumph in the works of thy hands.
content_old: 4 For thou, Jehovah, hast made me glad through thy work; I will triumph in the works of thy hands.

content: 5 Jehovah, how great are thy works! Thy thoughts are very deep:
content_old: 5 Jehovah, how great are thy works! Thy thoughts are very deep:

content: 6 A brutish man knoweth not, neither doth a fool understand it.
content_old: 6 A brutish man knoweth not, neither doth a fool understand it.

content: 7 When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity flourish, it is that they may be destroyed for ever.
content_old: 7 When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity flourish, it is that they may be destroyed for ever.

content: 8 And thou, Jehovah, art on high for evermore.
content_old: 8 And thou, Jehovah, art on high for evermore.

content: 9 For lo, thine enemies, O Jehovah, for lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
content_old: 9 For lo, thine enemies, O Jehovah, for lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

content: 10 But my horn shalt thou exalt like a buffalo’s: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
content_old: 10 But my horn shalt thou exalt like a buffalo’s: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.

content: 11 And mine eye shall see its desire on mine enemies; mine ears shall hear it of the evil-doers that rise up against me.
content_old: 11 And mine eye shall see its desire on mine enemies; mine ears shall hear it of the evil-doers that rise up against me.

content: 12 The righteous shall shoot forth like a palm-tree; he shall grow like a cedar on Lebanon.
content_old: 12 The righteous shall shoot forth like a palm-tree; he shall grow like a cedar on Lebanon.

content: 13 Those that are planted in the house of Jehovah shall flourish in the courts of our God:
content_old: 13 Those that are planted in the house of Jehovah shall flourish in the courts of our God:

content: 14 They are still vigorous in old age, they are full of sap and green;
content_old: 14 They are still vigorous in old age, they are full of sap and green;

content: 1 Jehovah reigneth, he hath clothed himself with majesty: Jehovah hath clothed himself, he hath girded himself with strength; yea, the world is established, it shall not be moved.
content_old: 1 Jehovah reigneth, he hath clothed himself with majesty: Jehovah hath clothed himself, he hath girded himself with strength; yea, the world is established, it shall not be moved.

content: 2 Thy throne is established of old; thou art from eternity.
content_old: 2 Thy throne is established of old; thou art from eternity.

content: 3 The floods lifted up, O Jehovah, the floods lifted up their voice; the floods lifted up their roaring waves.
content_old: 3 The floods lifted up, O Jehovah, the floods lifted up their voice; the floods lifted up their roaring waves.

content: 4 Jehovah on high is mightier than the voices of many waters, than the mighty breakers of the sea.
content_old: 4 Jehovah on high is mightier than the voices of many waters, than the mighty breakers of the sea.

content: 1 O •God of vengeances, Jehovah, •God of vengeances, shine forth;
content_old: 1 O •God of vengeances, Jehovah, •God of vengeances, shine forth;

content: 2 Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth, render the reward to the proud.
content_old: 2 Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth, render the reward to the proud.

content: 3 How long shall the wicked, O Jehovah, how long shall the wicked triumph?
content_old: 3 How long shall the wicked, O Jehovah, how long shall the wicked triumph?

content: 4 How long shall they utter and speak insolence—all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?
content_old: 4 How long shall they utter and speak insolence—all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?

content: 5 They crush thy people, O Jehovah, and afflict thine inheritance;
content_old: 5 They crush thy people, O Jehovah, and afflict thine inheritance;

content: 6 They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless,
content_old: 6 They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless,

content: 7 And say, Jah will not see, neither will the God of Jacob regard it.
content_old: 7 And say, Jah will not see, neither will the God of Jacob regard it.

content: 8 Understand, ye brutish among the people; and ye fools, when will ye be wise?
content_old: 8 Understand, ye brutish among the people; and ye fools, when will ye be wise?

content: 9 He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? He that formed the eye, shall he not see?
content_old: 9 He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? He that formed the eye, shall he not see?

content: 10 He that instructeth the nations, shall not he correct—he that teacheth man knowledge?
content_old: 10 He that instructeth the nations, shall not he correct—he that teacheth man knowledge?

content: 11 Jehovah knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
content_old: 11 Jehovah knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.

content: 12 Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Jah, and whom thou teachest out of thy law;
content_old: 12 Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Jah, and whom thou teachest out of thy law;

content: 13 That thou mayest give him rest from the days of evil, until the pit be digged for the wicked.
content_old: 13 That thou mayest give him rest from the days of evil, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

content: 14 For Jehovah will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance;
content_old: 14 For Jehovah will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance;

content: 15 For judgment shall return unto righteousness, and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
content_old: 15 For judgment shall return unto righteousness, and all the upright in heart shall follow it.

content: 16 Who will rise up for me against the evil-doers? who will stand for me against the workers of iniquity?
content_old: 16 Who will rise up for me against the evil-doers? who will stand for me against the workers of iniquity?

content: 17 If Jehovah had not been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.
content_old: 17 If Jehovah had not been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.

content: 18 When I said, My foot slippeth, thy loving-kindness, O Jehovah, held me up.
content_old: 18 When I said, My foot slippeth, thy loving-kindness, O Jehovah, held me up.

content: 19 In the multitude of my anxious thoughts within me thy comforts have delighted my soul.
content_old: 19 In the multitude of my anxious thoughts within me thy comforts have delighted my soul.

content: 20 Shall the throne of wickedness be united to thee, which frameth mischief into a law?
content_old: 20 Shall the throne of wickedness be united to thee, which frameth mischief into a law?

content: 21 They band together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn innocent blood.
