content_old: 21 They band together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn innocent blood.

content: 22 But Jehovah will be my high tower; and my God the rock of my refuge.
content_old: 22 But Jehovah will be my high tower; and my God the rock of my refuge.

content: 1 Come, let us sing aloud to Jehovah, let us shout for joy to the rock of our salvation;
content_old: 1 Come, let us sing aloud to Jehovah, let us shout for joy to the rock of our salvation;

content: 2 Let us come before his face with thanksgiving; let us shout aloud unto him with psalms.
content_old: 2 Let us come before his face with thanksgiving; let us shout aloud unto him with psalms.

content: 3 For Jehovah is a great •God, and a great king above all gods.
content_old: 3 For Jehovah is a great •God, and a great king above all gods.

content: 4 In his hand are the deep places of the earth; the heights of the mountains are his also:
content_old: 4 In his hand are the deep places of the earth; the heights of the mountains are his also:

content: 5 The sea is his, and he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
content_old: 5 The sea is his, and he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.

content: 6 Come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before Jehovah our Maker.
content_old: 6 Come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before Jehovah our Maker.

content: 7 For he is our God; and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. To-day if ye hear his voice,
content_old: 7 For he is our God; and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. To-day if ye hear his voice,

content: 8 Harden not your heart, as at Meribah, as in the day of Massah, in the wilderness;
content_old: 8 Harden not your heart, as at Meribah, as in the day of Massah, in the wilderness;

content: 9 When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.
content_old: 9 When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.

content: 10 Forty years was I grieved with the generation, and said, It is a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways;
content_old: 10 Forty years was I grieved with the generation, and said, It is a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways;

content: 1 Sing ye unto Jehovah a new song: sing unto Jehovah, all the earth.
content_old: 1 Sing ye unto Jehovah a new song: sing unto Jehovah, all the earth.

content: 2 Sing unto Jehovah, bless his name; publish his salvation from day to day.
content_old: 2 Sing unto Jehovah, bless his name; publish his salvation from day to day.

content: 3 Declare his glory among the nations, his wondrous works among all the peoples.
content_old: 3 Declare his glory among the nations, his wondrous works among all the peoples.

content: 4 For Jehovah is great and exceedingly to be praised; he is terrible above all gods.
content_old: 4 For Jehovah is great and exceedingly to be praised; he is terrible above all gods.

content: 5 For all the gods of the peoples are idols; but Jehovah made the heavens.
content_old: 5 For all the gods of the peoples are idols; but Jehovah made the heavens.

content: 6 Majesty and splendour are before him; strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
content_old: 6 Majesty and splendour are before him; strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

content: 7 Give unto Jehovah, ye families of peoples, give unto Jehovah glory and strength;
content_old: 7 Give unto Jehovah, ye families of peoples, give unto Jehovah glory and strength;

content: 8 Give unto Jehovah the glory of his name; bring an oblation and come into his courts;
content_old: 8 Give unto Jehovah the glory of his name; bring an oblation and come into his courts;

content: 9 Worship Jehovah in holy splendour; tremble before him, all the earth.
content_old: 9 Worship Jehovah in holy splendour; tremble before him, all the earth.

content: 10 Say among the nations, Jehovah reigneth! yea, the world is established, it shall not be moved; he will execute judgment upon the peoples with equity.
content_old: 10 Say among the nations, Jehovah reigneth! yea, the world is established, it shall not be moved; he will execute judgment upon the peoples with equity.

content: 11 Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;
content_old: 11 Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;

content: 12 Let the field exult and all that is therein. Then shall all the trees of the forest sing for joy,
content_old: 12 Let the field exult and all that is therein. Then shall all the trees of the forest sing for joy,

content: 1 Jehovah reigneth: let the earth be glad, let the many isles rejoice.
content_old: 1 Jehovah reigneth: let the earth be glad, let the many isles rejoice.

content: 2 Clouds and darkness are round about him; righteousness and judgment are the foundation of his throne.
content_old: 2 Clouds and darkness are round about him; righteousness and judgment are the foundation of his throne.

content: 3 A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his adversaries round about.
content_old: 3 A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his adversaries round about.

content: 4 His lightnings lightened the world: the earth saw, and trembled.
content_old: 4 His lightnings lightened the world: the earth saw, and trembled.

content: 5 The mountains melted like wax at the presence of Jehovah, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
content_old: 5 The mountains melted like wax at the presence of Jehovah, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

content: 6 The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory.
content_old: 6 The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory.

content: 7 Ashamed be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of idols. Worship him, all ye gods.
content_old: 7 Ashamed be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of idols. Worship him, all ye gods.

content: 8 Zion heard, and rejoiced; and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of thy judgments, O Jehovah.
content_old: 8 Zion heard, and rejoiced; and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of thy judgments, O Jehovah.

content: 9 For thou, Jehovah, art the Most High above all the earth; thou art exalted exceedingly above all gods.
content_old: 9 For thou, Jehovah, art the Most High above all the earth; thou art exalted exceedingly above all gods.

content: 10 Ye that love Jehovah, hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his saints, he delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.
content_old: 10 Ye that love Jehovah, hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his saints, he delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.

content: 11 Light is sown for the righteous, and joy for the upright in heart.
content_old: 11 Light is sown for the righteous, and joy for the upright in heart.

content: A Psalm.
content_old: A Psalm.

content: 1 Sing ye unto Jehovah a new song: for he hath done wondrous things; his right hand and his holy arm hath wrought salvation for him.
content_old: 1 Sing ye unto Jehovah a new song: for he hath done wondrous things; his right hand and his holy arm hath wrought salvation for him.

content: 2 Jehovah hath made known his salvation: his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the nations.
content_old: 2 Jehovah hath made known his salvation: his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the nations.

content: 3 He hath remembered his loving-kindness and his faithfulness toward the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
content_old: 3 He hath remembered his loving-kindness and his faithfulness toward the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

content: 4 Shout aloud unto Jehovah, all the earth; break forth and shout for joy, and sing psalms.
content_old: 4 Shout aloud unto Jehovah, all the earth; break forth and shout for joy, and sing psalms.

content: 5 Sing psalms unto Jehovah with the harp: with the harp, and the voice of a song;
content_old: 5 Sing psalms unto Jehovah with the harp: with the harp, and the voice of a song;

content: 6 With trumpets and sound of cornet, make a joyful noise before the King, Jehovah.
content_old: 6 With trumpets and sound of cornet, make a joyful noise before the King, Jehovah.

content: 7 Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein;
content_old: 7 Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein;

content: 8 Let the floods clap their hands; let the mountains sing for joy together,
content_old: 8 Let the floods clap their hands; let the mountains sing for joy together,

content: 1 Jehovah reigneth: let the peoples tremble. He sitteth between the cherubim: let the earth be moved.
content_old: 1 Jehovah reigneth: let the peoples tremble. He sitteth between the cherubim: let the earth be moved.

content: 2 Jehovah is great in Zion, and he is high above all the peoples.
content_old: 2 Jehovah is great in Zion, and he is high above all the peoples.

content: 3 They shall praise thy great and terrible name, —it is holy! —
content_old: 3 They shall praise thy great and terrible name, —it is holy! —

content: 4 And the strength of the king that loveth justice. Thou hast established equity: it is thou that executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.
content_old: 4 And the strength of the king that loveth justice. Thou hast established equity: it is thou that executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

content: 5 Exalt Jehovah our God, and worship at his footstool. He is holy!
content_old: 5 Exalt Jehovah our God, and worship at his footstool. He is holy!

content: 6 Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among them that call upon his name: they called unto Jehovah, and he answered them.
content_old: 6 Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among them that call upon his name: they called unto Jehovah, and he answered them.

content: 7 He spoke unto them in the pillar of cloud: they kept his testimonies, and the statute that he gave them.
content_old: 7 He spoke unto them in the pillar of cloud: they kept his testimonies, and the statute that he gave them.

content: 8 Jehovah, our God, thou answeredst them: a forgiving •God wast thou unto them, though thou tookest vengeance of their doings.
content_old: 8 Jehovah, our God, thou answeredst them: a forgiving •God wast thou unto them, though thou tookest vengeance of their doings.

content: A Psalm of thanksgiving.
content_old: A Psalm of thanksgiving.

content: 1 Shout aloud unto Jehovah, all the earth!
content_old: 1 Shout aloud unto Jehovah, all the earth!

content: 2 Serve Jehovah with joy: come before his presence with exultation.
content_old: 2 Serve Jehovah with joy: come before his presence with exultation.

content: 3 Know that Jehovah is God: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
content_old: 3 Know that Jehovah is God: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

content: 4 Enter into his gates with thanksgiving and into his courts with praise; give thanks unto him, bless his name:
content_old: 4 Enter into his gates with thanksgiving and into his courts with praise; give thanks unto him, bless his name:

content: A Psalm of David.
content_old: A Psalm of David.

content: 1 I will sing of loving-kindness and judgment: unto thee, Jehovah, will I sing psalms.
content_old: 1 I will sing of loving-kindness and judgment: unto thee, Jehovah, will I sing psalms.

content: 2 I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. When wilt thou come unto me? I will walk within my house in the integrity of my heart.
content_old: 2 I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. When wilt thou come unto me? I will walk within my house in the integrity of my heart.

content: 3 I will set no thing of Belial before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; it shall not cleave to me.
content_old: 3 I will set no thing of Belial before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; it shall not cleave to me.

content: 4 A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will not know evil.
content_old: 4 A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will not know evil.

content: 5 Whoso secretly slandereth his neighbour, him will I destroy; him that hath a high look and a proud heart will I not suffer.
content_old: 5 Whoso secretly slandereth his neighbour, him will I destroy; him that hath a high look and a proud heart will I not suffer.

content: 6 Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.
content_old: 6 Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.

content: 7 He that practiseth deceit shall not dwell within my house; he that speaketh falsehoods shall not subsist in my sight.
content_old: 7 He that practiseth deceit shall not dwell within my house; he that speaketh falsehoods shall not subsist in my sight.

content: A Prayer of the afflicted, when he is overwhelmed, and poureth out his complaint before Jehovah.
content_old: A Prayer of the afflicted, when he is overwhelmed, and poureth out his complaint before Jehovah.

content: 1 Jehovah, hear my prayer, and let my cry come unto thee.
content_old: 1 Jehovah, hear my prayer, and let my cry come unto thee.

content: 2 Hide not thy face from me: in the day of my trouble, incline thine ear unto me; in the day I call, answer me speedily.
content_old: 2 Hide not thy face from me: in the day of my trouble, incline thine ear unto me; in the day I call, answer me speedily.

content: 3 For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as a firebrand.
content_old: 3 For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as a firebrand.

content: 4 My heart is smitten and withered like grass; yea, I have forgotten to eat my bread.
content_old: 4 My heart is smitten and withered like grass; yea, I have forgotten to eat my bread.

content: 5 By reason of the voice of my groaning, my bones cleave to my flesh.
content_old: 5 By reason of the voice of my groaning, my bones cleave to my flesh.

content: 6 I am become like the pelican of the wilderness, I am as an owl in desolate places;
content_old: 6 I am become like the pelican of the wilderness, I am as an owl in desolate places;

content: 7 I watch, and am like a sparrow alone upon the housetop.
content_old: 7 I watch, and am like a sparrow alone upon the housetop.

content: 8 Mine enemies reproach me all the day; they that are mad against me swear by me.
content_old: 8 Mine enemies reproach me all the day; they that are mad against me swear by me.

content: 9 For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,
content_old: 9 For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,

content: 10 Because of thine indignation and thy wrath; for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.
content_old: 10 Because of thine indignation and thy wrath; for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.

content: 11 My days are like a lengthened-out shadow, and I, I am withered like grass.
content_old: 11 My days are like a lengthened-out shadow, and I, I am withered like grass.

content: 12 But thou, Jehovah, abidest for ever, and thy memorial from generation to generation.
content_old: 12 But thou, Jehovah, abidest for ever, and thy memorial from generation to generation.

content: 13 Thou wilt rise up, thou wilt have mercy upon Zion: for it is the time to be gracious to her, for the set time is come.
content_old: 13 Thou wilt rise up, thou wilt have mercy upon Zion: for it is the time to be gracious to her, for the set time is come.

content: 14 For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour her dust.
content_old: 14 For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour her dust.

content: 15 And the nations shall fear the name of Jehovah, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.
content_old: 15 And the nations shall fear the name of Jehovah, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

content: 16 When Jehovah shall build up Zion, he will appear in his glory.
content_old: 16 When Jehovah shall build up Zion, he will appear in his glory.

content: 17 He will regard the prayer of the destitute one, and not despise their prayer.
content_old: 17 He will regard the prayer of the destitute one, and not despise their prayer.

content: 18 This shall be written for the generation to come; and a people that shall be created shall praise Jah:
content_old: 18 This shall be written for the generation to come; and a people that shall be created shall praise Jah:

content: 19 For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from the heavens hath Jehovah beheld the earth,
content_old: 19 For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from the heavens hath Jehovah beheld the earth,

content: 20 To hear the groaning of the prisoner, to loose those that are appointed to die;
content_old: 20 To hear the groaning of the prisoner, to loose those that are appointed to die;

content: 21 That the name of Jehovah may be declared in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem,
content_old: 21 That the name of Jehovah may be declared in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem,

content: 22 When the peoples shall be gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve Jehovah.
content_old: 22 When the peoples shall be gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve Jehovah.

content: 23 He weakened my strength in the way, he shortened my days.
content_old: 23 He weakened my strength in the way, he shortened my days.

content: 24 I said, My •God, take me not away in the midst of my days! …Thy years are from generation to generation.
content_old: 24 I said, My •God, take me not away in the midst of my days! …Thy years are from generation to generation.

content: 25 Of old hast thou founded the earth, and the heavens are the work of thy hands:
content_old: 25 Of old hast thou founded the earth, and the heavens are the work of thy hands:

content: 26 They shall perish, but thou continuest; and all of them shall grow old as a garment: as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed.
content_old: 26 They shall perish, but thou continuest; and all of them shall grow old as a garment: as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed.

content: 27 But thou art the Same, and thy years shall have no end.
content_old: 27 But thou art the Same, and thy years shall have no end.

content: A Psalm of David.
content_old: A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Bless Jehovah, O my soul; and all that is within me, bless his holy name!
content_old: 1 Bless Jehovah, O my soul; and all that is within me, bless his holy name!

content: 2 Bless Jehovah, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:
content_old: 2 Bless Jehovah, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:

content: 3 Who forgiveth all thine iniquities, who healeth all thy diseases;
content_old: 3 Who forgiveth all thine iniquities, who healeth all thy diseases;

content: 4 Who redeemeth thy life from the pit, who crowneth thee with loving-kindness and tender mercies;
content_old: 4 Who redeemeth thy life from the pit, who crowneth thee with loving-kindness and tender mercies;

content: 5 Who satisfieth thine old age with good things; thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
content_old: 5 Who satisfieth thine old age with good things; thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

content: 6 Jehovah executeth righteousness and justice for all that are oppressed.
content_old: 6 Jehovah executeth righteousness and justice for all that are oppressed.

content: 7 He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.
content_old: 7 He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.

content: 8 Jehovah is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in loving-kindness.
content_old: 8 Jehovah is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in loving-kindness.

content: 9 He will not always chide, neither will he keep his anger for ever.
content_old: 9 He will not always chide, neither will he keep his anger for ever.

content: 10 He hath not dealt with us according to our sins, nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
content_old: 10 He hath not dealt with us according to our sins, nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

content: 11 For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great is his loving-kindness toward them that fear him.
content_old: 11 For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great is his loving-kindness toward them that fear him.

content: 12 As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
content_old: 12 As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.

content: 13 As a father pitieth his children, so Jehovah pitieth them that fear him.
content_old: 13 As a father pitieth his children, so Jehovah pitieth them that fear him.

content: 14 For himself knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.
content_old: 14 For himself knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.

content: 15 As for man, his days are as grass; as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth:
content_old: 15 As for man, his days are as grass; as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth:

content: 16 For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone, and the place thereof knoweth it no more.
content_old: 16 For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone, and the place thereof knoweth it no more.

content: 17 But the loving-kindness of Jehovah is from everlasting and to everlasting, upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children’s children,
content_old: 17 But the loving-kindness of Jehovah is from everlasting and to everlasting, upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children’s children,

content: 18 To such as keep his covenant and to those that remember his precepts to do them.
content_old: 18 To such as keep his covenant and to those that remember his precepts to do them.

content: 19 Jehovah hath established his throne in the heavens, and his kingdom ruleth over all.
content_old: 19 Jehovah hath established his throne in the heavens, and his kingdom ruleth over all.

content: 20 Bless Jehovah, ye his angels, mighty in strength, that execute his word, hearkening unto the voice of his word.
content_old: 20 Bless Jehovah, ye his angels, mighty in strength, that execute his word, hearkening unto the voice of his word.

content: 21 Bless Jehovah, all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his that do his will.
content_old: 21 Bless Jehovah, all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his that do his will.

content: 1 Bless Jehovah, O my soul! Jehovah my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with majesty and splendour;
content_old: 1 Bless Jehovah, O my soul! Jehovah my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with majesty and splendour;

content: 2 Covering thyself with light as with a garment, stretching out the heavens like a tent-curtain; —
content_old: 2 Covering thyself with light as with a garment, stretching out the heavens like a tent-curtain; —

content: 3 Who layeth the beams of his upper chambers in the waters, who maketh clouds his chariot, who walketh upon the wings of the wind;
content_old: 3 Who layeth the beams of his upper chambers in the waters, who maketh clouds his chariot, who walketh upon the wings of the wind;

content: 4 Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flame of fire.
content_old: 4 Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flame of fire.

content: 5 He laid the earth upon its foundations: it shall not be removed for ever.
content_old: 5 He laid the earth upon its foundations: it shall not be removed for ever.

content: 6 Thou hadst covered it with the deep, as with a vesture; the waters stood above the mountains:
content_old: 6 Thou hadst covered it with the deep, as with a vesture; the waters stood above the mountains:

content: 7 At thy rebuke they fled, at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away; —
content_old: 7 At thy rebuke they fled, at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away; —

content: 8 The mountains rose, the valleys sank, unto the place which thou hadst founded for them; —
content_old: 8 The mountains rose, the valleys sank, unto the place which thou hadst founded for them; —

content: 9 Thou hast set a bound which they may not pass over, that they turn not again to cover the earth.
content_old: 9 Thou hast set a bound which they may not pass over, that they turn not again to cover the earth.

content: 10 He sendeth the springs into the valleys: they run among the mountains;
content_old: 10 He sendeth the springs into the valleys: they run among the mountains;

content: 11 They give drink to every beast of the field; the wild asses quench their thirst.
content_old: 11 They give drink to every beast of the field; the wild asses quench their thirst.

content: 12 The birds of heaven dwell by them; they give forth their voice from among the branches.
content_old: 12 The birds of heaven dwell by them; they give forth their voice from among the branches.

content: 13 He watereth the mountains from his upper-chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.
content_old: 13 He watereth the mountains from his upper-chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.

content: 14 He maketh the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man; bringing forth bread out of the earth,
content_old: 14 He maketh the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man; bringing forth bread out of the earth,

content: 15 And wine which gladdeneth the heart of man; making his face shine with oil; and with bread he strengtheneth man’s heart.
content_old: 15 And wine which gladdeneth the heart of man; making his face shine with oil; and with bread he strengtheneth man’s heart.

content: 16 The trees of Jehovah are satisfied, the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted,
content_old: 16 The trees of Jehovah are satisfied, the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted,

content: 17 Where the birds make their nests; as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.
content_old: 17 Where the birds make their nests; as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.

content: 18 The high mountains are for the wild goats; the cliffs, a refuge for the rock-badgers.
content_old: 18 The high mountains are for the wild goats; the cliffs, a refuge for the rock-badgers.

content: 19 He made the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth its going down.
content_old: 19 He made the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth its going down.

content: 20 Thou makest darkness, and it is night, wherein all the beasts of the forest creep forth:
content_old: 20 Thou makest darkness, and it is night, wherein all the beasts of the forest creep forth:

content: 21 The young lions roar after the prey, and to seek their food from •God.
content_old: 21 The young lions roar after the prey, and to seek their food from •God.

content: 22 The sun ariseth, they retreat, and lay them down in their dens.
content_old: 22 The sun ariseth, they retreat, and lay them down in their dens.

content: 23 Man goeth forth unto his work, and to his labour until the evening.
content_old: 23 Man goeth forth unto his work, and to his labour until the evening.

content: 24 How manifold are thy works, O Jehovah! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.
content_old: 24 How manifold are thy works, O Jehovah! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.

content: 25 Yonder is the great and wide sea: therein are moving things innumerable, living creatures small and great.
content_old: 25 Yonder is the great and wide sea: therein are moving things innumerable, living creatures small and great.

content: 26 There go the ships; there that leviathan, which thou hast formed to play therein.
content_old: 26 There go the ships; there that leviathan, which thou hast formed to play therein.

content: 27 These all look unto thee, that thou mayest give their food in its season:
content_old: 27 These all look unto thee, that thou mayest give their food in its season:

content: 28 That thou givest unto them, they gather; thou openest thy hand, they are filled with good.
content_old: 28 That thou givest unto them, they gather; thou openest thy hand, they are filled with good.

content: 29 Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled; thou takest away their breath, they expire and return to their dust.
content_old: 29 Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled; thou takest away their breath, they expire and return to their dust.

content: 30 Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created, and thou renewest the face of the earth.
content_old: 30 Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created, and thou renewest the face of the earth.

content: 31 The glory of Jehovah will endure for ever; Jehovah will rejoice in his works.
content_old: 31 The glory of Jehovah will endure for ever; Jehovah will rejoice in his works.

content: 32 He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth; he toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.
content_old: 32 He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth; he toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.

content: 33 I will sing unto Jehovah as long as I live; I will sing psalms to my God while I have my being.
content_old: 33 I will sing unto Jehovah as long as I live; I will sing psalms to my God while I have my being.

content: 34 My meditation shall be pleasant unto him; I will rejoice in Jehovah.
content_old: 34 My meditation shall be pleasant unto him; I will rejoice in Jehovah.

content: 1 Give ye thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name; make known his acts among the peoples.
content_old: 1 Give ye thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name; make known his acts among the peoples.

content: 2 Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him; meditate upon all his wondrous works.
content_old: 2 Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him; meditate upon all his wondrous works.

content: 3 Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek Jehovah.
content_old: 3 Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek Jehovah.

content: 4 Seek Jehovah and his strength, seek his face continually;
content_old: 4 Seek Jehovah and his strength, seek his face continually;

content: 5 Remember his wondrous works which he hath done, his miracles and the judgments of his mouth:
content_old: 5 Remember his wondrous works which he hath done, his miracles and the judgments of his mouth:

content: 6 Ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.
content_old: 6 Ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.

content: 7 He, Jehovah, is our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
content_old: 7 He, Jehovah, is our God; his judgments are in all the earth.

content: 8 He is ever mindful of his covenant, —the word which he commanded to a thousand generations, —
content_old: 8 He is ever mindful of his covenant, —the word which he commanded to a thousand generations, —

content: 9 Which he made with Abraham, and of his oath unto Isaac;
content_old: 9 Which he made with Abraham, and of his oath unto Isaac;

content: 10 And he confirmed it unto Jacob for a statute, unto Israel for an everlasting covenant,
content_old: 10 And he confirmed it unto Jacob for a statute, unto Israel for an everlasting covenant,

content: 11 Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance;
content_old: 11 Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance;

content: 12 When they were a few men in number, of small account, and strangers in it.
content_old: 12 When they were a few men in number, of small account, and strangers in it.

content: 13 And they went from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people.
content_old: 13 And they went from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people.

content: 14 He suffered no man to oppress them, and reproved kings for their sakes,
content_old: 14 He suffered no man to oppress them, and reproved kings for their sakes,

content: 15 Saying, Touch not mine anointed ones, and do my prophets no harm.
content_old: 15 Saying, Touch not mine anointed ones, and do my prophets no harm.

content: 16 And he called for a famine upon the land; he broke the whole staff of bread.
content_old: 16 And he called for a famine upon the land; he broke the whole staff of bread.

content: 17 He sent a man before them: Joseph was sold for a bondman.
content_old: 17 He sent a man before them: Joseph was sold for a bondman.

content: 18 They afflicted his feet with fetters; his soul came into irons;
content_old: 18 They afflicted his feet with fetters; his soul came into irons;

content: 19 Until the time when what he said came about: the word of Jehovah tried him.
content_old: 19 Until the time when what he said came about: the word of Jehovah tried him.

content: 20 The king sent and loosed him—the ruler of peoples—and let him go free.
content_old: 20 The king sent and loosed him—the ruler of peoples—and let him go free.

content: 21 He made him lord of his house, and ruler over all his possessions:
content_old: 21 He made him lord of his house, and ruler over all his possessions:

content: 22 To bind his princes at his pleasure, and teach his elders wisdom.
content_old: 22 To bind his princes at his pleasure, and teach his elders wisdom.

content: 23 And Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
content_old: 23 And Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

content: 24 And he made his people exceeding fruitful, and made them mightier than their oppressors.
content_old: 24 And he made his people exceeding fruitful, and made them mightier than their oppressors.

content: 25 He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.
content_old: 25 He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

content: 26 He sent Moses his servant, and Aaron whom he had chosen:
content_old: 26 He sent Moses his servant, and Aaron whom he had chosen:

content: 27 They set his signs among them, and miracles in the land of Ham.
content_old: 27 They set his signs among them, and miracles in the land of Ham.

content: 28 He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.
content_old: 28 He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

content: 29 He turned their waters into blood, and caused their fish to die.
content_old: 29 He turned their waters into blood, and caused their fish to die.

content: 30 Their land swarmed with frogs, —in the chambers of their kings.
content_old: 30 Their land swarmed with frogs, —in the chambers of their kings.

content: 31 He spoke, and there came dog-flies, and gnats in all their borders.
content_old: 31 He spoke, and there came dog-flies, and gnats in all their borders.

content: 32 He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land;
content_old: 32 He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land;

content: 33 And he smote their vines and their fig-trees, and broke the trees of their borders.
content_old: 33 And he smote their vines and their fig-trees, and broke the trees of their borders.

content: 34 He spoke, and the locust came, and the cankerworm, even without number;
content_old: 34 He spoke, and the locust came, and the cankerworm, even without number;

content: 35 And they devoured every herb in their land, and ate up the fruit of their ground.
content_old: 35 And they devoured every herb in their land, and ate up the fruit of their ground.

content: 36 And he smote every firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their vigour.
content_old: 36 And he smote every firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their vigour.

content: 37 And he brought them forth with silver and gold; and there was not one feeble among their tribes.
content_old: 37 And he brought them forth with silver and gold; and there was not one feeble among their tribes.

content: 38 Egypt rejoiced at their departure; for the fear of them had fallen upon them.
content_old: 38 Egypt rejoiced at their departure; for the fear of them had fallen upon them.

content: 39 He spread a cloud for a covering, and fire to give light in the night.
content_old: 39 He spread a cloud for a covering, and fire to give light in the night.

content: 40 They asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
content_old: 40 They asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

content: 41 He opened the rock, and waters gushed forth; they ran in the dry places like a river.
content_old: 41 He opened the rock, and waters gushed forth; they ran in the dry places like a river.

content: 42 For he remembered his holy word, and Abraham his servant;
content_old: 42 For he remembered his holy word, and Abraham his servant;

content: 43 And he brought forth his people with gladness, his chosen with rejoicing;
content_old: 43 And he brought forth his people with gladness, his chosen with rejoicing;

content: 44 And he gave them the lands of the nations, and they took possession of the labour of the peoples:
content_old: 44 And he gave them the lands of the nations, and they took possession of the labour of the peoples:

content: 1 Hallelujah! Give ye thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah! Give ye thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.

content: 2 Who can utter the mighty acts of Jehovah? who can shew forth all his praise?
content_old: 2 Who can utter the mighty acts of Jehovah? who can shew forth all his praise?

content: 3 Blessed are they that keep justice, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.
content_old: 3 Blessed are they that keep justice, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

content: 4 Remember me, O Jehovah, with thy favour toward thy people; visit me with thy salvation:
content_old: 4 Remember me, O Jehovah, with thy favour toward thy people; visit me with thy salvation:

content: 5 That I may see the prosperity of thy chosen ones, that I may rejoice in the joy of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.
content_old: 5 That I may see the prosperity of thy chosen ones, that I may rejoice in the joy of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

content: 6 We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
content_old: 6 We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

content: 7 Our fathers in Egypt considered not thy wondrous works; they remembered not the multitude of thy loving-kindnesses; but they rebelled at the sea, at the Red Sea.
content_old: 7 Our fathers in Egypt considered not thy wondrous works; they remembered not the multitude of thy loving-kindnesses; but they rebelled at the sea, at the Red Sea.

content: 8 Yet he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make known his might.
content_old: 8 Yet he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make known his might.

content: 9 And he rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; and he led them through the deeps as through a wilderness.
content_old: 9 And he rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; and he led them through the deeps as through a wilderness.

content: 10 And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
content_old: 10 And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

content: 11 And the waters covered their oppressors: there was not one of them left.
content_old: 11 And the waters covered their oppressors: there was not one of them left.

content: 12 Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.
content_old: 12 Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

content: 13 They soon forgot his works; they waited not for his counsel:
content_old: 13 They soon forgot his works; they waited not for his counsel:

content: 14 And they lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted •God in the desert.
content_old: 14 And they lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted •God in the desert.

content: 15 Then he gave them their request, but sent leanness into their soul.
content_old: 15 Then he gave them their request, but sent leanness into their soul.

content: 16 And they envied Moses in the camp, and Aaron, the saint of Jehovah.
content_old: 16 And they envied Moses in the camp, and Aaron, the saint of Jehovah.

content: 17 The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram;
content_old: 17 The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram;

content: 18 And fire was kindled in their company; a flame burned up the wicked.
content_old: 18 And fire was kindled in their company; a flame burned up the wicked.

content: 19 They made a calf in Horeb, and did homage to a molten image;
content_old: 19 They made a calf in Horeb, and did homage to a molten image;

content: 20 And they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.
content_old: 20 And they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

content: 21 They forgot •God their Saviour, who had done great things in Egypt,
content_old: 21 They forgot •God their Saviour, who had done great things in Egypt,

content: 22 Wondrous works in the land of Ham, terrible things by the Red Sea.
content_old: 22 Wondrous works in the land of Ham, terrible things by the Red Sea.

content: 23 And he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses, his chosen, stood before him in the breach, to turn away his fury, lest he should destroy them.
content_old: 23 And he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses, his chosen, stood before him in the breach, to turn away his fury, lest he should destroy them.

content: 24 And they despised the pleasant land; they believed not his word,
content_old: 24 And they despised the pleasant land; they believed not his word,

content: 25 But murmured in their tents: they hearkened not unto the voice of Jehovah.
content_old: 25 But murmured in their tents: they hearkened not unto the voice of Jehovah.

content: 26 And he lifted up his hand to them, that he would make them fall in the wilderness;
content_old: 26 And he lifted up his hand to them, that he would make them fall in the wilderness;

content: 27 And that he would make their seed fall among the nations, and disperse them through the countries.
content_old: 27 And that he would make their seed fall among the nations, and disperse them through the countries.

content: 28 And they joined themselves unto Baal-Peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead;
content_old: 28 And they joined themselves unto Baal-Peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead;

content: 29 And they provoked him to anger with their doings; and a plague broke out among them.
content_old: 29 And they provoked him to anger with their doings; and a plague broke out among them.

content: 30 Then stood up Phinehas and executed judgment, and the plague was stayed;
content_old: 30 Then stood up Phinehas and executed judgment, and the plague was stayed;

content: 31 And that was reckoned unto him for righteousness, from generation to generation, for evermore.
content_old: 31 And that was reckoned unto him for righteousness, from generation to generation, for evermore.

content: 32 And they moved him to wrath at the waters of Meribah, and it went ill with Moses on their account;
content_old: 32 And they moved him to wrath at the waters of Meribah, and it went ill with Moses on their account;

content: 33 For they provoked his spirit, so that he spoke unadvisedly with his lips.
content_old: 33 For they provoked his spirit, so that he spoke unadvisedly with his lips.

content: 34 They did not destroy the peoples, as Jehovah commanded them;
content_old: 34 They did not destroy the peoples, as Jehovah commanded them;

content: 35 But they mingled with the nations, and learned their works;
content_old: 35 But they mingled with the nations, and learned their works;

content: 36 And they served their idols; and they were a snare unto them:
content_old: 36 And they served their idols; and they were a snare unto them:

content: 37 And they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto demons,
content_old: 37 And they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto demons,

content: 38 And shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan; and the land was polluted with blood.
content_old: 38 And shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan; and the land was polluted with blood.

content: 39 And they were defiled with their works, and went a-whoring in their doings.
content_old: 39 And they were defiled with their works, and went a-whoring in their doings.

content: 40 Then was the anger of Jehovah kindled against his people, and he abhorred his inheritance;
content_old: 40 Then was the anger of Jehovah kindled against his people, and he abhorred his inheritance;

content: 41 And he gave them into the hand of the nations; and they that hated them ruled over them:
content_old: 41 And he gave them into the hand of the nations; and they that hated them ruled over them:

content: 42 And their enemies oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.
content_old: 42 And their enemies oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

content: 43 Often did he deliver them; but as for them they provoked him by their counsel, and they were brought low by their iniquity.
content_old: 43 Often did he deliver them; but as for them they provoked him by their counsel, and they were brought low by their iniquity.

content: 44 But he regarded their distress, when he heard their cry;
content_old: 44 But he regarded their distress, when he heard their cry;

content: 45 And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his loving-kindnesses;
content_old: 45 And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his loving-kindnesses;

content: 46 And he caused them to find compassion of all those that had carried them captives.
content_old: 46 And he caused them to find compassion of all those that had carried them captives.

content: 47 Save us, Jehovah our God, and gather us from among the nations, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.
content_old: 47 Save us, Jehovah our God, and gather us from among the nations, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

content: 1 Give ye thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.
content_old: 1 Give ye thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.

content: 2 Let the redeemed of Jehovah say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the oppressor,
content_old: 2 Let the redeemed of Jehovah say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the oppressor,

content: 3 And gathered out of the countries, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the sea.
content_old: 3 And gathered out of the countries, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the sea.

content: 4 They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way, they found no city of habitation;
content_old: 4 They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way, they found no city of habitation;

content: 5 Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them:
content_old: 5 Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them:

content: 6 Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses,
content_old: 6 Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses,

content: 7 And he led them forth by a right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
content_old: 7 And he led them forth by a right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

content: 8 Let them give thanks unto Jehovah for his loving-kindness, and for his wondrous works to the children of men;
content_old: 8 Let them give thanks unto Jehovah for his loving-kindness, and for his wondrous works to the children of men;

content: 9 For he hath satisfied the longing soul and filled the hungry soul with good.
content_old: 9 For he hath satisfied the longing soul and filled the hungry soul with good.

content: 10 Such as inhabit darkness and the shadow of death, bound in affliction and iron,
content_old: 10 Such as inhabit darkness and the shadow of death, bound in affliction and iron,

content: 11 Because they had rebelled against the words of •God, and had despised the counsel of the Most High; …
content_old: 11 Because they had rebelled against the words of •God, and had despised the counsel of the Most High; …

content: 12 And he bowed down their heart with labour; they stumbled, and there was none to help:
content_old: 12 And he bowed down their heart with labour; they stumbled, and there was none to help:

content: 13 Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses;
content_old: 13 Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses;

content: 14 He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and broke their bands in sunder.
content_old: 14 He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and broke their bands in sunder.

content: 15 Let them give thanks unto Jehovah for his loving-kindness, and for his wondrous works to the children of men;
content_old: 15 Let them give thanks unto Jehovah for his loving-kindness, and for his wondrous works to the children of men;

content: 16 For he hath broken the gates of bronze, and cut asunder the bars of iron.
content_old: 16 For he hath broken the gates of bronze, and cut asunder the bars of iron.

content: 17 Fools, because of their way of transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted;
content_old: 17 Fools, because of their way of transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted;

content: 18 Their soul abhorreth all manner of food, and they draw near unto the gates of death:
content_old: 18 Their soul abhorreth all manner of food, and they draw near unto the gates of death:

content: 19 Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses;
content_old: 19 Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses;

content: 20 He sendeth his word, and healeth them, and delivereth them from their destructions.
content_old: 20 He sendeth his word, and healeth them, and delivereth them from their destructions.

content: 21 Let them give thanks unto Jehovah for his loving-kindness, and for his wondrous works to the children of men,
content_old: 21 Let them give thanks unto Jehovah for his loving-kindness, and for his wondrous works to the children of men,

content: 22 And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works in joyful song.
content_old: 22 And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works in joyful song.

content: 23 They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters,
content_old: 23 They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters,

content: 24 These see the works of Jehovah, and his wonders in the deep.
content_old: 24 These see the works of Jehovah, and his wonders in the deep.

content: 25 For he speaketh, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof:
content_old: 25 For he speaketh, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof:

content: 26 They mount up to the heavens, they go down to the depths; their soul is melted because of trouble;
content_old: 26 They mount up to the heavens, they go down to the depths; their soul is melted because of trouble;

content: 27 They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and they are at their wits’ end:
content_old: 27 They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and they are at their wits’ end:

content: 28 Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses;
content_old: 28 Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses;

content: 29 He maketh the storm a calm, and the waves thereof are still:
content_old: 29 He maketh the storm a calm, and the waves thereof are still:

content: 30 And they rejoice because they are quiet; and he bringeth them unto their desired haven.
content_old: 30 And they rejoice because they are quiet; and he bringeth them unto their desired haven.

content: 31 Let them give thanks unto Jehovah for his loving-kindness, and for his wondrous works to the children of men;
content_old: 31 Let them give thanks unto Jehovah for his loving-kindness, and for his wondrous works to the children of men;

content: 32 Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the session of the elders.
content_old: 32 Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the session of the elders.

content: 33 He maketh rivers into a wilderness, and water-springs into dry ground;
content_old: 33 He maketh rivers into a wilderness, and water-springs into dry ground;

content: 34 A fruitful land into a plain of salt, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
content_old: 34 A fruitful land into a plain of salt, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

content: 35 He maketh the wilderness into a pool of water, and the dry land into water-springs;
content_old: 35 He maketh the wilderness into a pool of water, and the dry land into water-springs;

content: 36 And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, and they establish a city of habitation;
content_old: 36 And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, and they establish a city of habitation;

content: 37 And sow fields, and plant vineyards, which yield fruits of increase;
content_old: 37 And sow fields, and plant vineyards, which yield fruits of increase;

content: 38 And he blesseth them, so that they are multiplied greatly; and he suffereth not their cattle to decrease.
content_old: 38 And he blesseth them, so that they are multiplied greatly; and he suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

content: 39 And they are diminished and brought low, through oppression, adversity, and sorrow:
content_old: 39 And they are diminished and brought low, through oppression, adversity, and sorrow:

content: 40 He poureth contempt upon nobles, and causeth them to wander in a pathless waste;
content_old: 40 He poureth contempt upon nobles, and causeth them to wander in a pathless waste;

content: 41 But he secureth the needy one on high from affliction, and maketh him families like flocks.
content_old: 41 But he secureth the needy one on high from affliction, and maketh him families like flocks.

content: 42 The upright shall see it, and rejoice; and all unrighteousness shall stop its mouth.
content_old: 42 The upright shall see it, and rejoice; and all unrighteousness shall stop its mouth.

content: A Song, a Psalm of David.
content_old: A Song, a Psalm of David.

content: 1 My heart is fixed, O God: I will sing, yea, I will sing psalms, even with my glory.
content_old: 1 My heart is fixed, O God: I will sing, yea, I will sing psalms, even with my glory.

content: 2 Awake, lute and harp: I will wake the dawn.
content_old: 2 Awake, lute and harp: I will wake the dawn.

content: 3 I will give thee thanks among the peoples, O Jehovah; of thee will I sing psalms among the nations:
content_old: 3 I will give thee thanks among the peoples, O Jehovah; of thee will I sing psalms among the nations:

content: 4 For thy loving-kindness is great above the heavens, and thy truth is unto the clouds.
content_old: 4 For thy loving-kindness is great above the heavens, and thy truth is unto the clouds.

content: 5 Be thou exalted above the heavens, O God, and thy glory above all the earth.
content_old: 5 Be thou exalted above the heavens, O God, and thy glory above all the earth.

content: 6 That thy beloved ones may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.
content_old: 6 That thy beloved ones may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.

content: 7 God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
content_old: 7 God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

content: 8 Gilead is mine, Manasseh is mine, and Ephraim is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;
content_old: 8 Gilead is mine, Manasseh is mine, and Ephraim is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;

content: 9 Moab is my wash-pot; upon Edom will I cast my sandal; over Philistia will I shout aloud.
content_old: 9 Moab is my wash-pot; upon Edom will I cast my sandal; over Philistia will I shout aloud.

content: 10 Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me unto Edom?
content_old: 10 Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me unto Edom?

content: 11 Wilt not thou, O God, who didst cast us off? and didst not go forth, O God, with our armies?
content_old: 11 Wilt not thou, O God, who didst cast us off? and didst not go forth, O God, with our armies?

content: 12 Give us help from trouble; for vain is man’s deliverance.
content_old: 12 Give us help from trouble; for vain is man’s deliverance.

content: To the chief Musician. Of David. A Psalm.
content_old: To the chief Musician. Of David. A Psalm.

content: 1 O God of my praise, be not silent:
content_old: 1 O God of my praise, be not silent:

content: 2 For the mouth of the wicked man and the mouth of deceit are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue,
content_old: 2 For the mouth of the wicked man and the mouth of deceit are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue,

content: 3 And with words of hatred have they encompassed me; and they fight against me without a cause.
content_old: 3 And with words of hatred have they encompassed me; and they fight against me without a cause.

content: 4 For my love they are mine adversaries; but I give myself unto prayer.
content_old: 4 For my love they are mine adversaries; but I give myself unto prayer.

content: 5 And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
content_old: 5 And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

content: 6 Set a wicked man over him, and let the adversary stand at his right hand;
content_old: 6 Set a wicked man over him, and let the adversary stand at his right hand;

content: 7 When he shall be judged, let him go out guilty, and let his prayer become sin;
content_old: 7 When he shall be judged, let him go out guilty, and let his prayer become sin;

content: 8 Let his days be few, let another take his office;
content_old: 8 Let his days be few, let another take his office;

content: 9 Let his sons be fatherless, and his wife a widow;
content_old: 9 Let his sons be fatherless, and his wife a widow;

content: 10 Let his sons be vagabonds and beg, and let them seek their bread far from their desolate places;
content_old: 10 Let his sons be vagabonds and beg, and let them seek their bread far from their desolate places;

content: 11 Let the usurer cast the net over all that he hath, and let strangers despoil his labour;
content_old: 11 Let the usurer cast the net over all that he hath, and let strangers despoil his labour;

content: 12 Let there be none to extend kindness unto him, neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children;
content_old: 12 Let there be none to extend kindness unto him, neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children;

content: 13 Let his posterity be cut off; in the generation following let their name be blotted out:
content_old: 13 Let his posterity be cut off; in the generation following let their name be blotted out:

content: 14 Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with Jehovah, and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out;
content_old: 14 Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with Jehovah, and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out;

content: 15 Let them be before Jehovah continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth:
content_old: 15 Let them be before Jehovah continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth:

content: 16 Because he remembered not to shew kindness, but persecuted the afflicted and needy man, and the broken in heart, to slay him.
content_old: 16 Because he remembered not to shew kindness, but persecuted the afflicted and needy man, and the broken in heart, to slay him.

content: 17 And he loved cursing; so let it come unto him. And he delighted not in blessing; and let it be far from him.
content_old: 17 And he loved cursing; so let it come unto him. And he delighted not in blessing; and let it be far from him.

content: 18 And he clothed himself with cursing like his vestment; so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones;
content_old: 18 And he clothed himself with cursing like his vestment; so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones;

content: 19 Let it be unto him as a garment with which he covereth himself, and for a girdle wherewith he is constantly girded.
content_old: 19 Let it be unto him as a garment with which he covereth himself, and for a girdle wherewith he is constantly girded.

content: 20 Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from Jehovah, and of them that speak evil against my soul.
content_old: 20 Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from Jehovah, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

content: 21 But do thou for me, Jehovah, Lord, for thy name’s sake; because thy loving-kindness is good, deliver me:
content_old: 21 But do thou for me, Jehovah, Lord, for thy name’s sake; because thy loving-kindness is good, deliver me:

content: 22 For I am afflicted and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
content_old: 22 For I am afflicted and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

content: 23 I am gone like a shadow when it lengtheneth; I am tossed about like the locust;
content_old: 23 I am gone like a shadow when it lengtheneth; I am tossed about like the locust;

content: 24 My knees are failing through fasting, and my flesh hath lost its fatness;
content_old: 24 My knees are failing through fasting, and my flesh hath lost its fatness;

content: 25 And I am become a reproach unto them; when they look upon me they shake their heads.
content_old: 25 And I am become a reproach unto them; when they look upon me they shake their heads.

content: 26 Help me, Jehovah my God; save me according to thy loving-kindness:
content_old: 26 Help me, Jehovah my God; save me according to thy loving-kindness:

content: 27 That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Jehovah, hast done it.
content_old: 27 That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Jehovah, hast done it.

content: 28 Let them curse, but bless thou; when they rise up, let them be ashamed, and let thy servant rejoice.
content_old: 28 Let them curse, but bless thou; when they rise up, let them be ashamed, and let thy servant rejoice.

content: 29 Let mine adversaries be clothed with confusion, and let them cover themselves with their shame as with a mantle.
content_old: 29 Let mine adversaries be clothed with confusion, and let them cover themselves with their shame as with a mantle.

content: 30 I will greatly celebrate Jehovah with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
content_old: 30 I will greatly celebrate Jehovah with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

content: Psalm of David.
content_old: Psalm of David.

content: 1 Jehovah said unto my Lord, Sit at my right hand, until I put thine enemies as footstool of thy feet.
content_old: 1 Jehovah said unto my Lord, Sit at my right hand, until I put thine enemies as footstool of thy feet.

content: 2 Jehovah shall send the sceptre of thy might out of Zion: rule in the midst of thine enemies.
content_old: 2 Jehovah shall send the sceptre of thy might out of Zion: rule in the midst of thine enemies.

content: 3 Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in holy splendour: from the womb of the morning shall come to thee the dew of thy youth.
content_old: 3 Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in holy splendour: from the womb of the morning shall come to thee the dew of thy youth.

content: 4 Jehovah hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art priest for ever after the order of Melchisedek.
content_old: 4 Jehovah hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art priest for ever after the order of Melchisedek.

content: 5 The Lord at thy right hand will smite through kings in the day of his anger.
content_old: 5 The Lord at thy right hand will smite through kings in the day of his anger.

content: 6 He shall judge among the nations; he shall fill all places with dead bodies; he shall smite through the head over a great country.
content_old: 6 He shall judge among the nations; he shall fill all places with dead bodies; he shall smite through the head over a great country.

content: 1 Hallelujah! I will celebrate Jehovah with my whole heart, in the council of the upright, and in the assembly.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah! I will celebrate Jehovah with my whole heart, in the council of the upright, and in the assembly.

content: 2 Great are the works of Jehovah; sought out of all that delight in them.
content_old: 2 Great are the works of Jehovah; sought out of all that delight in them.

content: 3 His work is majesty and splendour, and his righteousness abideth for ever.
content_old: 3 His work is majesty and splendour, and his righteousness abideth for ever.

content: 4 He hath made his wonders to be remembered: Jehovah is gracious and merciful.
content_old: 4 He hath made his wonders to be remembered: Jehovah is gracious and merciful.

content: 5 He hath given meat unto them that fear him; he is ever mindful of his covenant.
content_old: 5 He hath given meat unto them that fear him; he is ever mindful of his covenant.

content: 6 He hath shewn his people the power of his works, to give them the heritage of the nations.
content_old: 6 He hath shewn his people the power of his works, to give them the heritage of the nations.

content: 7 The works of his hands are truth and judgment; all his precepts are faithful:
content_old: 7 The works of his hands are truth and judgment; all his precepts are faithful:

content: 8 Maintained for ever and ever, done in truth and uprightness.
content_old: 8 Maintained for ever and ever, done in truth and uprightness.

content: 9 He sent deliverance unto his people; he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and terrible is his name.
content_old: 9 He sent deliverance unto his people; he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and terrible is his name.

content: 1 Hallelujah! Blessed is the man that feareth Jehovah, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah! Blessed is the man that feareth Jehovah, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.

content: 2 His seed shall be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright shall be blessed.
content_old: 2 His seed shall be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright shall be blessed.

content: 3 Wealth and riches shall be in his house; and his righteousness abideth for ever.
content_old: 3 Wealth and riches shall be in his house; and his righteousness abideth for ever.

content: 4 Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness; he is gracious, and merciful, and righteous.
content_old: 4 Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness; he is gracious, and merciful, and righteous.

content: 5 It is well with the man that is gracious and lendeth; he will sustain his cause in judgment.
content_old: 5 It is well with the man that is gracious and lendeth; he will sustain his cause in judgment.

content: 6 For he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.
content_old: 6 For he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.

content: 7 He shall not be afraid of evil tidings; his heart is fixed confiding in Jehovah;
content_old: 7 He shall not be afraid of evil tidings; his heart is fixed confiding in Jehovah;

content: 8 His heart is maintained, he is not afraid, until he see his desire upon his oppressors.
content_old: 8 His heart is maintained, he is not afraid, until he see his desire upon his oppressors.

content: 9 He scattereth abroad, he giveth to the needy; his righteousness abideth for ever: his horn shall be exalted with honour.

content: 1 Hallelujah! Praise, ye servants of Jehovah, praise the name of Jehovah.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah! Praise, ye servants of Jehovah, praise the name of Jehovah.

content: 2 Blessed be the name of Jehovah, from this time forth and for evermore!
content_old: 2 Blessed be the name of Jehovah, from this time forth and for evermore!

content: 3 From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same, let Jehovah’s name be praised.
content_old: 3 From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same, let Jehovah’s name be praised.

content: 4 Jehovah is high above all nations, his glory above the heavens.
content_old: 4 Jehovah is high above all nations, his glory above the heavens.

content: 5 Who is like unto Jehovah our God, who hath placed his dwelling on high;
content_old: 5 Who is like unto Jehovah our God, who hath placed his dwelling on high;

content: 6 Who humbleth himself to look on the heavens and on the earth?
content_old: 6 Who humbleth himself to look on the heavens and on the earth?

content: 7 He raiseth up the poor out of the dust; from the dung-hill he lifteth up the needy,
content_old: 7 He raiseth up the poor out of the dust; from the dung-hill he lifteth up the needy,

content: 8 To set him among nobles, among the nobles of his people.

content: 1 When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,

content: 2 Judah was his sanctuary, Israel his dominion.

content: 3 The sea saw it and fled, the Jordan turned back;

content: 4 The mountains skipped like rams, the hills like lambs.
content_old: 4 The mountains skipped like rams, the hills like lambs.

content: 5 What ailed thee, thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou turnedst back?
content_old: 5 What ailed thee, thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou turnedst back?

content: 6 Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams? ye hills, like lambs?

content: 1 Not unto us, O Jehovah, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy loving-kindness and for thy truth’s sake.
content_old: 1 Not unto us, O Jehovah, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy loving-kindness and for thy truth’s sake.

content: 2 Wherefore should the nations say, Where then is their God?
content_old: 2 Wherefore should the nations say, Where then is their God?

content: 3 But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he pleased.
content_old: 3 But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he pleased.

content: 4 Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands:
content_old: 4 Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands:

content: 5 They have a mouth, and they speak not; eyes have they, and they see not;
content_old: 5 They have a mouth, and they speak not; eyes have they, and they see not;

content: 6 They have ears, and they hear not; a nose have they, and they smell not;
content_old: 6 They have ears, and they hear not; a nose have they, and they smell not;

content: 7 They have hands, and they handle not; feet have they, and they walk not; they give no sound through their throat.
content_old: 7 They have hands, and they handle not; feet have they, and they walk not; they give no sound through their throat.

content: 8 They that make them are like unto them, —every one that confideth in them.
content_old: 8 They that make them are like unto them, —every one that confideth in them.

content: 9 O Israel, confide thou in Jehovah: he is their help and their shield.
content_old: 9 O Israel, confide thou in Jehovah: he is their help and their shield.

content: 10 House of Aaron, confide in Jehovah: he is their help and their shield.
content_old: 10 House of Aaron, confide in Jehovah: he is their help and their shield.

content: 11 Ye that fear Jehovah, confide in Jehovah: he is their help and their shield.
content_old: 11 Ye that fear Jehovah, confide in Jehovah: he is their help and their shield.

content: 12 Jehovah hath been mindful of us: he will bless, he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron;
content_old: 12 Jehovah hath been mindful of us: he will bless, he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron;

content: 13 He will bless them that fear Jehovah, both the small and the great.
content_old: 13 He will bless them that fear Jehovah, both the small and the great.

content: 14 Jehovah will add unto you more, unto you and unto your children.
content_old: 14 Jehovah will add unto you more, unto you and unto your children.

content: 15 Ye are blessed of Jehovah, who made the heavens and the earth.
content_old: 15 Ye are blessed of Jehovah, who made the heavens and the earth.

content: 16 The heavens are the heavens of Jehovah, but the earth hath he given to the children of men.
content_old: 16 The heavens are the heavens of Jehovah, but the earth hath he given to the children of men.

content: 17 The dead praise not Jah, neither any that go down into silence;

content: 1 I love Jehovah, for he hath heard my voice and my supplications;
content_old: 1 I love Jehovah, for he hath heard my voice and my supplications;

content: 2 For he hath inclined his ear unto me, and I will call upon him during all my days.
content_old: 2 For he hath inclined his ear unto me, and I will call upon him during all my days.

content: 3 The bands of death encompassed me, and the anguish of Sheol took hold of me; I found trouble and sorrow:
content_old: 3 The bands of death encompassed me, and the anguish of Sheol took hold of me; I found trouble and sorrow:

content: 4 Then called I upon the name of Jehovah: I beseech thee, Jehovah, deliver my soul.
content_old: 4 Then called I upon the name of Jehovah: I beseech thee, Jehovah, deliver my soul.

content: 5 Gracious is Jehovah and righteous; and our God is merciful.
content_old: 5 Gracious is Jehovah and righteous; and our God is merciful.

content: 6 Jehovah keepeth the simple: I was brought low, and he saved me.
content_old: 6 Jehovah keepeth the simple: I was brought low, and he saved me.

content: 7 Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for Jehovah hath dealt bountifully with thee.
content_old: 7 Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for Jehovah hath dealt bountifully with thee.

content: 8 For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, my feet from falling.
content_old: 8 For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, my feet from falling.

content: 9 I will walk before Jehovah in the land of the living.
content_old: 9 I will walk before Jehovah in the land of the living.

content: 10 I believed, therefore have I spoken. As for me, I was greatly afflicted.
content_old: 10 I believed, therefore have I spoken. As for me, I was greatly afflicted.

content: 11 I said in my haste, All men are liars.

content: 12 What shall I render unto Jehovah, for all his benefits toward me?
content_old: 12 What shall I render unto Jehovah, for all his benefits toward me?

content_old: 13 I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of Jehovah.

content: 14 I will perform my vows unto Jehovah, yea, before all his people.
content_old: 14 I will perform my vows unto Jehovah, yea, before all his people.

content: 15 Precious in the sight of Jehovah is the death of his saints.
content_old: 15 Precious in the sight of Jehovah is the death of his saints.

content: 18 I will perform my vows unto Jehovah, yea, before all his people,

content: 1 Praise Jehovah, all ye nations; laud him, all ye peoples;

content: 1 Give ye thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.
content_old: 1 Give ye thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.

content: 2 Oh let Israel say, that his loving-kindness endureth for ever.
content_old: 2 Oh let Israel say, that his loving-kindness endureth for ever.

content: 3 Oh let the house of Aaron say, that his loving-kindness endureth for ever.
content_old: 3 Oh let the house of Aaron say, that his loving-kindness endureth for ever.

content: 4 Oh let them that fear Jehovah say, that his loving-kindness endureth for ever.
content_old: 4 Oh let them that fear Jehovah say, that his loving-kindness endureth for ever.

content: 5 I called upon Jah in distress; Jah answered me and set me in a large place.
content_old: 5 I called upon Jah in distress; Jah answered me and set me in a large place.

content: 6 Jehovah is for me, I will not fear; what can man do unto me?
content_old: 6 Jehovah is for me, I will not fear; what can man do unto me?

content: 7 Jehovah is for me among them that help me; and I shall see my desire upon them that hate me.
content_old: 7 Jehovah is for me among them that help me; and I shall see my desire upon them that hate me.

content: 8 It is better to trust in Jehovah than to put confidence in man;
content_old: 8 It is better to trust in Jehovah than to put confidence in man;

content: 9 It is better to trust in Jehovah than to put confidence in nobles.

content: 10 All nations encompassed me; but in the name of Jehovah have I destroyed them.

content: 11 They encompassed me, yea, encompassed me; but in the name of Jehovah have I destroyed them.
content_old: 11 They encompassed me, yea, encompassed me; but in the name of Jehovah have I destroyed them.

content: 12 They encompassed me like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of Jehovah have I destroyed them.

content: 14 My strength and song is Jah, and he is become my salvation.

content_old: 15 The voice of triumph and salvation is in the tents of the righteous: the right hand of Jehovah doeth valiantly;

content_old: 16 The right hand of Jehovah is exalted, the right hand of Jehovah doeth valiantly.

content: 17 I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of Jah.

content_old: 18 Jah hath chastened me sore; but he hath not given me over unto death.

content_old: 24 This is the day that Jehovah hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

content: 27 Jehovah is •God, and he hath given us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, —up to the horns of the altar.

content: 28 Thou art my •God, and I will give thee thanks; my God, I will exalt thee.
