content: 78 Let the proud be ashamed; for they have acted perversely towards me with falsehood: as for me, I meditate in thy precepts.
content_old: 78 Let the proud be ashamed; for they have acted perversely towards me with falsehood: as for me, I meditate in thy precepts.

content: 79 Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that know thy testimonies.
content_old: 79 Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that know thy testimonies.

content: 80 Let my heart be perfect in thy statutes, that I be not ashamed.
content_old: 80 Let my heart be perfect in thy statutes, that I be not ashamed.

content: 81 My soul fainteth for thy salvation; I hope in thy word.
content_old: 81 My soul fainteth for thy salvation; I hope in thy word.

content: 82 Mine eyes fail for thy •word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?
content_old: 82 Mine eyes fail for thy •word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?

content: 83 For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; I do not forget thy statutes.
content_old: 83 For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; I do not forget thy statutes.

content: 84 How many shall be the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
content_old: 84 How many shall be the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

content: 85 The proud have digged pits for me, which is not according to thy law.
content_old: 85 The proud have digged pits for me, which is not according to thy law.

content: 86 All thy commandments are faithfulness. They persecute me wrongfully: help thou me.
content_old: 86 All thy commandments are faithfulness. They persecute me wrongfully: help thou me.

content: 87 They had almost consumed me upon the earth; but as for me, I forsook not thy precepts.
content_old: 87 They had almost consumed me upon the earth; but as for me, I forsook not thy precepts.

content: 88 Quicken me according to thy loving-kindness, and I will keep the testimony of thy mouth.
content_old: 88 Quicken me according to thy loving-kindness, and I will keep the testimony of thy mouth.

content: 89 For ever, O Jehovah, thy word is settled in the heavens.
content_old: 89 For ever, O Jehovah, thy word is settled in the heavens.

content: 90 Thy faithfulness is from generation to generation: thou hast established the earth, and it standeth.
content_old: 90 Thy faithfulness is from generation to generation: thou hast established the earth, and it standeth.

content: 91 By thine ordinances they stand this day; for all things are thy servants.
content_old: 91 By thine ordinances they stand this day; for all things are thy servants.

content: 92 Unless thy law had been my delight, I should then have perished in mine affliction.
content_old: 92 Unless thy law had been my delight, I should then have perished in mine affliction.

content: 93 I will never forget thy precepts; for by them thou hast quickened me.
content_old: 93 I will never forget thy precepts; for by them thou hast quickened me.

content: 94 I am thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.
content_old: 94 I am thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.

content: 95 The wicked have awaited me to destroy me; but I attend unto thy testimonies.
content_old: 95 The wicked have awaited me to destroy me; but I attend unto thy testimonies.

content: 96 I have seen an end of all perfection: thy commandment is exceeding broad.
content_old: 96 I have seen an end of all perfection: thy commandment is exceeding broad.

content: 97 Oh how I love thy law! it is my meditation all the day.
content_old: 97 Oh how I love thy law! it is my meditation all the day.

content: 98 Thy commandments make me wiser than mine enemies; for they are ever with me.
content_old: 98 Thy commandments make me wiser than mine enemies; for they are ever with me.

content: 99 I have more understanding than all my teachers; for thy testimonies are my meditation.
content_old: 99 I have more understanding than all my teachers; for thy testimonies are my meditation.

content: 100 I understand more than the aged, because I have observed thy precepts.
content_old: 100 I understand more than the aged, because I have observed thy precepts.

content: 101 I have refrained my feet from every evil path, that I might keep thy word.
content_old: 101 I have refrained my feet from every evil path, that I might keep thy word.

content: 102 I have not departed from thy judgments; for it is thou that hast taught me.
content_old: 102 I have not departed from thy judgments; for it is thou that hast taught me.

content: 103 How sweet are thy •words unto my taste! more than honey to my mouth!
content_old: 103 How sweet are thy •words unto my taste! more than honey to my mouth!

content: 104 From thy precepts I get understanding; therefore I hate every false path.
content_old: 104 From thy precepts I get understanding; therefore I hate every false path.

content: 105 Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
content_old: 105 Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

content: 106 I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
content_old: 106 I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.

content: 107 I am afflicted very much; O Jehovah, quicken me according to thy word.
content_old: 107 I am afflicted very much; O Jehovah, quicken me according to thy word.

content: 108 Accept, I beseech thee, Jehovah, the voluntary-offerings of my mouth, and teach me thy judgments.
content_old: 108 Accept, I beseech thee, Jehovah, the voluntary-offerings of my mouth, and teach me thy judgments.

content: 109 My life is continually in my hand; but I do not forget thy law.
content_old: 109 My life is continually in my hand; but I do not forget thy law.

content: 110 The wicked have laid a snare for me; but I have not wandered from thy precepts.
content_old: 110 The wicked have laid a snare for me; but I have not wandered from thy precepts.

content: 111 Thy testimonies have I taken as a heritage for ever; for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
content_old: 111 Thy testimonies have I taken as a heritage for ever; for they are the rejoicing of my heart.

content: 112 I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes for ever, unto the end.
content_old: 112 I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes for ever, unto the end.

content: 113 The double-minded have I hated; but thy law do I love.
content_old: 113 The double-minded have I hated; but thy law do I love.

content: 114 Thou art my hiding-place and my shield: I hope in thy word.
content_old: 114 Thou art my hiding-place and my shield: I hope in thy word.

content: 115 Depart from me, ye evil-doers; and I will observe the commandments of my God.
content_old: 115 Depart from me, ye evil-doers; and I will observe the commandments of my God.

content: 116 Uphold me according to thy •word, that I may live; and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
content_old: 116 Uphold me according to thy •word, that I may live; and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

content: 117 Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe; and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.
content_old: 117 Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe; and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.

content: 118 Thou hast set at nought all them that wander from thy statutes; for their deceit is falsehood.
content_old: 118 Thou hast set at nought all them that wander from thy statutes; for their deceit is falsehood.

content: 119 Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross; therefore I love thy testimonies.
content_old: 119 Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross; therefore I love thy testimonies.

content: 120 My flesh shuddereth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.
content_old: 120 My flesh shuddereth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

content: 121 I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.
content_old: 121 I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.

content: 122 Be surety for thy servant for good; let not the proud oppress me.
content_old: 122 Be surety for thy servant for good; let not the proud oppress me.

content: 123 Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the •word of thy righteousness.
content_old: 123 Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the •word of thy righteousness.

content: 124 Deal with thy servant according to thy loving-kindness, and teach me thy statutes.
content_old: 124 Deal with thy servant according to thy loving-kindness, and teach me thy statutes.

content: 125 I am thy servant; give me understanding that I may know thy testimonies.
content_old: 125 I am thy servant; give me understanding that I may know thy testimonies.

content: 126 It is time for Jehovah to work: they have made void thy law.
content_old: 126 It is time for Jehovah to work: they have made void thy law.

content: 127 Therefore I love thy commandments above gold, yea, above fine gold.
content_old: 127 Therefore I love thy commandments above gold, yea, above fine gold.

content: 128 Therefore I regard all thy precepts concerning all things to be right: I hate every false path.
content_old: 128 Therefore I regard all thy precepts concerning all things to be right: I hate every false path.

content: 129 Thy testimonies are wonderful; therefore doth my soul observe them.
content_old: 129 Thy testimonies are wonderful; therefore doth my soul observe them.

content: 130 The entrance of thy words giveth light, giving understanding unto the simple.
content_old: 130 The entrance of thy words giveth light, giving understanding unto the simple.

content: 131 I opened my mouth wide and panted; for I longed for thy commandments.
content_old: 131 I opened my mouth wide and panted; for I longed for thy commandments.

content: 132 Turn unto me, and be gracious unto me, as thou art wont to do unto those that love thy name.
content_old: 132 Turn unto me, and be gracious unto me, as thou art wont to do unto those that love thy name.

content: 133 Establish my steps in thy •word; and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
content_old: 133 Establish my steps in thy •word; and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

content: 134 Deliver me from the oppression of man; and I will keep thy precepts.
content_old: 134 Deliver me from the oppression of man; and I will keep thy precepts.

content: 135 Make thy face to shine upon thy servant, and teach me thy statutes.
content_old: 135 Make thy face to shine upon thy servant, and teach me thy statutes.

content: 136 Mine eyes run down with streams of water, because they keep not thy law.
content_old: 136 Mine eyes run down with streams of water, because they keep not thy law.

content: 137 Righteous art thou, Jehovah, and upright are thy judgments.
content_old: 137 Righteous art thou, Jehovah, and upright are thy judgments.

content: 138 Thou hast commanded thy testimonies in righteousness and exceeding faithfulness.
content_old: 138 Thou hast commanded thy testimonies in righteousness and exceeding faithfulness.

content: 139 My zeal destroyeth me, because mine oppressors have forgotten thy words.
content_old: 139 My zeal destroyeth me, because mine oppressors have forgotten thy words.

content: 140 Thy •word is exceeding pure, and thy servant loveth it.
content_old: 140 Thy •word is exceeding pure, and thy servant loveth it.

content: 141 I am little and despised: thy precepts have I not forgotten.
content_old: 141 I am little and despised: thy precepts have I not forgotten.

content: 142 Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is truth.
content_old: 142 Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is truth.

content: 143 Trouble and anguish have taken hold upon me: thy commandments are my delights.
content_old: 143 Trouble and anguish have taken hold upon me: thy commandments are my delights.

content: 144 The righteousness of thy testimonies is for ever: give me understanding, and I shall live.
content_old: 144 The righteousness of thy testimonies is for ever: give me understanding, and I shall live.

content: 145 I have called with my whole heart; answer me, O Jehovah: I will observe thy statutes.
content_old: 145 I have called with my whole heart; answer me, O Jehovah: I will observe thy statutes.

content: 146 I call upon thee; save me, and I will keep thy testimonies.
content_old: 146 I call upon thee; save me, and I will keep thy testimonies.

content: 147 I anticipate the morning-dawn and I cry: I hope in thy word.
content_old: 147 I anticipate the morning-dawn and I cry: I hope in thy word.

content: 148 Mine eyes anticipate the night-watches, that I may meditate in thy •word.
content_old: 148 Mine eyes anticipate the night-watches, that I may meditate in thy •word.

content: 149 Hear my voice according to thy loving-kindness: O Jehovah, quicken me according to thy judgment.
content_old: 149 Hear my voice according to thy loving-kindness: O Jehovah, quicken me according to thy judgment.

content: 150 They have drawn nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.
content_old: 150 They have drawn nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

content: 151 Thou, Jehovah, art near, and all thy commandments are truth.
content_old: 151 Thou, Jehovah, art near, and all thy commandments are truth.

content: 152 From thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.
content_old: 152 From thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.

content: 153 See mine affliction, and deliver me; for I have not forgotten thy law.
content_old: 153 See mine affliction, and deliver me; for I have not forgotten thy law.

content: 154 Plead my cause, and redeem me: quicken me according to thy •word.
content_old: 154 Plead my cause, and redeem me: quicken me according to thy •word.

content: 155 Salvation is far from the wicked; for they seek not thy statutes.
content_old: 155 Salvation is far from the wicked; for they seek not thy statutes.

content: 156 Many are thy tender mercies, O Jehovah; quicken me according to thy judgments.
content_old: 156 Many are thy tender mercies, O Jehovah; quicken me according to thy judgments.

content: 157 Many are my persecutors and mine oppressors; I have not declined from thy testimonies.
content_old: 157 Many are my persecutors and mine oppressors; I have not declined from thy testimonies.

content: 158 I beheld them that deal treacherously, and was grieved; because they kept not thy •word.
content_old: 158 I beheld them that deal treacherously, and was grieved; because they kept not thy •word.

content: 159 See how I have loved thy precepts: quicken me, O Jehovah, according to thy loving-kindness.
content_old: 159 See how I have loved thy precepts: quicken me, O Jehovah, according to thy loving-kindness.

content: 160 The sum of thy word is truth, and every righteous judgment of thine is for ever.
content_old: 160 The sum of thy word is truth, and every righteous judgment of thine is for ever.

content: 161 Princes have persecuted me without a cause; but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.
content_old: 161 Princes have persecuted me without a cause; but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

content: 162 I have joy in thy •word, as one that findeth great spoil.
content_old: 162 I have joy in thy •word, as one that findeth great spoil.

content: 163 I hate and abhor falsehood; thy law do I love.
content_old: 163 I hate and abhor falsehood; thy law do I love.

content: 164 Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.
content_old: 164 Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.

content: 165 Great peace have they that love thy law, and nothing doth stumble them.
content_old: 165 Great peace have they that love thy law, and nothing doth stumble them.

content: 166 I have hoped for thy salvation, O Jehovah, and have done thy commandments.
content_old: 166 I have hoped for thy salvation, O Jehovah, and have done thy commandments.

content: 167 My soul hath kept thy testimonies, and I love them exceedingly.
content_old: 167 My soul hath kept thy testimonies, and I love them exceedingly.

content: 168 I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies; for all my ways are before thee.
content_old: 168 I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies; for all my ways are before thee.

content: 169 Let my cry come near before thee, Jehovah: give me understanding according to thy word.
content_old: 169 Let my cry come near before thee, Jehovah: give me understanding according to thy word.

content: 170 Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy •word.
content_old: 170 Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy •word.

content: 171 My lips shall pour forth praise when thou hast taught me thy statutes.
content_old: 171 My lips shall pour forth praise when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

content: 172 My tongue shall speak aloud of thy •word; for all thy commandments are righteousness.
content_old: 172 My tongue shall speak aloud of thy •word; for all thy commandments are righteousness.

content: 173 Let thy hand be for my help; for I have chosen thy precepts.
content_old: 173 Let thy hand be for my help; for I have chosen thy precepts.

content: 174 I have longed for thy salvation, O Jehovah, and thy law is my delight.
content_old: 174 I have longed for thy salvation, O Jehovah, and thy law is my delight.

content: 175 Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.
content_old: 175 Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 In my trouble I called unto Jehovah, and he answered me.
content_old: 1 In my trouble I called unto Jehovah, and he answered me.

content: 2 Jehovah, deliver my soul from the lying lip, from the deceitful tongue.
content_old: 2 Jehovah, deliver my soul from the lying lip, from the deceitful tongue.

content: 3 What shall be given unto thee, what shall be added unto thee, thou deceitful tongue?
content_old: 3 What shall be given unto thee, what shall be added unto thee, thou deceitful tongue?

content: 4 Sharp arrows of a mighty one, with burning coals of broom-wood.
content_old: 4 Sharp arrows of a mighty one, with burning coals of broom-wood.

content: 5 Woe is me, that I sojourn in Meshech, that I dwell among the tents of Kedar!
content_old: 5 Woe is me, that I sojourn in Meshech, that I dwell among the tents of Kedar!

content: 6 My soul hath long dwelt with them that hate peace.
content_old: 6 My soul hath long dwelt with them that hate peace.

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 I lift up mine eyes unto the mountains: whence shall my help come?
content_old: 1 I lift up mine eyes unto the mountains: whence shall my help come?

content: 2 My help cometh from Jehovah, who made the heavens and the earth.
content_old: 2 My help cometh from Jehovah, who made the heavens and the earth.

content: 3 He will not suffer thy foot to be moved; he that keepeth thee will not slumber.
content_old: 3 He will not suffer thy foot to be moved; he that keepeth thee will not slumber.

content: 4 Behold, he that keepeth Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.
content_old: 4 Behold, he that keepeth Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.

content: 5 Jehovah is thy keeper, Jehovah is thy shade upon thy right hand;
content_old: 5 Jehovah is thy keeper, Jehovah is thy shade upon thy right hand;

content: 6 The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
content_old: 6 The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

content: 7 Jehovah will keep thee from all evil; he will keep thy soul.
content_old: 7 Jehovah will keep thee from all evil; he will keep thy soul.

content: A Song of degrees. Of David.
content_old: A Song of degrees. Of David.

content: 1 I rejoiced when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of Jehovah.
content_old: 1 I rejoiced when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of Jehovah.

content: 2 Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O Jerusalem.
content_old: 2 Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O Jerusalem.

content: 3 Jerusalem, which art built as a city that is compact together,
content_old: 3 Jerusalem, which art built as a city that is compact together,

content: 4 Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of Jah, a testimony to Israel, to give thanks unto the name of Jehovah.
content_old: 4 Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of Jah, a testimony to Israel, to give thanks unto the name of Jehovah.

content: 5 For there are set thrones for judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
content_old: 5 For there are set thrones for judgment, the thrones of the house of David.

content: 6 Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.
content_old: 6 Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.

content: 7 Peace be within thy bulwarks, prosperity within thy palaces.
content_old: 7 Peace be within thy bulwarks, prosperity within thy palaces.

content: 8 For my brethren and companions’ sakes I will say, Peace be within thee!
content_old: 8 For my brethren and companions’ sakes I will say, Peace be within thee!

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 Unto thee do I lift up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.
content_old: 1 Unto thee do I lift up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

content: 2 Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress, so our eyes are directed to Jehovah our God, until he be gracious unto us.
content_old: 2 Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress, so our eyes are directed to Jehovah our God, until he be gracious unto us.

content: 3 Be gracious unto us, O Jehovah, be gracious unto us; for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.
content_old: 3 Be gracious unto us, O Jehovah, be gracious unto us; for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

content: A Song of degrees. Of David.
content_old: A Song of degrees. Of David.

content: 1 If it had not been Jehovah who was for us—oh let Israel say—
content_old: 1 If it had not been Jehovah who was for us—oh let Israel say—

content: 2 If it had not been Jehovah who was for us, when men rose up against us,
content_old: 2 If it had not been Jehovah who was for us, when men rose up against us,

content: 3 Then they had swallowed us up alive, when their anger was kindled against us;
content_old: 3 Then they had swallowed us up alive, when their anger was kindled against us;

content: 4 Then the waters had overwhelmed us, a torrent had gone over our soul;
content_old: 4 Then the waters had overwhelmed us, a torrent had gone over our soul;

content: 5 Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.
content_old: 5 Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.

content: 6 Blessed be Jehovah, who gave us not up a prey to their teeth!
content_old: 6 Blessed be Jehovah, who gave us not up a prey to their teeth!

content: 7 Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we have escaped.
content_old: 7 Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we have escaped.

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 They that confide in Jehovah are as mount Zion, which cannot be moved; it abideth for ever.
content_old: 1 They that confide in Jehovah are as mount Zion, which cannot be moved; it abideth for ever.

content: 2 Jerusalem! —mountains are round about her, and Jehovah is round about his people, from henceforth and for evermore.
content_old: 2 Jerusalem! —mountains are round about her, and Jehovah is round about his people, from henceforth and for evermore.

content: 3 For the sceptre of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.
content_old: 3 For the sceptre of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.

content: 4 Do good, O Jehovah, unto the good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.
content_old: 4 Do good, O Jehovah, unto the good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 When Jehovah turned the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.
content_old: 1 When Jehovah turned the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.

content: 2 Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with rejoicing: then said they among the nations, Jehovah hath done great things for them.
content_old: 2 Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with rejoicing: then said they among the nations, Jehovah hath done great things for them.

content: 3 Jehovah hath done great things for us; and we are joyful.
content_old: 3 Jehovah hath done great things for us; and we are joyful.

content: 4 Turn our captivity, O Jehovah, as the streams in the south.
content_old: 4 Turn our captivity, O Jehovah, as the streams in the south.

content: 5 They that sow in tears shall reap with rejoicing:
content_old: 5 They that sow in tears shall reap with rejoicing:

content: A Song of degrees. Of Solomon.
content_old: A Song of degrees. Of Solomon.

content: 1 Unless Jehovah build the house, in vain do its builders labour in it; unless Jehovah keep the city, the keeper watcheth in vain:
content_old: 1 Unless Jehovah build the house, in vain do its builders labour in it; unless Jehovah keep the city, the keeper watcheth in vain:

content: 2 It is vain for you to rise up early, to lie down late, to eat the bread of sorrows: so to his beloved one he giveth sleep.
content_old: 2 It is vain for you to rise up early, to lie down late, to eat the bread of sorrows: so to his beloved one he giveth sleep.

content: 3 Lo, children are an inheritance from Jehovah, and the fruit of the womb a reward.
content_old: 3 Lo, children are an inheritance from Jehovah, and the fruit of the womb a reward.

content: 4 As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the children of youth.
content_old: 4 As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the children of youth.

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 Blessed is every one that feareth Jehovah, that walketh in his ways.
content_old: 1 Blessed is every one that feareth Jehovah, that walketh in his ways.

content: 2 For thou shalt eat the labour of thy hands; happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.
content_old: 2 For thou shalt eat the labour of thy hands; happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.

content: 3 Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine in the inner part of thy house; thy children like olive-plants round about thy table.
content_old: 3 Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine in the inner part of thy house; thy children like olive-plants round about thy table.

content: 4 Behold, thus shall the man be blessed that feareth Jehovah.
content_old: 4 Behold, thus shall the man be blessed that feareth Jehovah.

content: 5 Jehovah will bless thee out of Zion; and mayest thou see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life,
content_old: 5 Jehovah will bless thee out of Zion; and mayest thou see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life,

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth—oh let Israel say—
content_old: 1 Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth—oh let Israel say—

content: 2 Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth; yet they have not prevailed against me.
content_old: 2 Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth; yet they have not prevailed against me.

content: 3 The ploughers ploughed upon my back; they made long their furrows.
content_old: 3 The ploughers ploughed upon my back; they made long their furrows.

content: 4 Jehovah is righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.
content_old: 4 Jehovah is righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.

content: 5 Let them be ashamed and turned backward, all that hate Zion;
content_old: 5 Let them be ashamed and turned backward, all that hate Zion;

content: 6 Let them be as the grass upon the house-tops, which withereth before it is plucked up,
content_old: 6 Let them be as the grass upon the house-tops, which withereth before it is plucked up,

content: 7 Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand, nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom;
content_old: 7 Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand, nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom;

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 Out of the depths do I call upon thee, Jehovah.
content_old: 1 Out of the depths do I call upon thee, Jehovah.

content: 2 Lord, hear my voice; let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplication.
content_old: 2 Lord, hear my voice; let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplication.

content: 3 If thou, Jah, shouldest mark iniquities, Lord, who shall stand?
content_old: 3 If thou, Jah, shouldest mark iniquities, Lord, who shall stand?

content: 4 But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.
content_old: 4 But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.

content: 5 I wait for Jehovah; my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
content_old: 5 I wait for Jehovah; my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.

content: 6 My soul waiteth for the Lord more than the watchers wait for the morning, more than the watchers for the morning.
content_old: 6 My soul waiteth for the Lord more than the watchers wait for the morning, more than the watchers for the morning.

content: 7 Let Israel hope in Jehovah, because with Jehovah there is loving-kindness, and with him is plenteous redemption;
content_old: 7 Let Israel hope in Jehovah, because with Jehovah there is loving-kindness, and with him is plenteous redemption;

content: A Song of degrees. Of David.
content_old: A Song of degrees. Of David.

content: 1 Jehovah, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; neither do I exercise myself in great matters, and in things too wonderful for me.
content_old: 1 Jehovah, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; neither do I exercise myself in great matters, and in things too wonderful for me.

content: 2 Surely I have restrained and composed my soul, like a weaned child with its mother: my soul within me is as a weaned child.
content_old: 2 Surely I have restrained and composed my soul, like a weaned child with its mother: my soul within me is as a weaned child.

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 Jehovah, remember for David all his affliction;
content_old: 1 Jehovah, remember for David all his affliction;

content: 2 How he swore unto Jehovah, vowed unto the Mighty One of Jacob:
content_old: 2 How he swore unto Jehovah, vowed unto the Mighty One of Jacob:

content: 3 I will not come into the tent of my house, I will not go up to the couch of my bed;
content_old: 3 I will not come into the tent of my house, I will not go up to the couch of my bed;

content: 4 I will not give sleep to mine eyes, slumber to mine eyelids,
content_old: 4 I will not give sleep to mine eyes, slumber to mine eyelids,

content: 5 Until I find out a place for Jehovah, habitations for the Mighty One of Jacob. …
content_old: 5 Until I find out a place for Jehovah, habitations for the Mighty One of Jacob. …

content: 6 Behold, we heard of it at Ephratah, we found it in the fields of the wood.
content_old: 6 Behold, we heard of it at Ephratah, we found it in the fields of the wood.

content: 7 Let us go into his habitations, let us worship at his footstool.
content_old: 7 Let us go into his habitations, let us worship at his footstool.

content: 8 Arise, Jehovah, into thy rest, thou and the ark of thy strength.
content_old: 8 Arise, Jehovah, into thy rest, thou and the ark of thy strength.

content: 9 Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness, and let thy saints shout for joy.
content_old: 9 Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness, and let thy saints shout for joy.

content: 10 For thy servant David’s sake, turn not away the face of thine anointed.
content_old: 10 For thy servant David’s sake, turn not away the face of thine anointed.

content: 11 Jehovah hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it: Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne;
content_old: 11 Jehovah hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it: Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne;

content: 12 If thy children keep my covenant, and my testimonies which I will teach them, their children also for evermore shall sit upon thy throne.
content_old: 12 If thy children keep my covenant, and my testimonies which I will teach them, their children also for evermore shall sit upon thy throne.

content: 13 For Jehovah hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his dwelling:
content_old: 13 For Jehovah hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his dwelling:

content: 14 This is my rest for ever; here will I dwell, for I have desired it.
content_old: 14 This is my rest for ever; here will I dwell, for I have desired it.

content: 15 I will abundantly bless her provision; I will satisfy her needy ones with bread;
content_old: 15 I will abundantly bless her provision; I will satisfy her needy ones with bread;

content: 16 And I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
content_old: 16 And I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

content: 17 There will I cause the horn of David to bud forth; I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.
content_old: 17 There will I cause the horn of David to bud forth; I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.

content: A Song of degrees. Of David.
content_old: A Song of degrees. Of David.

content: 1 Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
content_old: 1 Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!

content: 2 Like the precious oil upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, upon Aaron’s beard, that ran down to the hem of his garments;
content_old: 2 Like the precious oil upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, upon Aaron’s beard, that ran down to the hem of his garments;

content: A Song of degrees.
content_old: A Song of degrees.

content: 1 Behold, bless Jehovah, all ye servants of Jehovah, who by night stand in the house of Jehovah.
content_old: 1 Behold, bless Jehovah, all ye servants of Jehovah, who by night stand in the house of Jehovah.

content: 2 Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless Jehovah.
content_old: 2 Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless Jehovah.

content: 1 Hallelujah! Praise the name of Jehovah; praise, ye servants of Jehovah,
content_old: 1 Hallelujah! Praise the name of Jehovah; praise, ye servants of Jehovah,

content: 2 Ye that stand in the house of Jehovah, in the courts of the house of our God.
content_old: 2 Ye that stand in the house of Jehovah, in the courts of the house of our God.

content: 3 Praise ye Jah; for Jehovah is good: sing psalms unto his name; for it is pleasant.
content_old: 3 Praise ye Jah; for Jehovah is good: sing psalms unto his name; for it is pleasant.

content: 4 For Jah hath chosen Jacob unto himself, Israel for his own possession.
content_old: 4 For Jah hath chosen Jacob unto himself, Israel for his own possession.

content: 5 For I know that Jehovah is great, and our Lord is above all gods.
content_old: 5 For I know that Jehovah is great, and our Lord is above all gods.

content: 6 Whatsoever Jehovah pleased, he hath done in the heavens and on the earth, in the seas and all deeps;
content_old: 6 Whatsoever Jehovah pleased, he hath done in the heavens and on the earth, in the seas and all deeps;

content: 7 Who causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; who maketh lightnings for the rain; who bringeth the wind out of his treasuries:
content_old: 7 Who causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; who maketh lightnings for the rain; who bringeth the wind out of his treasuries:

content: 8 Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast;
content_old: 8 Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast;

content: 9 Who sent signs and miracles into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh and upon all his servants;
content_old: 9 Who sent signs and miracles into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh and upon all his servants;

content: 10 Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings,
content_old: 10 Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings,

content: 11 Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan;
content_old: 11 Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan;

content: 12 And gave their land for an inheritance, an inheritance unto Israel his people.
content_old: 12 And gave their land for an inheritance, an inheritance unto Israel his people.

content: 13 Thy name, O Jehovah, is for ever; thy memorial, O Jehovah, from generation to generation.
content_old: 13 Thy name, O Jehovah, is for ever; thy memorial, O Jehovah, from generation to generation.

content: 14 For Jehovah will judge his people, and will repent in favour of his servants.
content_old: 14 For Jehovah will judge his people, and will repent in favour of his servants.

content: 15 The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands:
content_old: 15 The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands:

content: 16 They have a mouth, and they speak not; eyes have they, and they see not;
content_old: 16 They have a mouth, and they speak not; eyes have they, and they see not;

content: 17 They have ears, and they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouth.
content_old: 17 They have ears, and they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouth.

content: 18 They that make them are like unto them, —every one that confideth in them.
content_old: 18 They that make them are like unto them, —every one that confideth in them.

content: 19 House of Israel, bless ye Jehovah; house of Aaron, bless ye Jehovah;
content_old: 19 House of Israel, bless ye Jehovah; house of Aaron, bless ye Jehovah;

content: 20 House of Levi, bless ye Jehovah; ye that fear Jehovah, bless Jehovah.
content_old: 20 House of Levi, bless ye Jehovah; ye that fear Jehovah, bless Jehovah.

content: 1 Give ye thanks unto Jehovah, for he is good; for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:
content_old: 1 Give ye thanks unto Jehovah, for he is good; for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:

content: 2 Give thanks unto the God of gods, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 2 Give thanks unto the God of gods, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 3 Give thanks unto the Lord of lords, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.
content_old: 3 Give thanks unto the Lord of lords, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.

content: 4 To him who alone doeth great wonders, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:
content_old: 4 To him who alone doeth great wonders, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:

content: 5 To him that by understanding made the heavens, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 5 To him that by understanding made the heavens, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 6 To him that stretched out the earth above the waters, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 6 To him that stretched out the earth above the waters, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 7 To him that made great lights, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 7 To him that made great lights, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 8 The sun for rule over the day, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,
content_old: 8 The sun for rule over the day, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,

content: 9 The moon and stars for rule over the night, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:
content_old: 9 The moon and stars for rule over the night, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:

content: 10 To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,
content_old: 10 To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,

content: 11 And brought out Israel from among them, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,
content_old: 11 And brought out Israel from among them, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,

content: 12 With a powerful hand and with a stretched-out arm, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 12 With a powerful hand and with a stretched-out arm, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 13 To him that divided the Red sea into parts, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,
content_old: 13 To him that divided the Red sea into parts, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,

content: 14 And made Israel to pass through the midst of it, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,
content_old: 14 And made Israel to pass through the midst of it, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,

content: 15 And overturned Pharaoh and his host in the Red sea, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 15 And overturned Pharaoh and his host in the Red sea, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 16 To him that led his people through the wilderness, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 16 To him that led his people through the wilderness, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 17 To him that smote great kings, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,
content_old: 17 To him that smote great kings, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,

content: 18 And slew famous kings, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 18 And slew famous kings, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 19 Sihon king of the Amorites, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,
content_old: 19 Sihon king of the Amorites, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,

content: 20 And Og king of Bashan, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 20 And Og king of Bashan, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 21 And gave their land for an inheritance, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,
content_old: 21 And gave their land for an inheritance, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever,

content: 22 An inheritance unto Israel his servant, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:
content_old: 22 An inheritance unto Israel his servant, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:

content: 23 Who hath remembered us in our low estate, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;
content_old: 23 Who hath remembered us in our low estate, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever;

content: 24 And hath delivered us from our oppressors, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:
content_old: 24 And hath delivered us from our oppressors, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever:

content: 25 Who giveth food to all flesh, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.
content_old: 25 Who giveth food to all flesh, for his loving-kindness endureth for ever.

content: 1 By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down; yea, we wept when we remembered Zion.
content_old: 1 By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down; yea, we wept when we remembered Zion.

content: 2 We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
content_old: 2 We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.

content: 3 For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that made us wail required mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
content_old: 3 For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that made us wail required mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

content: 4 How should we sing a song of Jehovah’s upon a foreign soil?
content_old: 4 How should we sing a song of Jehovah’s upon a foreign soil?

content: 5 If I forget thee, Jerusalem, let my right hand forget its skill;
content_old: 5 If I forget thee, Jerusalem, let my right hand forget its skill;

content: 6 If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to my palate: if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
content_old: 6 If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to my palate: if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.

content: 7 Remember, O Jehovah, against the sons of Edom, the day of Jerusalem; who said, Lay it bare, Lay it bare, down to its foundation!
content_old: 7 Remember, O Jehovah, against the sons of Edom, the day of Jerusalem; who said, Lay it bare, Lay it bare, down to its foundation!

content: 8 Daughter of Babylon, who art to be laid waste, happy he that rendereth unto thee that which thou hast meted out to us.
content_old: 8 Daughter of Babylon, who art to be laid waste, happy he that rendereth unto thee that which thou hast meted out to us.

content: A Psalm of David.
content_old: A Psalm of David.

content: 1 I will give thee thanks with my whole heart; before the gods will I sing psalms of thee.
content_old: 1 I will give thee thanks with my whole heart; before the gods will I sing psalms of thee.

content: 2 I will bow down toward the temple of thy holiness, and celebrate thy name for thy loving-kindness and for thy truth; for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.
content_old: 2 I will bow down toward the temple of thy holiness, and celebrate thy name for thy loving-kindness and for thy truth; for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.

content: 3 In the day when I called thou answeredst me; thou didst encourage me with strength in my soul.
content_old: 3 In the day when I called thou answeredst me; thou didst encourage me with strength in my soul.

content: 4 All the kings of the earth shall celebrate thee, Jehovah, when they have heard the words of thy mouth;
content_old: 4 All the kings of the earth shall celebrate thee, Jehovah, when they have heard the words of thy mouth;

content: 5 And they shall sing in the ways of Jehovah, for great is the glory of Jehovah.
content_old: 5 And they shall sing in the ways of Jehovah, for great is the glory of Jehovah.

content: 6 For Jehovah is high; but he looketh upon the lowly, and the proud he knoweth afar off.
content_old: 6 For Jehovah is high; but he looketh upon the lowly, and the proud he knoweth afar off.

content: 7 Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou wilt stretch forth thy hand against the anger of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
content_old: 7 Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou wilt stretch forth thy hand against the anger of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

content: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Jehovah, thou hast searched me, and known me.
content_old: 1 Jehovah, thou hast searched me, and known me.

content: 2 Thou knowest my down-sitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off;
content_old: 2 Thou knowest my down-sitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off;

content: 3 Thou searchest out my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways;
content_old: 3 Thou searchest out my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways;

content: 4 For there is not yet a word on my tongue, but lo, O Jehovah, thou knowest it altogether.
content_old: 4 For there is not yet a word on my tongue, but lo, O Jehovah, thou knowest it altogether.

content: 5 Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thy hand upon me.
content_old: 5 Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thy hand upon me.

content: 6 O knowledge too wonderful for me! it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
content_old: 6 O knowledge too wonderful for me! it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

content: 7 Whither shall I go from thy Spirit? and whither flee from thy presence?
content_old: 7 Whither shall I go from thy Spirit? and whither flee from thy presence?

content: 8 If I ascend up into the heavens thou art there; or if I make my bed in Sheol, behold, thou art there;
content_old: 8 If I ascend up into the heavens thou art there; or if I make my bed in Sheol, behold, thou art there;

content: 9 If I take the wings of the dawn and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
content_old: 9 If I take the wings of the dawn and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,

content: 10 Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
content_old: 10 Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

content: 11 And if I say, Surely darkness shall cover me, and the light about me be night;
content_old: 11 And if I say, Surely darkness shall cover me, and the light about me be night;

content: 12 Even darkness hideth not from thee, and the night shineth as the day: the darkness is as the light.
content_old: 12 Even darkness hideth not from thee, and the night shineth as the day: the darkness is as the light.

content: 13 For thou hast possessed my reins; thou didst cover me in my mother’s womb.
content_old: 13 For thou hast possessed my reins; thou didst cover me in my mother’s womb.

content: 14 I will praise thee, for I am fearfully, wonderfully made. Marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.
content_old: 14 I will praise thee, for I am fearfully, wonderfully made. Marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

content: 15 My bones were not hidden from thee when I was made in secret, curiously wrought in the lower parts of the earth.
content_old: 15 My bones were not hidden from thee when I was made in secret, curiously wrought in the lower parts of the earth.

content: 16 Thine eyes did see my unformed substance, and in thy book all my members were written; during many days were they fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.
content_old: 16 Thine eyes did see my unformed substance, and in thy book all my members were written; during many days were they fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

content: 17 But how precious are thy thoughts unto me, O •God! how great is the sum of them!
content_old: 17 But how precious are thy thoughts unto me, O •God! how great is the sum of them!

content: 18 If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand. When I awake, I am still with thee.
content_old: 18 If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand. When I awake, I am still with thee.

content: 19 Oh that thou wouldest slay the wicked, O †God! And ye men of blood, depart from me.
content_old: 19 Oh that thou wouldest slay the wicked, O †God! And ye men of blood, depart from me.

content: 20 For they speak of thee wickedly, they take thy name in vain, thine enemies.
content_old: 20 For they speak of thee wickedly, they take thy name in vain, thine enemies.

content: 21 Do not I hate them, O Jehovah, that hate thee? and do not I loathe them that rise up against thee?
content_old: 21 Do not I hate them, O Jehovah, that hate thee? and do not I loathe them that rise up against thee?

content: 22 I hate them with perfect hatred; I account them mine enemies.
content_old: 22 I hate them with perfect hatred; I account them mine enemies.

content: 23 Search me, O •God, and know my heart; prove me, and know my thoughts;
content_old: 23 Search me, O •God, and know my heart; prove me, and know my thoughts;

content: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
content_old: To the chief Musician. A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Free me, O Jehovah, from the evil man; preserve me from the violent man:
content_old: 1 Free me, O Jehovah, from the evil man; preserve me from the violent man:

content: 2 Who devise mischiefs in their heart; every day are they banded together for war.
content_old: 2 Who devise mischiefs in their heart; every day are they banded together for war.

content: 3 They sharpen their tongues like a serpent; adders’ poison is under their lips. Selah.
content_old: 3 They sharpen their tongues like a serpent; adders’ poison is under their lips. Selah.

content: 4 Keep me, O Jehovah, from the hands of the wicked man, preserve me from the violent man, who devise to overthrow my steps.
content_old: 4 Keep me, O Jehovah, from the hands of the wicked man, preserve me from the violent man, who devise to overthrow my steps.

content: 5 The proud have hidden a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the way-side; they have set traps for me. Selah.
content_old: 5 The proud have hidden a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the way-side; they have set traps for me. Selah.

content: 6 I have said unto Jehovah, Thou art my •God: give ear, O Jehovah, to the voice of my supplications.
content_old: 6 I have said unto Jehovah, Thou art my •God: give ear, O Jehovah, to the voice of my supplications.

content: 7 Jehovah, the Lord, is the strength of my salvation: thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.
content_old: 7 Jehovah, the Lord, is the strength of my salvation: thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.

content: 8 Grant not, O Jehovah, the desire of the wicked; further not his device: they would exalt themselves. Selah.
content_old: 8 Grant not, O Jehovah, the desire of the wicked; further not his device: they would exalt themselves. Selah.

content: 9 As for the head of those that encompass me, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
content_old: 9 As for the head of those that encompass me, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

content: 10 Let burning coals fall on them; let them be cast into the fire; into deep waters, that they rise not up again.
content_old: 10 Let burning coals fall on them; let them be cast into the fire; into deep waters, that they rise not up again.

content: 11 Let not the man of evil tongue be established in the earth: evil shall hunt the man of violence to his ruin.
content_old: 11 Let not the man of evil tongue be established in the earth: evil shall hunt the man of violence to his ruin.

content: 12 I know that Jehovah will maintain the cause of the afflicted one, the right of the needy.
content_old: 12 I know that Jehovah will maintain the cause of the afflicted one, the right of the needy.

content: A Psalm of David.
content_old: A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Jehovah, I have called upon thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I call unto thee.
content_old: 1 Jehovah, I have called upon thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I call unto thee.

content: 2 Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense, the lifting up of my hands as the evening oblation.
content_old: 2 Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense, the lifting up of my hands as the evening oblation.

content: 3 Set a watch, O Jehovah, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
content_old: 3 Set a watch, O Jehovah, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.

content: 4 Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise deeds of wickedness with men that are workers of iniquity; and let me not eat of their dainties.
content_old: 4 Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise deeds of wickedness with men that are workers of iniquity; and let me not eat of their dainties.

content: 5 Let the righteous smite me, it is kindness; and let him reprove me, it is an excellent oil which my head shall not refuse: for yet my prayer also is for them in their calamities.
content_old: 5 Let the righteous smite me, it is kindness; and let him reprove me, it is an excellent oil which my head shall not refuse: for yet my prayer also is for them in their calamities.

content: 6 When their judges are thrown down from the rocks, they shall hear my words, for they are sweet.
content_old: 6 When their judges are thrown down from the rocks, they shall hear my words, for they are sweet.

content: 7 Our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.
content_old: 7 Our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.

content: 8 For unto thee, Jehovah, Lord, are mine eyes; in thee do I trust: leave not my soul destitute.
content_old: 8 For unto thee, Jehovah, Lord, are mine eyes; in thee do I trust: leave not my soul destitute.

content: 9 Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, and from the traps of the workers of iniquity.
content_old: 9 Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, and from the traps of the workers of iniquity.

content: An instruction of David; when he was in the cave: a prayer.
content_old: An instruction of David; when he was in the cave: a prayer.

content: 1 I cry unto Jehovah with my voice: with my voice unto Jehovah do I make supplication.
content_old: 1 I cry unto Jehovah with my voice: with my voice unto Jehovah do I make supplication.

content: 2 I pour out my plaint before him; I shew before him my trouble.
content_old: 2 I pour out my plaint before him; I shew before him my trouble.

content: 3 When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they hidden a snare for me.
content_old: 3 When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they hidden a snare for me.

content: 4 Look on the right hand and see; there is no man that knoweth me: refuge hath failed me; no man careth for my soul.
content_old: 4 Look on the right hand and see; there is no man that knoweth me: refuge hath failed me; no man careth for my soul.

content: 5 I cried unto thee, Jehovah; I said, Thou art my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.
content_old: 5 I cried unto thee, Jehovah; I said, Thou art my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.

content: 6 Attend unto my cry, for I am brought very low; deliver me from my persecutors, for they are stronger than I.
content_old: 6 Attend unto my cry, for I am brought very low; deliver me from my persecutors, for they are stronger than I.

content: A Psalm of David.
content_old: A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Jehovah, hear my prayer; give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, in thy righteousness.
content_old: 1 Jehovah, hear my prayer; give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, in thy righteousness.

content: 2 And enter not into judgment with thy servant; for in thy sight no man living shall be justified.
content_old: 2 And enter not into judgment with thy servant; for in thy sight no man living shall be justified.

content: 3 For the enemy persecuteth my soul: he hath crushed my life down to the earth; he hath made me to dwell in dark places, as those that have been long dead.
content_old: 3 For the enemy persecuteth my soul: he hath crushed my life down to the earth; he hath made me to dwell in dark places, as those that have been long dead.

content: 4 And my spirit is overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.
content_old: 4 And my spirit is overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.

content: 5 I remember the days of old: I meditate on all thy doing; I muse on the work of thy hands.
content_old: 5 I remember the days of old: I meditate on all thy doing; I muse on the work of thy hands.

content: 6 I stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul, as a parched land, thirsteth after thee. Selah.
content_old: 6 I stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul, as a parched land, thirsteth after thee. Selah.

content: 7 Answer me speedily, O Jehovah; my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, or I shall be like unto them that go down into the pit.
content_old: 7 Answer me speedily, O Jehovah; my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, or I shall be like unto them that go down into the pit.

content: 8 Cause me to hear thy loving-kindness in the morning, for in thee do I confide; make me to know the way wherein I should walk, for unto thee do I lift up my soul.
content_old: 8 Cause me to hear thy loving-kindness in the morning, for in thee do I confide; make me to know the way wherein I should walk, for unto thee do I lift up my soul.

content: 9 Deliver me, O Jehovah, from mine enemies: unto thee do I flee for refuge.
content_old: 9 Deliver me, O Jehovah, from mine enemies: unto thee do I flee for refuge.

content: 10 Teach me to do thy will; for thou art my God: let thy good Spirit lead me in a plain country.
content_old: 10 Teach me to do thy will; for thou art my God: let thy good Spirit lead me in a plain country.

content: 11 Revive me, O Jehovah, for thy name’s sake; in thy righteousness bring my soul out of trouble;
content_old: 11 Revive me, O Jehovah, for thy name’s sake; in thy righteousness bring my soul out of trouble;

content: A Psalm of David.
content_old: A Psalm of David.

content: 1 Blessed be Jehovah my rock, who teacheth my hands to war, my fingers to fight;
content_old: 1 Blessed be Jehovah my rock, who teacheth my hands to war, my fingers to fight;

content: 2 My mercy and my fortress, my high tower and my deliverer, my shield and he in whom I trust, who subdueth my people under me!
content_old: 2 My mercy and my fortress, my high tower and my deliverer, my shield and he in whom I trust, who subdueth my people under me!

content: 3 Jehovah, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him, the son of man, that thou takest thought of him?
content_old: 3 Jehovah, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him, the son of man, that thou takest thought of him?

content: 4 Man is like to vanity; his days are as a shadow that passeth away.
content_old: 4 Man is like to vanity; his days are as a shadow that passeth away.

content: 5 Jehovah, bow thy heavens, and come down; touch the mountains, that they smoke;
content_old: 5 Jehovah, bow thy heavens, and come down; touch the mountains, that they smoke;

content: 6 Cast forth lightnings, and scatter them; send forth thine arrows, and discomfit them:
content_old: 6 Cast forth lightnings, and scatter them; send forth thine arrows, and discomfit them:

content: 7 Stretch out thy hands from above; rescue me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of aliens,
content_old: 7 Stretch out thy hands from above; rescue me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of aliens,

content: 8 Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
content_old: 8 Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

content: 9 O God, I will sing a new song unto thee; with the ten-stringed lute will I sing psalms unto thee:
content_old: 9 O God, I will sing a new song unto thee; with the ten-stringed lute will I sing psalms unto thee:

content: 10 Who givest salvation unto kings; who rescuest David thy servant from the hurtful sword.
content_old: 10 Who givest salvation unto kings; who rescuest David thy servant from the hurtful sword.

content: 11 Rescue me, and deliver me from the hand of aliens, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
content_old: 11 Rescue me, and deliver me from the hand of aliens, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

content: 12 That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; our daughters as corner-columns, sculptured after the fashion of a palace:
content_old: 12 That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; our daughters as corner-columns, sculptured after the fashion of a palace:

content: 13 Our granaries full, affording all manner of store; our sheep bringing forth thousands, ten thousands in our pastures;
content_old: 13 Our granaries full, affording all manner of store; our sheep bringing forth thousands, ten thousands in our pastures;

content: 14 Our kine laden with young; no breaking in and no going forth, and no outcry in our streets.
content_old: 14 Our kine laden with young; no breaking in and no going forth, and no outcry in our streets.

content: A Psalm of praise. Of David.
content_old: A Psalm of praise. Of David.

content: 1 I will extol thee, my God, O King, and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.
content_old: 1 I will extol thee, my God, O King, and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.

content: 2 Every day will I bless thee, and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.
content_old: 2 Every day will I bless thee, and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.

content: 3 Great is Jehovah, and exceedingly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.
content_old: 3 Great is Jehovah, and exceedingly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.

content: 4 One generation shall laud thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.
content_old: 4 One generation shall laud thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.

content: 5 I will speak of the glorious splendour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.
content_old: 5 I will speak of the glorious splendour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.

content: 6 And they shall tell of the might of thy terrible acts; and thy great deeds will I declare.
content_old: 6 And they shall tell of the might of thy terrible acts; and thy great deeds will I declare.

content: 7 They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, and shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
content_old: 7 They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, and shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.

content: 8 Jehovah is gracious and merciful; slow to anger, and of great loving-kindness.
content_old: 8 Jehovah is gracious and merciful; slow to anger, and of great loving-kindness.

content: 9 Jehovah is good to all; and his tender mercies are over all his works.
content_old: 9 Jehovah is good to all; and his tender mercies are over all his works.

content: 10 All thy works shall praise thee, Jehovah, and thy saints shall bless thee.
content_old: 10 All thy works shall praise thee, Jehovah, and thy saints shall bless thee.

content: 11 They shall tell of the glory of thy kingdom, and speak of thy power;
content_old: 11 They shall tell of the glory of thy kingdom, and speak of thy power;

content: 12 To make known to the children of men his mighty acts, and the glorious splendour of his kingdom.
content_old: 12 To make known to the children of men his mighty acts, and the glorious splendour of his kingdom.

content: 13 Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages, and thy dominion is throughout all generations.
content_old: 13 Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages, and thy dominion is throughout all generations.

content: 14 Jehovah upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all that are bowed down.
content_old: 14 Jehovah upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all that are bowed down.

content: 15 The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their food in its season.
content_old: 15 The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their food in its season.

content: 16 Thou openest thy hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.
content_old: 16 Thou openest thy hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.

content: 17 Jehovah is righteous in all his ways, and kind in all his works.
content_old: 17 Jehovah is righteous in all his ways, and kind in all his works.

content: 18 Jehovah is nigh unto all that call upon him, unto all that call upon him in truth.
content_old: 18 Jehovah is nigh unto all that call upon him, unto all that call upon him in truth.

content: 19 He fulfilleth the desire of them that fear him; he heareth their cry, and saveth them.
content_old: 19 He fulfilleth the desire of them that fear him; he heareth their cry, and saveth them.

content: 20 Jehovah keepeth all that love him, and all the wicked will he destroy.
content_old: 20 Jehovah keepeth all that love him, and all the wicked will he destroy.

content: 1 Hallelujah! Praise Jehovah, O my soul.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah! Praise Jehovah, O my soul.

content: 2 As long as I live will I praise Jehovah; I will sing psalms unto my God while I have my being.
content_old: 2 As long as I live will I praise Jehovah; I will sing psalms unto my God while I have my being.

content: 3 Put not confidence in nobles, in a son of man, in whom there is no salvation.
content_old: 3 Put not confidence in nobles, in a son of man, in whom there is no salvation.

content: 4 His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his purposes perish.
content_old: 4 His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his purposes perish.

content: 5 Blessed is he who hath the •God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in Jehovah his God,
content_old: 5 Blessed is he who hath the •God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in Jehovah his God,

content: 6 Who made the heavens and the earth, the sea and all that is therein; who keepeth truth for ever;
content_old: 6 Who made the heavens and the earth, the sea and all that is therein; who keepeth truth for ever;

content: 7 Who executeth judgment for the oppressed, who giveth bread to the hungry. Jehovah looseth the prisoners;
content_old: 7 Who executeth judgment for the oppressed, who giveth bread to the hungry. Jehovah looseth the prisoners;

content: 8 Jehovah openeth the eyes of the blind; Jehovah raiseth up them that are bowed down; Jehovah loveth the righteous;
content_old: 8 Jehovah openeth the eyes of the blind; Jehovah raiseth up them that are bowed down; Jehovah loveth the righteous;

content: 9 Jehovah preserveth the strangers; he lifteth up the fatherless and the widow; but the way of the wicked doth he subvert.
content_old: 9 Jehovah preserveth the strangers; he lifteth up the fatherless and the widow; but the way of the wicked doth he subvert.

content: 1 Praise ye Jah! for it is good. Sing psalms of our God; for it is pleasant: praise is comely.
content_old: 1 Praise ye Jah! for it is good. Sing psalms of our God; for it is pleasant: praise is comely.

content: 2 Jehovah doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth the outcasts of Israel.
content_old: 2 Jehovah doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth the outcasts of Israel.

content: 3 He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.
content_old: 3 He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

content: 4 He counteth the number of the stars; he giveth names to them all.
content_old: 4 He counteth the number of the stars; he giveth names to them all.

content: 5 Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.
content_old: 5 Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.

content: 6 Jehovah lifteth up the meek; he abaseth the wicked to the earth.
content_old: 6 Jehovah lifteth up the meek; he abaseth the wicked to the earth.

content: 7 Sing unto Jehovah with thanksgiving; sing psalms upon the harp unto our God:
content_old: 7 Sing unto Jehovah with thanksgiving; sing psalms upon the harp unto our God:

content: 8 Who covereth the heavens with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains;
content_old: 8 Who covereth the heavens with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains;

content: 9 Who giveth to the cattle their food, to the young ravens which cry.
content_old: 9 Who giveth to the cattle their food, to the young ravens which cry.

content: 10 He delighteth not in the strength of the horse, he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man;
content_old: 10 He delighteth not in the strength of the horse, he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man;

content: 11 Jehovah taketh pleasure in those that fear him, in those that hope in his loving-kindness.
content_old: 11 Jehovah taketh pleasure in those that fear him, in those that hope in his loving-kindness.

content: 12 Laud Jehovah, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.
content_old: 12 Laud Jehovah, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.

content: 13 For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee;
content_old: 13 For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee;

content: 14 He maketh peace in thy borders; he satisfieth thee with the finest of the wheat.
content_old: 14 He maketh peace in thy borders; he satisfieth thee with the finest of the wheat.

content: 15 He sendeth forth his oracles to the earth: his word runneth very swiftly.
content_old: 15 He sendeth forth his oracles to the earth: his word runneth very swiftly.

content: 16 He giveth snow like wool, scattereth the hoar frost like ashes;
content_old: 16 He giveth snow like wool, scattereth the hoar frost like ashes;

content: 17 He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?
content_old: 17 He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?

content: 18 He sendeth his word, and melteth them; he causeth his wind to blow—the waters flow.
content_old: 18 He sendeth his word, and melteth them; he causeth his wind to blow—the waters flow.

content: 19 He sheweth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.
content_old: 19 He sheweth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.

content: 1 Hallelujah! Praise Jehovah from the heavens; praise him in the heights.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah! Praise Jehovah from the heavens; praise him in the heights.

content: 2 Praise ye him, all his angels; praise ye him, all his hosts.
content_old: 2 Praise ye him, all his angels; praise ye him, all his hosts.

content: 3 Praise him, sun and moon; praise him, all ye stars of light.
content_old: 3 Praise him, sun and moon; praise him, all ye stars of light.

content: 4 Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that are above the heavens.
content_old: 4 Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that are above the heavens.

content: 5 Let them praise the name of Jehovah, for he it is that commanded, and they were created:
content_old: 5 Let them praise the name of Jehovah, for he it is that commanded, and they were created:

content: 6 And he established them for ever and ever; he made for them a statute which shall not pass.
content_old: 6 And he established them for ever and ever; he made for them a statute which shall not pass.

content: 7 Praise Jehovah from the earth, ye sea-monsters, and all deeps;
content_old: 7 Praise Jehovah from the earth, ye sea-monsters, and all deeps;

content: 8 Fire and hail, snow and vapour, stormy wind fulfilling his word;
content_old: 8 Fire and hail, snow and vapour, stormy wind fulfilling his word;

content: 9 Mountains and all hills, fruit-trees and all cedars;
content_old: 9 Mountains and all hills, fruit-trees and all cedars;

content: 10 Beasts and all cattle, creeping things and winged fowl;
content_old: 10 Beasts and all cattle, creeping things and winged fowl;

content: 11 Kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all judges of the earth;
content_old: 11 Kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all judges of the earth;

content: 12 Both young men and maidens, old men with youths, —
content_old: 12 Both young men and maidens, old men with youths, —

content: 13 Let them praise the name of Jehovah: for his name alone is exalted; his majesty is above the earth and the heavens.
content_old: 13 Let them praise the name of Jehovah: for his name alone is exalted; his majesty is above the earth and the heavens.

content: 1 Hallelujah! Sing unto Jehovah a new song; sing his praise in the congregation of the godly.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah! Sing unto Jehovah a new song; sing his praise in the congregation of the godly.

content: 2 Let Israel rejoice in his Maker; let the sons of Zion be joyful in their King.
content_old: 2 Let Israel rejoice in his Maker; let the sons of Zion be joyful in their King.

content: 3 Let them praise his name in the dance; let them sing psalms unto him with the tambour and harp.
content_old: 3 Let them praise his name in the dance; let them sing psalms unto him with the tambour and harp.

content: 4 For Jehovah taketh pleasure in his people; he beautifieth the meek with salvation.
content_old: 4 For Jehovah taketh pleasure in his people; he beautifieth the meek with salvation.

content: 5 Let the godly exult in glory; let them shout for joy upon their beds.
content_old: 5 Let the godly exult in glory; let them shout for joy upon their beds.

content: 6 Let the high praises of •God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand:
content_old: 6 Let the high praises of •God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand:

content: 7 To execute vengeance against the nations, and punishment among the peoples;
content_old: 7 To execute vengeance against the nations, and punishment among the peoples;

content: 8 To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;
content_old: 8 To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;

content: 1 Hallelujah! Praise •God in his sanctuary; praise him in the firmament of his power.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah! Praise •God in his sanctuary; praise him in the firmament of his power.

content: 2 Praise him in his mighty acts; praise him according to the abundance of his greatness.
content_old: 2 Praise him in his mighty acts; praise him according to the abundance of his greatness.

content: 3 Praise him with the sound of the trumpet; praise him with lute and harp;
content_old: 3 Praise him with the sound of the trumpet; praise him with lute and harp;

content: 4 Praise him with the tambour and dance; praise him with stringed instruments and the pipe;
content_old: 4 Praise him with the tambour and dance; praise him with stringed instruments and the pipe;

content: 5 Praise him with loud cymbals; praise him with high sounding cymbals.
content_old: 5 Praise him with loud cymbals; praise him with high sounding cymbals.
